Great common room with plenty of space. Enough to have multiple couches and still have room for our 4 desks. Bedrooms are small but you can debunk. Bathroom is 2 floors down, that's the only downside.
Real solid room. Good  call.
Beautiful view, huge, nicely placed windows, big closet. Bathroom is in the basement but not a big deal.

This room was one of the last rooms left in Bloomberg, but is definitely much better than you would expect for that. The lighting in the room is not great because of fewer windows. It shares a wall with the men's bathroom and hence, you might need to get used to that. But, otherwise fantastic room since it is Bloomberg afterall

This room was really fine. I had it after it was converted into a double so it was a little tight, definitely smaller than most of my friend's rooms but we made it work. I would avoid overcrowding and definitely put the beds closer to the windows to achieve max space. I love the annex, do not let the haters get you down.

summary: Lots of space, lots of light, occasionally loud
content: Since this room lies on the corner of Forbes, it has windows on two walls, which allows for quite a lot of natural illumination. It's a fairly large room as well, and the usual Forbes private bathroom amenities are nice. The only discernible drawback to this room is that, since it's located next to a door leading out of Forbes, one will sporadically hear groups of people noisily enter and leave. But that's not too bad.
Four large, relatively equal sized rooms + a bathroom. Hallway is a little bit awkwardly wide but not wide enough for anything substantial to sit there. Very far from engineering stuff though.

I lived in 733 as a junior and really loved the room. It was a good size and a good location. Moving in was a bit rough with being on the third floor, but not a deal breaker. The one downside is that the built-in closet takes up some of the square footage BUT it has a door and honestly makes the dorm more like a bedroom; the room had more character, since it wasn't just an open square and it ultimately made decorating easier. One bathroom across the hall and another just around the corner.

Configured like a double and a single connected by a hallway. VERY nice room -- at the base of the tower, so the double is very nice and open. Highly recommend configuring the room like a bedroom + common room -- fit all of the beds into the single, and then you have a HUGE common room outside that looks over the junior slums/U-store courtyard. It's really nice. Some noise from the junior slums can be heard at night, depending on how much partying is going on. The walkway is right next to the dorm, too, so you do hear noise that way, but we didn't feel it bothered us too much. 

Laundry is directly downstairs, and bathrooms (both genders) are upstairs and down the hall. Little basement (including study room and kitchen) Are also directly downstairs -- very convenient location within Little and on campus. We haven't had bug problems either. 

Downsides: for some reason, the single got really hot at night during this past winter, and fiddling with the thermostat didn't help, so we had to leave the door open at night.

Definitely one of the best current triple options in Mathey. Used to be a quad apparently which wouldn't be awful, but as a triple has one big single and a debunked double w two desks in the common room and space for couch/chairs/whatever. No bugs, closets are dark and kind of small

Very cozy double. You can unbunk the beds but this leaves very little room for you to use your desks. We had a small beanbag, there wasn't enough room for a couch. Basically just used the room for sleeping and roommate hanging out.

We were at the bottom of junior draw so we were expecting an awful room, but actually this room was great. Yes, the awkward hallway takes up a chunk of square footage but the hooks that line it make for good coat/towel/umbrella storage and we were able to fit two narrow shoe racks. The common room was large enough for separate desk and hangout/couch areas, and we hosted plenty of pre games with tons of people so in that regard space is not an issue. Both bedrooms are small and both get a lot of noise from University Place traffic. The balcony is HUGE AND AWESOME and if you don't use it you're wasting the room. Boys bathroom is down the hall and girls bathroom is one floor below.

I liked living here. The common room is big and has a nice window bench and a great view of Holder courtyard. There are men's and women's bathrooms right down the hall and a printer and study room right downstairs in 4B. The laundry room is further away but no big deal. And the dining hall is super close which is key. The bedrooms are both very small so debunking is not an option. One bedroom — the one closest to the door — is noticeably smaller than the other. That wasn't much of an issue for us because we basically were only in the bedrooms when we were sleeping. Holder is kind of inconveniently located from almost everything else on campus which can be a drag sometimes.

Great size and huge closet. Great location on campus and laundry and water fountain in the basement. There was a bit of an ant problem while I was there but I think it had more to do with the boys down the hall than the building itself. I loved living in this room.

triples generally suck and this one isn't an exception. while the common room is nice and spacious the double and single are pretty much the same size and would probably be impossible in terms of debunking. it's on the first floor overlooking the quad and therefore gets extremely loud on the weekends and allows the common room no privacy. also there is a bit of a bug problem...not the worst triple but definitely not the best.

Getting this dorm as a freshman confirmed all the expectations I had about living in Princeton. It's got a fireplace (which, of course, can't be used but still looks hella classy) and a bay window. There are two closets and, if you get creative with the placement of your dressers, the bedroom has enough space for debunking. The windows face the Mathey Common Room, so if somebody's playing the piano in there you can hear it. The only drawbacks about 65, I'd say, are that it can get pretty chilly sometimes and the lighting isn't the best, especially in the bedroom.

This room is wonderful! It is extremely spacious, and it has two relatively big walk-in closets. The women's restroom and the men's restroom are both located on this floor. The only drawbacks are the lack of air conditioning and the fact that there aren't enough windows to light up the entire room properly (if you look at the floor plan, you will see that there are only two mulled windows). It only gets really warm during the first two weeks of school, and the last few weeks of the spring semester, so the lack of air conditioning will not be felt that much at all. There are no elevators in Lockhart. The kitchen and the laundry room are located on the ground floor. There is a printer in Foulke Hall, which is right next to Lockhart Hall, so you will have to exit the building in order to get to the printer. The location is great as well : the U-store is right outside the building, and Nassau Street is also very close.

This room has great light, really tall ~8-9 ft. ceilings, and huge windows! Although it is listed as a basement floor, you enter at ground level and walk up a half set of stairs to get to the room. It is set up as three singles with foyer in between so you will each have a private space. The foyer is a great place to put a coat rack and Christmas tree in the winter. The two side rooms are triangular in shape, but the furniture fits perfectly and there is still plenty of room. The only downsides are the smaller size of the middle room and the proximity to the dumpsters outside. Basement laundry, water fountain, full kitchen, and common room directly below. Elevator next door. I highly highly highly recommend this room.

I was top 5 draw time in Butler, and I chose this quad because it's in a sophomore-full hall (connection w/ 67 means lots of rooms to pop into) and because it has pretty phenomenal evening light (holy shit it's gorgeous). It's also a bubble room so obviously really spacey.
The view is phenomenal, the room is spacious, laundry and elevator in the hallway, common room and dining hall downstairs, huge for a single.

If you want a double in Scully, this is the one! It's quiet, and both rooms have two windows, which is unheard of in Scully. The half-bathroom system with a common area is sweet. It's near the elevator, printer, and laundry, and has easy access to the kitchen. It's on the same floor as the TV lounge and there are tons of study spaces. Plus, air conditioning!

I really like this room! Upsides: spacious. Nice big closet. Someone's painted glow-in-the-dark stars on the ceiling and I kind of like them. Thin walls facilitate eavesdropping on 232 and 234. 

Downsides: tremendous view of the Business Today office at 48 University Place. You can see in the review below that BT always left their lights on in 2006 and they've carried on the tradition into 2015. You can sometimes see the heads of people sitting at the desk in there, and then you have to wonder--can they see you too? If it bothers you, you can always go into 48 Uni late at night, get into the BT offices (password 1968), take a Hershey's Kiss, and flip the light switch--but it's kind of annoying to have to leave your room and do all that. The enterprising 233 resident might try to rig some remotely-controlled thing, like buy something where you can point across the way and press a button and have the light go out, but I never got around to it. 

Other downsides: lots of stairs. Climbing up, climbing down. Good luck getting a futon up here, man! Also, it can get hot, but then you just open a window. 

I really like this room, though.

This room is a pretty good frosh year double. It's spacious, has a private bathroom/good closet space, and a window overlooking the courtyard. Only downside is the thin windows which can make the room pretty drafty and the thin walls make it easy to hear people in the hallway, but those are typical Forbes problems.

Negatives: The closet is just a rack without a door. There is no fireplace or mantle, but the wall juts out like there used to be one. The radiator is taller than average and breaks frequently. I had to get a portable heater from facilities because they can't fix it when it's still cold outside. Once it started to warm up they fixed it and it broke again a few days later. There is a large gap under the door, so when the window is open and it is windy there is a whooshing sound. One wall is shared with the women's bathroom, and the doors on the stalls in there automatically slam shut, which you will hear at all hours of the day. To get to the men's bathroom you either have to go up one floor and across the building or go outside on the same floor. In general, the room is small and feels small.

Positive: If you're a girl the bathroom is right next door. It's on the first floor so you don't have any flights of stairs to go up. The laundry room is just three doors down so it's very convenient.

summary: Pretty small but location trumps all
content: A bit smaller than square footage implies because there are two pointless steps once you walk in where you can't really do anything with. Cannot fit desks in bedrooms. Desks more comfortably fit in common room. Once desks are in common room, you can probably fit a fridge or a chair (but most likely not both). More comfortable to bunk beds than debunk. No bathroom on the same floor but there is one directly below and above you. Printer cluster directly below you. Close proximity to u-store by going out basement entryways. Laundry is downstairs, down the hall. The dorm room is immediately to your left when you walk in through entryway 4...plus, it's Little so great location overall. But if doing work in common room, you can often hear the entryway door open and close every now and then, and since you're on the 1st floor, people can pretty easily see into your window, especially at night...just something to keep in mind. Generally not too noisy though, since there's only 3 rooms on your floor. Not too many public places to hangout/study. There's a bench table for 2-3 people immediately downstairs (where the printer is) and a few couches/a larger table to work at near the laundry room. Rated 4 mostly for convenience of amenities (laundry, printer, ustore, dillon gym, etc).

summary: Very nice room, but you'll definitely get exercise
content:
Don't know why people are talking about bats...
I lived in this room 13-14 and we didn't have any trouble with living creatures, except ants when one of my roommates left out food for a few days (which is common in Rocky).
Yes, it is quite a hike up to the fifth floor (move-in is terrible), but it is a really nice room, and there is an elevator to the third if you don't feel like the entire walk. If anything, I was in much better shape by the end of the year.
It's definitely quiet (your only neighbors are the floor below, and those rooms are usually too small for parties). It's also very spacious for a Rocky quad - there's room to de-bunk both beds if you want, and the common room has space for a couple couches. The staircase takes up a decent amount of space, but makes the room unique.
The main downside for me was that the girls bathroom is on the third floor (for guys it is on the fourth) which is a bit of a hike first thing in the morning.
Overall, I loved living in the tower, though I wouldn't say it is the best room on campus.

It's an ok room. Kinda small, but the building is great. Laundry on the same floor, trash as well. Both a tad bit far (trash room farther than laundry). It's pretty far (keeping in mind, I'm lazy) from the girls bathroom but close to the boy's. There's a study room on the same floor with a microwave and a boiling water tap. Kitchen right down stairs.

Not the best room on campus, but very standard for a freshman quad. The bedrooms are small (especially the left one) but the common room has enough space to fit a couple desks and a couch.
It gets really hot in the early fall/late spring due to the southern sun. It's really close to the girls bathroom (and fairly close to the guys). Buyers is a fairly quiet dorm, but this room is on one of the more social/connected hallways since it is on the second floor.

I loved this room so much!  It has a huge common room and a great layout - two of the bedrooms are smaller, but that just encourages you to spend more time in the great common room with your awesome suite mates! We all put our desks in the common room, as well as the extra bed as a couch (we only had seven people) - so it was perfect as a social hub, but you can go in your room as well for privacy or quiet!  Living in this room made all of us, who came in as freshman who didn't know each other, such good friends and we are all living together next year as well!!!

Literally one of the best rooms in Whitman! Huge single (used to be a double)! Two sets of furniture and I pushed the two beds together to make a king size bed. Thermostat works. Tree right in front of windows so it's a little dark at times because there is not much natural sunlight. I had space in this room to ride my scooter around in circles. Not far from an unlocked visitor's bathroom, and not all that far from the men's and women's restrooms either. In the south courtyard, so you can get to the dining hall without leaving the building on cold days. I hope for your sake that they don't convert this room back to a double.
Great room, good size and has air-conditioning.  One of the newest buildings so all of the rooms are really modern, clean, and nice.

summary: Solid room in generl, but tiny bedrooms
content:
The best setup for this room is probably with all the desks in the common room lined against the walls with a futon right below the windows. Makes for slightly small, but cozy common room to work/chill in. Biggest downside of this room is the small bedrooms, which you have to bunk. Even bunked, the bedrooms have very little room to walk around in. However, you only really need the bedrooms to sleep in, so this room is overall pretty solid.   

Beware of all the conversations you will accidentally eavesdrop on since the window directly opens to the path facing Brown/Prospect Garden on the way to Frist. They can be both amusing or annoying at times.
This room was home to an epic crew in 2012-13. Great people make a great room. We stacked a couple desks in the hallway nook and gave us a great set-up for the common room.

Bathroom upstairs is the only negative of this room. Great location if you like Dillon. No problems with the music from the gym ever. Big common room and the double is better just for sleeping. When you enter the room--to the left is best for the double and the room to the right is best for the single.

summary: Great Location, Great Room, Little small
content: This room is in a phenomenal location as it is down the hall from the bathroom and a minute walk to the Dining Hall. The only negative things is that the rooms can be cramped if you don't bunk beds. We got rid of one of the four desks so only one was in the common room but it was still tough. For one of the doubles, we could only keep one of the wardrobes in the room and the other needed to be in the common room. Privacy is also kind of tough, blinds need to be down for a lot of time.

summary: Excellent towards the end of the draw
content: This is a great room that is routinely chosen as one of the last few singles in Mathey.  There were three singles left when I drew and I ended up really pleased with the result.  It's in Little, which is a huge step up from Joline or Campbell , and has a thermostat and hardwood floors.  You are limited in how you can arrange the furniture, but I managed to fit a TV, a futon, and a fridge within the framework of the room.  High ceilings make the room feel a lot bigger than it is and there's a gorgeous window/skylight facing the Little courtyard.  This skylight opens up onto a roof that one might, if they were so inclined, clamber out onto and stargaze/relax with friends.  The only thing is that when it rains or snows if you forget to close the window it will make your desk/floor wet, depending on how you arrange the room

Nothing really special about this place—don't draw here if you are a sophomore.  Common room is sizeable but the rooms are a little cramped.  You can debunk if you want to.  Joline just isn't a great dorm.  You'll have better luck in Blair, Hamilton, or Little

This is true for all of Spelman, but just know it has very thin walls, an awkward layout, uneven heating, and a lack of AC. That said, I don't think this room in particular is any better or worse than others though.

The view isn't great, but who cares about that when you get a private bathroom? There's a really nice study room very close by and there's a convenient printer upstairs. You have to go upstairs for the laundry as well, but that's not much of a hassle. The A/C is amazing and noise from other people isn't a problem if people are considerate. The room is also conveniently located near Butler and Whitman dining halls and Bloomberg Arch is also a shuttle bus stop and prominent landmark, which is really handy. Even though Bloomberg isn't joined to the underground Butler complex, it's still a very nice place to live, with clean, modern architecture.

It's a cozy bit of space, so you'll probably want to stack your book shelf on your desk or something. My complaint isn't the room so much as the surroundings. Sometimes the court yard can be noisy, and my experience is that 1939 was always loud on the weekends and consistently smelled like beer. Also, you're next to the male bathroom, which is not fun. I would strongly suggest using a noise maker if you plan on sleeping.

Huge common room! Bedrooms are pretty small though-- we were not able to debunk. On the first floor, it's nice not to have to lug anything up the stairs, but we have to keep the blinds closed all the time so people can't see in a night.

Don't be fooled by the square footage, this room is GREAT. Although there is no room to deubunk in the bedrooms, the ceilings are so tall that it doesn't matter-- I was top bunk and could stand up on my bed. The ledges along the ceiling provide a ton of overhead storage space that prevent a lot of clutter.

I would say the only downside to this room is having to walk down for the bathroom - but you get used to that quickly! The laundry is in this entryway (6), which makes it very convenient. This is easily one of the biggest singles for underclassmen at Princeton!

This carpeted, New Wing room has plenty of space. We didn't even bother bunking the beds. It has a deceit walk-in closet space, and its own bathroom, so you only have to share with your roommate. The only disadvantage of this is that you have to clean your own bathroom. The wall's in the bathroom are not particularly attractive either. They are some shade of yellow. It looks better if you put in your own shower curtain though, instead of the boring, beige one that came with the room. The view from the window is not as good as the golf course, but it is better than the parking lot. It is the 30th largest double in non-Annex Forbes. Many of my Main Inn and Annex friends marveled at its size. It is also sub-free, which was a plus for me.

Everything's in great condition.  It's a corner room, so the common room is a lot bigger than that of the average quad.  The only downside sometimes is that being on the first floor in front of the dining halls gets annoying when you want to change/walk around in your underwear, but also want the shades up.

Pretty sure this room is always just for freshmen but whatever. Had the BEST freshman year in this dorm. You can either have 5 singles and 1 double or, as we did, use the room to the right of the bathroom as a common room and have 2 doubles. It's a kinda small space but great for pre-games. Fun, great locations nice views of gothic Walker + pretty flowers outside. Trash collection @ 10.30 am is REALLY loud. Gauss in general is kinda gross (old, no AC), as is most of Wilson. Also don't really interact with people outside of the suite.  Have a great year anyway !
Very large for a single. The view from the windows sucks and the valence leaks on occasion, but you can't beat the size and the single-ness.

Amazing room!  The four singles are all larger than any one person reasonably needs, and the common room is still not crowded with a couch, two armchairs, a futon, a fridge, and a TV on a cabinet. There's still room for activities extending from the hallway.  Proximity to the dining hall (no need to walk outside) is a nice plus, as well.  Laundry one floor up and printer (and another laundry room) in the basement.
It's huge for a double, but the lighting is awful, consider bringing a floor lamp. It's also farther than you think from the dhall and/or the laundry room etc.

Features:
Relatively spacious single
Two large windows overlooking Blair Courtyard
On the same floor, there's: guys/girls bathroom, water fountain with hot/cold water, laundry, study room!
Buyers is nice and quiet, with a common room upstairs that has a microwave.

Only downside is tile floor (if you don't like that), and it's in the basement (which is fine for me).
This is where Malcolm Forbes lived when he was at Princeton!
This is where Carl Icahn lived when he was at Princeton!
This is where Meg Whitman lived when she went to Princeton!

Lived in this triple this year and had a fantastic time- the common room is large enough to move all three desks in if desired, and the large window is a fantastic backdrop for a couch or futon. The single is pretty small, and the double is just barely large enough to unbunk, but with three girls living in this triple we still managed to find space for all our things and live comfortably.

Amazing common room with a large bay window.  Really great w/lots of floor space and a fireplace.  Bedrooms tiny and nearly impossible to unbunk.  Subfree so can't utilize the common room in certain ways.

This quad has a long and storied history. Best room in Campbell (for dudes). Close to the restroom, if you're into that. According to the plaque on the mantel, was home to a freshman F. Scott Fitzgerald.

Cozy is the right way to describe this room... definitely on the smaller side, but I ended up really enjoying it. Though bedrooms are tiny, the common room is a fine size. The view is great, and it's right upstairs from the game room, laundry, and bathrooms, and down the hall from printers. We also had a rug which definitely livened up the common room.

Edwards as a building doesn't make a whole lot of sense, but this is a good room. It's spacious for a single and even has its own closet. It did have some heater issues, and a few bugs, and there's only a girls' bathroom on this floor, so it's a little inconvenient for guys. However, all worth putting up with for the privilege of having your own room.
great room, spacious, close to kitchen/lounge/study room, huge windows, nice view, big bathroom shared with only one other person
best room i've ever had! spacious, high ceilings, huge windows, great natural light, perfect study nook, close to bathroom and kitchen
Highly recommend, especially if you want a great window and don't need so much space

count yourself lucky if you get this room- all your friends will be jealous of you (especially those who live in the annex). pros: really spacious, nice private bathroom, 2 closets, quiet. cons: low ceiling, crappy (but cute) tiny circle window, squirrels having sex in the walls but we took care of that... but the pros far outweigh the cons and you will love this room!!
Garbage sounds in the morning were a real BUMMER. Also, there is no view (unless you enjoy trash bins and stinky banana peels).

summary: nominally but not functionally a room
content: I'll be forever grateful to this room for teaching me how to live minimally-- previous poster is right about there only being one possibly configuration and even then it gets tough to move around the room when you've got a big coat on. It's small. Real small. That being said, it was nice to have a space of my own this year. 2.5/5

Among the top 10 largest singles in all of Whitman, and quite probably the nicest Princeton dorm I will ever live in. ABSURDLY spacious with a beautiful courtyard view and perfect location--you, my friend, have hit the jackpot with this room.

While at first the square footage seems smaller than other rooms in Wilson, this is by far the biggest double with the most useable amount of space. Many doubles are L-shaped, but this room is roughly a square. The room is big enough to debunk the beds and still have plenty of space. There is a (not in use) fireplace, but it has no mantle piece, so we just put one of the beds against it and used it as storage. There is an indent in the room (which doesn't make the room a square) that is the perfect size for one of the dressers. We put both desks against the furnace. The closet is on the small side, but most college closets are like that. We have 5 gorgeous, big windows, but unfortunately being on the first floor we can easily hear the noise from outside. I recommend bringing a loud fan to drown out all outside noise. As a freshman, this was the perfect room!

Could not have asked for a better room for sophomore year, especially being in a draw group of 8 and having the other quad take Blair 81. Pretty big common room with good lighting, decent sunlight and window seating. Bedrooms are a bit on the small side but definitely debunkable comfortably. One of the bedrooms is a bit smaller than the other though, and the bigger bedroom has its closet away from where the beds are which is nice.

Blair is a really nice building to live in, and entryway 8 is a great location. Bathrooms are right upstairs, and there are more bathrooms downstairs (although the men’s bathroom is kinda far downstairs). Kitchen, laundry and study room are right downstairs as well. Building is very close to dining hall, u-store and Nassau street.

Pro tips
Get a lot of fans for the warm months because the room doesn’t get a lot of circulation.
If getting a couch, put it next to the window seat to get a sectional kind of seating area.
If the light in the entry area bothers you at night, put some dark colored duct tape over it. It comes off easily when moving out and fire safety shouldn’t bother you about it.

Our draw time was good but not great, and I feel that this room was a real steal. Highly recommend!

It's a pretty nicely sized room actually. My roommate and I had our beds debunked and pushed against either wall and there was still a ton of room, but I imagine there's even more floor space if the beds are bunked. The heater didn't work, but we got a space heater from Housing that did more than it needed to, so overall, it's a pretty solid space.

Here's what I wish I knew when packing all my stuff for this room:

There is really only one wall that's completely usable for something the size of a bed because the other three are covered in doors and windows. Bunking is really the only option. The shade that's on the window makes the room really dark, and people pass by it all the time so I would recommend a light-colored curtain instead. The room is also just kind of dark and dingy in general so get lots of lamps/lights. The bathroom is huge, but it's also bare so you'll definitely need some shelves in there and in the shower. Also the shower head is weird so you can't hang a caddy over it; a tension corner shelf works better. Once you get all situated, I think you'll love this room. I certainly did!

Last but not least, congratulations because this hall has some of the nicest rooms! Enjoy it while you can because this hall typically gets bad draw numbers for room selection in the spring.

Super convenient location: laundry downstairs, cafeteria connected downstairs (don't have to walk outside on snowy days), bathroom close, common room connected, study space downstairs. Really great room!

This was a great room. Both doubles are pretty evenly sized. We were able to fit both beds, both desks, both dressers and both shelves in our double, while still debunking, leaving a lot of space in the common room for a futon/Chairs/coffee table/Tv. The common room window is awesome and was replaced summer 2014. The floors were also redone summer 2013, though our group did a number on them.. sorry.

The room is split up into two "doubles" and a common room, but one double is a substantial two times the size of the other. We decided to move all four beds into the large double and use the smaller as a closet for our dressers, and use the common room for our desks. There is plenty of space, and it is the only room in the tower next to Blair arch - amazing view, with seminar rooms above.

This room is a pleasant surprise. The L shaped configuration allows for the room to be divided in a way that ensures each roommate has his/her own private space within the shared room space. There is really PLENTY of space. 

Both legs of the L have windows facing the Wilson courtyard. There is an open closet space with about 3 or 4 feet of closet rack for each roommate with two shelves above. The floors are wood cross-hatched squares. Normal cinderblock walls which can make Command Hooks a hassle. The window fits a box fan nicely. Noise in adjacent rooms or men's bathroom was not an issue. The dresser has 5 deep drawers. Desk has 3 drawers on the side with a long and shallow drawer in the middle. 

I recommend placing the bookshelf on top of the dresser. 

Ah, this was a lot of information. Bottom line--Wilson is not horrible (at all), and this room is quite nice.

summary: Ok quad in campbell, nice alcove
content: Campbell basically has the smallest quads of any res college. Its possible to debunk only if all of the desks and bookshelves are moved out. The alcove is very nice, and the closets are huge, but overall the room is pretty small, and it sucks walking up and down to go to the bathroom. Campbell also looks like a WW2 bunker. you get used to it.

Pros: large, private bathroom, linoleum floors

Cons: minor ant problem, poor natural light, bathroom layout is kind of odd

The cons aren't really a big inconvenience (the ants start disappearing as it gets colder). Overall, it's a pretty nice room!
I have nothing bad to say about this room.

Great room, feels a bit smaller than other rooms I've been in but it still feels plenty big enough. Sometimes annoying because it's right next to the staircase and so you can hear the door opening and closing at night, but I got used to it. No other complaints.

Great spacious room that I was lucky to have last year. The view is north up elm drive which is nicer than looking out on the whitman courtyard. Very quiet too. Only draw back the bathroom was kinda far away

Overall, this is a nice room in terms of comfort and comfort. 

Furniture: 4 long book cases (these can be stacked on top of one another and put in the common room for more space in bedrooms), 4 desks (only one can fit in each bedroom), 4 beds (can only be bunked), 4 wardrobes (with two drawers), 4 clothing chests (4 drawers) 

You can put a micro-fridge in this room. You may try put bean bags in the common room, but there is not a lot of room. You have a fireplace which is not functional. 

Location: Bathrooms are either upstairs or downstairs only a few steps away. Printer is downstairs just to the left coming down the stairs. The University Store is just around the corner as well as the gym. Very good location if you spend most of time up campus.

It's a good-size room, plenty of floor space. The closet has no doors, though, so you might want to buy curtains or something to cover it up. Four large windows. Standard junior slum problems: rickety heating, bad floors, etc.

The women's bathroom is one floor up on the fourth floor, but has just one toilet and one shower. Our year they made the men's bathroom (2nd floor), which has two showers and three toilets, co-ed. Suggest that to your DA. 

The kitchen is nice, it's private and only independents use it so it stays relatively clean and your food is less likely to be stolen. Also has a nice size dining area and you get a cupboard to store things in.

The location is pretty meh if you're commuting to Friend or in that direction; gotta go uphill. A bike was useful.

This room sucks. Too small for 2 people and god forbid either you or your roommate are at all messy. Also put the beds in the corners to maximize space. Kind of feels like a prison cell with the cinder block walls.
-1 for campbell but good otherwise :) would recommend (if you have to live in campbell)

This room definitely grows on you. It takes some work to get it set up just right, but it can be exactly what you want if you put in the time. My direct roommate and I unbunked our beds and our other roommates kept theirs bunked. Unbunking came at the expense of some loss of storage because instead of dressers, this room has built in drawers. However, we are much happier with our beds unbunked. It really just depends on your preferences, but both can work. There are definitely quads out there with bigger common rooms, but I haven't seen a quad in Mathey with bigger bedrooms, so it's pretty balanced. The best things about this room are the size of the bedrooms, the high ceilings, proximity to the bathroom and elevator. Also, if the windows are closed, the room is very quiet at night, even if the neighbors are playing loud music and having people over. The negatives are the distance to the laundry room and printer, and that the room is super dark. My friends affectionately call it the cave. Overall though, the room is pretty great!

I agree with the previous posters. You likely have this as your freshman room. You are very lucky to have it. I do have three minor negatives:

1. Garbage trucks empty the dumpsters directly below this room early in the mornings. This can be a minor nuisance.
2. You will not be able to control the temperature. Usually, it will be either too hot or too cold. Often significantly so. In my case it was usually too hot. I once forgot to crack my window and came back to an 81 degree Fahrenheit room.
3. If you are a male you will have to go either a floor up or a floor down for a men's room. This is not ideal.

In all though, enjoy this spacious second floor room while you can.  You will be spoiled for next year; it is unlikely you will have a room (much less a single) this big or nice as a sophomore.

There's not too much space in this room. At the same time if you're smart about how you use it you will get a lot out of it. My roommate and I had each of our beds on opposite sides of the room, and took criss crossing desks, so I had the left side of the room and the right desk that way if you're working late at night the light doesn't bother your roommate. 
The closets are pretty crappy, you only get a small indent in the wall, but each person also gets like four drawers which definitely helps. 
You can't really sprawl out that much, but it's good for the basics, watching movies on a tv just put the tv at the end of the room so you can watch from your bed, and the desk area is kind of cozy. It's not a big desk area, but these days with computers you don't really need a big space to write an essay, cause you can have everything you need on your laptop.
Some of the perks are there's a great lounge nearby on  this floor which makes for a great time hanging out with your floor-mates and your RCA. 
The view in this room is also really nice. 
It's a small room, but I think if you have a good relationship with your roommate, you'll be fine. I think it helps when you're willing to do stuff like studying at the library at least part of the time when your roommate is watching TV or vice versa. 
Also, you're close to Nassau Street and Dillon Gym and the dining area. 
I feel like you gotta have good communication with your roommate in a room like this.
Very clean and has great lighting! The area is very quiet and has a personal bathroom with another person. Beautiful view of Poe field! Awesome room!
I also had a great time with this room. There's a wonderful window bench, so you don't even need to buy a couch - just a big pillow or two will do.

We set up this room as a double with a single. The single is very private and visitors usually thought it was just a closet door. The double has four windows with a nice view of the junior slums (hey, they're pretty from the outside) and the single also has its own window. Very spacious and easy to entertain in, though the stair gets a bit noisy at night. Both bathrooms are upstairs, but you have the benefit of being right above the washing machines and study room. The slums are noisy on Thursday and Saturday nights, but the noise isn't bad otherwise. We were on the last page of the draw times and I was surprised we got this nice of a room - apparently nobody draws for triples in Mathey.

summary: The Room Where Memories are Made
content:
Tip: Get this room. Take your beds and put them all in one bedroom. Put all your desks in the other bedroom. Now you have the perfect common room space for a FUCKING MAN CAVE.

You're welcome.

This is really tiny, but it's not too bad if you don't have too much stuff/don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. Has a really nice view, and the place in front of the window is perfect for a bean-bag - incredible place to read in the afternoons. (But can get dingy sometimes.)
Lots of room to move around, bathroom is right upstairs or downstairs. No bug problem whatsoever. Temperature can fluctuate.

This room gets terrible natural light. It is very noisy, with people walking by in the corridor, and with people playing either of the nearby pianos at all hours of the day and night. The heater hardly works, and even when it does, the room is still cold, with drafts getting in the window. There's just enough space to unbunk beds, leaving little floor space. The location means that there's no community in the corridor.
so big, and an extra walk in closet. floors are really squeaky though and you can hear people walking above you all the time.
Loved this room. So much sunlight, a crazy amount of space. Big walk in closet!  Really going to miss it!

This room is the last room in the left half of Bloomberg (right outside is the stairwell that leads to Bloomberg arch. Super convenient to go outside and inside because it's a continuous flight of stairs from directly outside, and not loud because it's sub-free so not that many people enter or leave. This happens to be the smallest single in Bloomberg second floor but I never found it to be cramped. Just don't expect to be able to fit a mini-fridge or sofa in here.

Would highly recommend this room to sophomores! Lived there last year and we still miss it. 
Pros:
-Awesome natural light: common room is all windows on one side
-one of the best views on campus/coolest rooms
-Both doubles de-bunk (put beds in L-shape) and both dressers fit in bedrooms
-Generously sized common room
-your room is cool enough that people will still visit despite the hike
Cons:
-3 flights of stairs
-bathroom is 2 floors down. 
-substance free (good/bad depending on you)

I will wake up sometimes and see the silhouette of a girl standing in front of the window. Don't know what happened in this room but there are presences/spirits that don't want me in here. Don't put yourself through this.

Huge common room but only have 1 bedroom for 3 people can be very difficult to deal with. Also the pipes are very loud and people coming from the street at night are very loud in this section of campus

Excellent room, spacious common room with window seat and bay window, nice for having people over. We put one bed in each room but they can both be in the smaller room too. Laundry, men's bathroom, and kitchen are all super nearby.

Ok, so this suite has a pretty nice common room and a bathroom. There are 5 rooms (3 doubles, 2 singles). There is one room that is really narrow, so what we did was we debunked the beds and moved one of them into the largest single. That meant that we ended up with one huge single, but that room also shares a very thin wall with the common room, which can get kind of loud from time to time. We kept all the desks from the doubles in the common room, which took a little bit of arranging, but ended up being pretty good. The doubles were comfortable (no way you can have debunked bed and desks in there though - we debunked, but kept desks outside). 

There is a little balcony/emergency exit that we're not "supposed" to use, but its really nice. The bathroom got kind of disgusting from time to time, so just make sure you have a good cleaning schedule - we didn't. Great room for pregames and we all became really good friends, so overall I had a great experience!

summary: Huge windows, right next to laundry
content: This room is right above the Bloomberg arch, and has floor-to-ceiling windows for one wall. The windows have Venetian blinds that you can't raise all the way, but it still lets in a lot of light. This room has a slightly funny shape with a narrow entrance, but there was room to put my dresser and still get by easily. There is sometimes noise from the laundry machines next door, but it's not too bad -- you mostly can't hear the machines but you can hear water flowing.
Really convenient-- next to the bathroom and the laundry room!

This is an incredible room. It's enormous and pretty square in shape so it seems even bigger. My only issue with it was finding enough furniture to fill it nicely.  Windows open out onto the roof, men's bathroom right next door and women's down the hall. No A/C, but this is about as good as Little gets.

summary: Small single, great closet storage, good location
content: The room is small, but there closet available provides a lot of storage space so I was able to keep my room feeling more open by shoving everything in there. There are also two large windows that make the room feel bigger too. It is also directly across from the women's restroom which was nice. A nice, cozy little room. Perfect single for anyone that does not care too much about room size.
draw_time: Lower half of junior draw time

content: The room is absolutely huge, filled with light, and there's so many things you can do with the space! Definitely more than enough room for two people, all of your stuff, a futon, etc, and still having tons of space to move around. Because it's on the stairway, that can get pretty noisy, and the pipes run through the wall and can get really loud, too. If you're not put-off by noise, it's great!
draw_time: Decent, but not stellar, people tend to see "shared bathroom" and pass it up

content: Not a bad quad if you have a bottom-half draw time. It takes a long time to get there from anywhere (especially the E-quad). When I lived there we could hear construction every day, but that might not be a problem anymore. It's big though, and the bedroom on the corner gets a lot of light.

summary: Dope ass room (if you're a junior)
content: This is a choice room, smack dab in the middle of campus, right next to Frist and within a 2 minute walk of the street. The room itself is pretty small and has overhangs because it is on the top floor, but the interesting shape allows for many furniture options. The high ceilings and huge window with ledge make this room very homey. Perfect for juniors because there is no other way you are getting a single this close to the street (unless you are independent).

summary: One of the smallest singles in Whitman, still a fine single
content: Can't complain. Decent natural light in morning, but I'd recommend bringing a floor lamp since the notorious poor lighting of Whitman is a real problem in here.

summary: Large bedrooms, not huge common room
content: This is a double bubble room and the bedrooms are great. The common room isn't huge but it's not bad, plus you get your own bathroom

summary: Best single in all of Wilson
content: The nicest single in all of Wilson. Huge square footage (I put two beds together) and the most beautiful bay window that made it perfectly okay for me to walk down the stairs to use the women's restroom (congrats boys, yours is right across the hall). Noise outside the window was a little loud at times but that's what you get with Wilson in general?

Do not sign up for this room. I was also trapped by the large square footage, but the piping and delivery trucks were a source of sleepless nights and morning. You're also right above the laundry room, which can be convenient, but the noise from it is unbearable :( DONT DO IT

This room is very spacious and nice. People tend to overlook Buyers (I think because it's sub free), so you can get this room even if you have a bad draw time. The only gripe I have with it is that it is as far as you can possibly get from a bathroom (you either have to walk to the basement and over one entry or down one floor and across two entries). Otherwise it's great.
draw_time: 10th to last draw time in Rocky (approximately)

content: This is one of the few rooms on campus that's legitimately a two-bedroom double; not like a common room and a bedroom, but you walk in and there are two doors to two separate bedrooms. Downsides: rooms are disproportionate in size (one big, one small), and the women's bathroom is pretty far, as is laundry. But tbh I loved it and would highly recommend
draw_time: Like page 50 out of 60 for upperclassmen draw, I think

content: The room is pretty small... helps to put the bookshelf on the desk or in the closet (extra storage for sweaters?). With the bed on risers, I was able to fit all the stuff you're initially given+ a sofa+ another decent size bookshelf+ a fridge. Keep in mind that there is a slanted ceiling on the window side.
L shaped room, so each person can have their own personal space. Extremely poor lighting. The closet is right by the entrance and does not have a door, so you may want to invest in a curtain.
Really awesome room. Nice, big common room with a great window and a large windowsill.

Rooms are decently sized, especially compared to other Cuyler triples. Window looks out to the courtyard and is beautiful. Nice fireplace. Closets are a bit small (but this is a problem in all of Cuyler)

summary: Good triple, but not the best in Cuyler
content:
It's not bad, but it's a smaller triple compared to other triples in Cuyler. 

No laundry and printer in the building make for a bit of a hassle as well.

summary: Worth it, despite being in the annex
content:
This room is awesome as a two room double. More than enough space, good view of the annex courtyard, and right next to the bathroom. Both wardrobes are in the larger room. This room is often overlooked because it is in the annex, but it's great. 

Downsides: you can hear people banging around in the bathroom and the bathroom fan (it's not that bad. only really a concern if you're a light sleeper and live in the inside room). Heating is kind of finicky sometimes.

Good size for a single. Fit a large couch in your room by putting the bookshelf on top of the desk or under your bed. Very comfortable. If it had a private restroom as well, it would be totally awesome.
Next to the laundry room though, you can certainly hear the machines going. Didn't personally bother me though, it was a dull and rhythmic enough sound that I could sleep.
draw_time: Very early in the juniors, so just after the half of upperclass draw.

content: This room is a bit on the small side for singles, but nonetheless cozy. It's right across from the now unisex bathroom. The heat works very well, although the window doesn't close completely so there's a slight draft if you stand right next to the window. It's not noisy and overall Spoon is an awesome place to be!
draw_time: bottom 2/5ths of Rocky draw - basically one of the last Spoon singles available

content: this is one of the few three room triples ive seen where you can all have your own singles without walking through the room of whoever lives in the common room. i live in the common room and it has never been a problem. the third dresser is also bolted outside the bedrooms in the hallway so it acts as a barrier between the common room and hallway. it has only been loud from parties a couple of big nights this year. and the bathrooms for men and women are right next door (i dont think its clear from the floor plan but this hallway is connected to patton and there is a bathroom right around the corner. also nice that laundry is three steps away.

summary: great for size but kind of isolating
content: this room was great in terms of being a four room double. but i did feel that without a common space i found it isolating, bc it is also far from central campus. in the entryway there are only two other rooms (the fourth is an RGS room). and going outside to do laundry was a struggle
draw_time: good enough to get this room

content: a nice square, very cozy! can be hot in the summer time but that's totally fine

summary: Good room overall, laundry is pretty far
content: Sleeping rooms are pretty even in square feet, you can do a lot with the floorplan in the living room. Laundry is somewhat of a hike, but not terrible.

This room is a nice quad in a central location. It is on the top floor (no elevator), but the bathrooms are convenient, and the view is nice. The built-in lighting is completely inadequate, so you'll need at least one floor lamp along with some desk lamps if you plan to work in the room.

A fabulous room with windows on all four sides. It's the only room on the fourth floor of little, and has two entryways, which is pretty awesome. The walls are at awkward angles in parts, which makes arranging furniture an adventure, but it is spacious.

Overall, this room is really quite spacious and was enjoyable to live in. There is a walk-in closet, rather than a wardrobe, which helps to save some space. I was able to put in a futon with plenty of room to spare. Two words of caution: the closest female bathroom is up a floor and there are bugs (silverfish) in the room. Also, like all rooms in the slums, there is no A/C.

A much bigger room than I was expecting. Besides coming with it's own Window Bench and fireplace, it currently houses 2 desks, a couch, 2 coffee tables, and 2 butterfly chairs, and 2 beanbags with room to spare in the common room. The bedrooms are almost exactly the same size, which is nice, and the closets are big, with shelving. If you bunk the beds, you can fit both desks in one the rooms with very little issue, but debunking definitely means putting both desks in the common room. A pretty awesome quad
It gets a little cramped, but not a bad room.
draw_time: Third-last draw time (two single-person groups after)

content: I loved living in this room. Easy access living on the first floor - especially since Edwards has no elevator. Private bathrooms just down the hall. It's very spacious for a single, plenty of room. Edwards is often very quiet since it is primarily singles, which is always a plus.
draw_time: Decent, above middle for sophomores, but not great

content: Fantastic room. Very open, spacious main common room, and the little loft/nook upstairs is also comfy. Helpful to have or get sofas/futons.
draw_time: Pretty good--we drew at around 10 or 11 am.

content: Spacious bedrooms with plenty of room to debunk, but the room facing Holder courtyard is much nicer and larger. The common room and the bedroom facing Nassau have slanted ceilings that are kind of annoying but livable. Right next to bathrooms for women and men, directly above the laundry room, printer downstairs and down the hall. Location is okay--it's far from everything that's not East Pyne--but your entryway does open into the arch so you can get to food without going totally outside. Pros: spacious, bathrooms/laundry/printing super convenient, unbunkable beds. Cons: slanted ceilings, 3rd floor, far from the rest of campus.
draw_time: Roughly the middle of rising sophomores.

content: Very solid. Nice sized room. Kind of stuck in the corner so it's a walk to/from most places, but Joline is lovely.
Bedrooms are badly shaped so debunking is a nightmare. Common room is a square which means there's no good way to position furniture.
It is converted 2 doubles into a 4room quad with 2 entrances. sucks that 2 people have to walk through someone's room to get to their room but It's not a bad settup

This is a great room and a massive single! Only downsides are having to walk up to the second floor anytime you want to use the bathroom. Also, this room is literally right next to the entryway so anytime your blinds are open people can see right through as they walk by.

Honestly this room was great. It was right across from the kitchen (huge bonus) and right next to the elevator to the laundry room (which made laundry super easy). Pretty spacious and great insulation. Has its own heater/ AC which is huge. For a sophomore room in forbes, it's really nice. Private bathroom is also super nice, especially when you're sick.

summary: Great common room, shitty bedrooms. Steal with a bad draw time.
content: Good room for parties, not so much for comfortable bedrooms. Big common room with nice views, esp. in winter. Sound goes outwards from the corners so its not too loud in the building, and nobody in brown ever makes noise complaints. Men's bathroom is a hike, womens bathroom is 2 doors over. Beds must be bunked, the bedrooms are too small. Brown is a fine building, laundry and printers, kitchen is on this floor, but no elevator which sucks if you're carrying anything. Pipes aren't too loud. I'd recommend this room for a group of girls who like having people over and like their direct roommates well, but got a meh draw time, or dudes who have a shitty draw time, because the bathroom being so far away is a real pain.

summary: Nice (but better if you have the single)
content: Nice common room with a bay window (blocked by a radiator, unfortunately) and a fireplace, but not great lighting. If you have the single (the bedroom further from the entryway), you're set. But if you have double, you have to get creative if you want to debunk. We moved one wardrobe into the common room to the left of the fireplace. That way it's next to the awkward alcove, which can be used as additional storage space. Then we placed one chest of drawers in the closet in the larger bedroom. It's a tight fit but it works if you don't have a lot of long clothing that needs to be hung in the closet. The beds in that bedroom will be pretty close together but it's not too awkward.
draw_time: decent; in the first half for juniors

content:
Amazing common room. It's got a beautiful window with storage space in the bench. There's also a fireplace and who doesn't like those?? We put two desks in the common room and all the shelves along the wall of the hallway. The smaller bedroom is smallish but if you have those roommates' desks in the common room it's not such a big deal. The larger bedroom is really nice — large window, another fireplace, and loads of space. Plus there's a neat plaque on the fireplace dedicated to some guy who used to live in the room.

IMPORTANT: the key to maximizing space in this room is putting your dressers underneath the beds. In order to do this you have to raise the beds as much as possible in their frames and prop them up on 7" risers. THE 5" RISERS THAT ARE SOLD IN THE USTORE WON'T CUT IT. You'll probably have to use a stool to get into your bed, but this is absolutely the best way to make the most of this room.

Oh also if you're a woman getting to the bathroom is so convenient — it's just down the hallway.

I loved this room and wish I could have lived in it another year.

Great room. Its really big and has 3 nice windows, so you get lots of natural lighting. Theres a huge walk in closet, like unnecessarily big but convenient for storage. View out to University Place - right by the Ustore.. trucks can get annoying in the morning. Its also on the 3rd floor.

We loved this room. First of all, 1927/clapp is the best building in Wilson, with mostly soundproof windows and AN ELEVATOR. If you're an athlete this is crucial for those days when your body hurts and you just can't bring yourself to climb one more stair. This room seems** a lot smaller than the other quads in 27/clapp, and it is slightly smaller, but the numbers are mostly reflecting the fact that this room does not have a bathroom inside of it. This was more of a benefit than a negative in my opinion, because I lived in a 8 person suite with a bathroom the year before and it was disgusting. The women's bathroom is literally directly across the hall, and you don't have to clean it yourself. The common room is awesome and can be quite spacious if you put one desk in each double, and the big window is awesome. We had a pretty bad draw time and were terrified that we would be stuck in that one quad in walker where you can't un-bunk. We were SO lucky to get this room.

Good room! Had some issues with ants and a few cockroaches, but that's probs to be expected with a kitchen. Heating was insufficient during the cold months, and lack of AC made September rather difficult. But I can't complain - I was lucky to have this room as a junior, and nothing beats having a private bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, plus a big common room.

This room is in the corner of Blair so there is a ton of natural light and 2 window seats. The ceilings are really high and some of the windows are double height. After living in Joline freshman year, having a bright room is fantastic. There's a cool fireplace too. The common room is HUGE, great for having people over. One of the bedrooms is too small to debunk but the other is possible. It has a small entryway area with built in coat hooks. The water fountain is right outside the door.

summary: Okay on space, top floor on the slums.
content:
Bathroom (female) and sinkerator were one floor down, most amenities (laundry, water, printer) were in the basement. Entryway 6 was an all-female entryway this year.

The double is only slightly bigger than the single, so the double would probably require bunking and would definitely be cozy. We decided to make the double a single and one person took the common room, which worked out.

The room is on the top floor and windows face away from the courtyard and towards Little Hall, so it's a fairly quiet room.

Overall, not a bad room especially given our draw time! Get used to the stairs, though.
draw_time: This was the biggest triple by draw time, all singles and 2 room doubles gone.

content:
Whitman quads are pretty generic, but this corner-room quad had a unique common room/doubles layout! We put all of our desks in the common room, and it was still pretty spacious.

One of the doubles is a funny L shape, which means that one person may have to sleep in a windowless nook. But with warm decorations and lamps, this could be very cozy!

Downsides: in the corner of Whitman furthest from everything (but close to the Wa). Faces Baker Rink/New South, very scenic.
The bad reviews below were when it was a six-person suite, with three doubles and a common room. Now it's four singles, and they're as big as you're going to find in Wilson. Definitely recommended!

We had a pretty poor draw time for sophomores, but we managed to get this room, and we're really happy with it. Really nice common room with a lot of space. Also, there is a lot of space to put posters, and there's one big uninterrupted wall if you want to use a projector. Bedrooms are small, you cannot unbunk in either. Men's and women's bathrooms right upstairs. Laundry and printer in the same building, and you don't technically have to go outside to access them. 

Overall, pretty happy with this room.

This room is pretty tiny, but I loved having two separate rooms. We made one into a common room and the other into a bed room. There's space to have the two beds unbunked, but there's not a lot of extra space in either room. You could also configure as two singles!
draw_time: Pretty good if I remember right

content: Great Room. Only 2 negative things I would say about it was that if the shades are up everyone can see into your room and the air conditioner makes noise.  Otherwise would highly recommend.

Large, private bathroom with a tub, huge amount of closet space next to the bathroom. Overall a good room, except that occasionally people will be really loud outside the window, because that's where the volleyball court is.
draw_time: 1/3 of the way through the draw

content: This is a great room of a good size, with a cute little stage and windows overlooking Elm Drive! Super close to the girls' bathroom.
draw_time: I got this room off the waitlist! I was lower than halfway through juniors

content: If you're looking for a single that's pretty spacious with lots of closet space, this room is great. (FYI, there is some damage on the wall, but I managed to cover that up with posters). Overall, 1915 hall is not a great place to live. The bathroom and laundry room are two floors down (which sucks), I can hear everything my neighbors say, the hall is generally dark and depressing, and NO AC. I would've preferred to have a smaller single in New Butler if I had the choice (only 1915 singles were available when I drew).

Best part about this room is that it has tons of space. It also has a great view of the golf course. This room would probably be most convenient for a guy because it's right across from the men's bathroom. It's also right by the kitchen, although this can get a little noisy at times. Also pretty close to the Annex laundry room - convenient!

Heating is a little too warm.  But it's big for a single.  Can be noisy at times, since you're neighbors with a quad.  Windows are facing the courtyard, which can contribute to the noise.  So to deal with the noise I usually have a fan going when I sleep.  The bathroom is also two flights of stairs down.  But you're probably looking at this because you want a single and probably don't have a huge selection as to the quality.  If that's the case, I say take it.

This room is great size for a single. Its shaped like a "thumbs up" which give the room character. It also separates the space well so you can have a sleep space and a social/work space. Has enough space to fit a king-size bed and a futon. It has a big walk in closet, with 2 shelves and hooks. The heater is really strong (can get pretty hot if you don't have a fan or don't like opening the window). Close to the girls bathroom, & has a common room down the hall.

summary: Great quingle if you get the right rooms
content: Two of the rooms are spacious and have good lighting, while the other two face New Butler,  so they're dark. These two small rooms also have windows facing the entrance to the Bloomberg basement, so I would not recommend if you value privacy + daylight + silence during a cappella recruitment.
draw_time: Second page of the freshman Butler list.

summary: Good but loud trucks in the morning
content: Nice, spacious single. There is no air conditioning, and it got super got in the warmer months. In addition, in the winter the heating didn't really work super well (one of the girls on my floor used to get woken up by the cold). The bathroom is two floors down, which kind of sucks, and loud trucks come by every morning to deliver food to the dining hall. These trucks come very early and it's impossible to not get woken up if your window is open. All in all, a good choice if you really want a single you sophomore year, but it doesn't have the best amenities.
draw_time: Not super great; I got the last single available

summary: Great room with a friendly ghost
content: This is a great room.  I've had many good memories in this room, and also some bad ones.  Also, it is HUGE for a single.  You could fit approximately 4,644 lobsters in this room, assuming 3 lobster friends per cubic square foot.  However, there is potentially a ghost that lurks right outside the window, I think.  This ghost could, perhaps, steal about 5 of your lobsters, give or take depending on how stealthy the ghost is.  The ghost, if any at all, is very friendly and I have not had any problems.  I actually enjoy having their presence here.  It gives the room a deliciously spooky vibe.
I swear I'm not responsible for the bad memories

Summary says it all... small room, good for sitting and sleeping but gets super crowded when friends come over. Basically feels like a large closet.

On the plus side, you can close the outer door (the door to B204 and B205) if people are being loud down the hall.

summary: Best and largest double in Wilson
content: This room was great--I live in Bloomberg now and still kinda miss it. It was that good. Pretty cool to be on the third floor, and the windows are bright and good for plants. Convenient bathrooms, no laundry in building--just go to Clapp next door. No printing either. Typical Wilson. There is a ceramics studio in the basement which is very underrated, and Wilcox is right next door. The radiators make metallic clanging noises at whatever time is prime sleeping or nap time. Also, if ants freak you out, 1938 is not the building for you. They invade when the weather gets warm. All-in-all, a great room to make Princeton memories in.

summary: Best room you'll have at Princeton
content: You get a decent view of the golf course, but that's just a bonus. It's a single with a private bathroom, perfectly rectangular with a ton of space, two closets (!!!), and looks very nice. It's great to host small-group events and you get a lot of privacy, too!
This room was very comfortable to live in.  It is a decently large room that is in good condition.  Laundry and bathroom are close enough to be convenient but far enough to not be too noisy.
draw_time: About top 1/3 of the rising sophomore draw

content: Nice quad, but there is this weird long nook that has a wardrobe in it that inflates the square footage; the room doesn't feel as big as it is listed (but it's still a nice size). Right outside the room is the men's bathroom (women's bathroom is kinda far away) and a water fountain (with hot water I used for tea and ramen). There is a kitchen just down the hall which was nice because two of us were independents. It feels weird to walk downstairs to our room, but the ground is lower in the back so we still have windows. Also the heaters didn't work so the University gave us space heaters for the winter. I don't know if they'll fix that for next year.

I lived here my freshman year and I loved it.  This room is spacious and in good condition.  There are basically two common rooms and a kitchen on this floor (technically one of the common rooms and the kitchen are in Wendell C, but Wendell B and C are connected).  This allows you all the benefits of a single, while also being able to socialize with your friends in a common space.

Enough room for one person, decent view of Poe field. Next to open common area that sometimes had noisy people late at night, but not too often. Close to kitchenette (microwave, hot water) and elevator. Natural sunlight in the mornings, less in the afternoon. Possibly haunted.
draw_time: I was in the top half for butler freshmen

content:
Great location, big room, big, lovely windows on both sides of the archway. 
Only downsides are the flights of stairs to the bathroom and lack of a water fountain.

Lived here my junior year. We split up the room so we each got singles, with one person in the common room. Common room has a bay window and fireplace. Plenty of space and we managed to fit a ton of people in here for pregames. Awesome awesome location - 1 minute from Dillon and Frist and as quick of a walk to the street/Fstone as you can get. (Note that all the 3-room triples in Cuyler are pretty much the same)
draw_time: Our draw time was right about middle of the list for juniors.

content: Not sure what the prior reviewer was talking about - was not so bad! Kind of a strange setup since it is a 1-room triple, but if you like your roommates enough it's not hard to make it work. Took some rearranging the furniture around, but it's possible to de-bunk and have all the beds on the ground. Think it used to be part of the hallway which is why the window alcoves are kind of weird. The bathroom can get really gross if you don't clean it bi-weekly or even weekly. Right next to the elevator which is dope (easy move-in and laundry).

summary: Triple with large common room and 2 decent bedrooms
content: Large common room with built-in shelf space on the walls. The two bedrooms were on the smaller side but were perfectly suitable. Great central location on campus. Right across the hall from the men's bathroom.
draw_time: Noon on the first day that juniors started to draw upperclass.

content: Just class

Great single. Enough space for all you need. Quiet. Faces Poe field, very nice view, lots of sunshine. Very high ceiling if that's your thing. Right in front of men's bathroom, and I was woken up a few times in the morning/late at night by people opening the door, but not too bad.
draw_time: Pretty good draw time for incoming junior

content: I love this room. It has a fireplace and the ceiling is all slopey and it has a ton of character. Close to the bathroom, nice view of the courtyard, super quiet (it somehow manages to have no shared walls with other bedrooms). Has a heater you can control. 10/10 would recommend.

Love, love, love this room -- it's been my home for a semester and a half now and I think it's one of the best singles out there! So nicely set up and you can always move things around if you don't like the arrangements they have for you.

This room is rough to say the least. I personally have a lot of stuff and my roommate did too, so the room was insanely cramped. If you are economical though, I can imagine it being decent. The ground floor level will makes it weird as the window looks directly onto a well-travelled throughway, forgetting this, many unfortunate souls have seen me or my roommate's johnsons as we change or disrobe to shower. Avoid at all costs.

This is a great single in the center of campus. Very spacious (can definitely fit a couch and a fridge with no problems) and the closet is built in and pretty spacious! (with shelving at the top).

2 Issues (ONLY if you are a light sleeper):
- this room faces out towards Frist. so you will hear people going and coming back from the street Thurs-Saturday night. 
- this room is directly next to the bathroom. You will be able to hear the toilet flush and the door closes pretty loudly. 

I am a light sleeper --> so I use a noise machine and it eliminates everything! (except the door slamming a little)
draw_time: 1/3 way down on the list for seniors

summary: Great, spacious, quiet single in a convenient location
content: Can't beat the location of the room, both within Little and on campus as a whole. While it's 3 flights up, you get used to the climb because it's super quiet despite being right across from the women's restroom (and a 5 sec walk from the men's). Printer and laundry room are all 4 flights down, and then a fair walk along the basement hallway, but for how seldom I visited those places, not too much of an inconvenience. Windows are either too high or tilted for others to see in so you can have natural light in all day long. Can sometimes be a bit noisy on Friday/Saturday nights since you're facing the slums but it usually dies down around 11:30 pm once people head to the Street. Definitely enough room to fit a large chair or large bean bag, but not much other furniture not already provided by the University. However, still an ample amount of space for one person. Ditto what the other review said.
draw_time: Can't remember for sure but definitely within the top 10 draw groups for Mathey

content:
This is listed as a triple, but I lived in this room with only one other person. So for a room in the slums it was pretty good --- common room and two singles. This room would be horrible if it had three people because the rooms are way too small (the third person would have to move out to the common room)
We drew in with someone who was studying abroad -- once she dropped the room, housing never replaced the third person for the remainder of the year.
draw_time: Bottom of the room draw list

summary: One of the best singles in Wilson
content:
This was my favorite room of all four years! 
Very spacious (great closet space) and the fireplace added a nice touch. 
Also, at the center of campus!

Light Sleepers:
- You will hear the garbage trucks around 9:00am in the morning

Beautiful common room. On the corner of the building so the common room is extra large and has tons of windows for natural light. I've been to other Brown quads with super depressing common rooms and ours is lovely. HOWEVER the bedrooms are super tiny and you can't unbunk. Fairly small closets too. Extra wardrobes in the common room do make up for the closet size somewhat.
The two bedrooms are the same size, so it's inconvenient in the double, but there is still enough room to debunk beds.
This room has AC, lots of space, is in a great location, has a nice view, and is on a quiet hallway.

It's a small room with a large window but you can really pimp it out. If you're a boy, the bathroom is literally next door, and if you're a girl it's like right downstairs and there's another one downstairs in the fourth entryway. You might hear people in the courtyard sometimes but that's only when it's warm.

Great location, 20 steps from Wu and I never had a problem with the heat during the summer months. Just buy a fan, put it next to a window and keep the air flowing and it's fine-- it also prepares you for living in the slums!! You get a little bit of noise on Thursday-Saturday nights because people walk home past your window and walking down 2 flights of stairs to get to the bathroom is annoying but totally fine.
Lots of windows. 2 nice singles and one huge double. Common room is spacious. Only drawback is distance from the bathroom.

summary: Great room, walk in closet, bathroom far away
content: Great room, very spacious with a walk-in closet. Unfortunately, the closest bathroom is upstairs, two lefts, and down the hall. There is a bench right outside the window that people will sit and talk on. Otherwise, would definitely recommend.
For a sophomore, this room is as good as it gets. It is in a building with an elevator and laundry. Both bedrooms are equally as big and the common room is huge. Bathroom across the hall.
draw_time: very good, early on the first day.

content: Really nice single, right next to the women's bathroom in a relatively quiet entryway. The only issue with the common room is that the window is at a height and cannot be opened. Nice size bedroom too!

My roommate and I had one of the worst draw times in Rocky. There were 2 doubles left in the entire college and we picked this one cause Holder(!). It is spacious and bright and offers each person a bit more privacy than the average double because of the way it is shaped. The only issue for us (both women!) is that the closest bathroom is quite a few flights of stairs down, though it is essentially a private bathroom for the two of us.

Great location, close to bathroom, printer, exit, and the writing center. One of the bedrooms is much smaller than the other but beds can be comfortably debunked. Common room has enough space for all the desks, bookshelves, and a couch. The bigger bedroom has more space than you'll know what to do with.

Love this room! Nice and square so no square footage lost. Really big common room with loads of room for couch, desks, etc. Also has a coat rack installed! Good size bedroom with room for both beds unbunked, with dressers between them, and two closets. Both rooms have a big window - the common room looks out onto the slums courtyard (west) and the bedroom looks out at the back of Little (east). Convenient to stairs, bathroom, laundry, and printer.
draw_time: Bad - last page of senior draw times

content:
A bit small for an upperclass double but really great setup. It has a fireplace and an amazing rotunda with a wrap-around heater we used as a bench and sunken windowsills large enough to be windowseats.

We were able to unbunk the beds very unawkwardly, idk what that other reviewer was thinking.

summary: Good enough but bad for a room at Princeton
content: Solid room, but the door hangs loosely in its frame and makes a lot of noise (enough to wake my roommate or me if we're asleep and it's allowed to close on its own). It's a small room but otherwise nice.
Very close to the guy's bathroom with a good location on campus. It's a nice room, and it's a good size for a single even if it's not huge. No A/C sadness.

summary: Solid double for a middle draw time
content:
This was a solid room, though you'll want to have a good working relationship with your roomate; it would be pretty easy to drive eachother up the wall because there is not a ton of space.
