My roomate and I debunked, and I put my bed right next to the heater, which was problematic when the heat was on during the winter (scaly hands, nosebleeds, etc), but I got a humidifier and that fixed things. Just a heads up because in the fall it seems totally reasonably to put the bed against the heater on the wall but in the winter it might be bad.

Two male bathrooms reasonably close by and a bunch in the basement.

You have to climb a ton of stairs for laundry, classes, etc, but it kept me in great shape!

Pretty good room, bathroom on the same floor, can de-bunk in both bedrooms, common room a good size with a window seat, slanted ceilings (attic-y feel), only one wardrobe per 2 people. If you don't mind walking up 3 flights, it's a great room.

This room has a lot of space, reasonably centrally located, bathrooms 2 floors down or 1.5 floors up, and generally seems good on paper. And it was a perfectly serviceable room.

A few things to keep in mind, which seem to be problems for Cuyler in general
- The heating/cooling was a little bit delayed, so when the weather is oscillating in the spring they would turn off the heat, it gets cold and you freeze, then they turn on the heat just in time for the weather to get warm and you cook a little bit. It wasn't that bad, but if you are sensitive to temperature it is something to keep in mind. 
- The windows weren't soundproof, which meant you could hear all the nearby parties and events in Dillon. I invested in some earplugs and it worked fine.

And things about this room specifically:
- Plan out how you will divide up the single/double early on. We did 1/3 of the year for each person, but you might have different ideas. Anyways, best to figure it out early on and avoid anger and hurt feelings when it ends up being whoever gets to campus first takes the single all year.
draw_time: Top 3rd for juniors, but bottom of the top 3rd

summary: great room but has a bug problem (just call housing to sort out)
content: I'm gonna miss this room when I leave, this single was huge. However make sure to call housing at the beginning of the year because I had a year-long problem with bugs (tons of roaches and centipedes), the heater was always blasting, and there was a 1.5 inch crack under the door that a lot of light came in through at night. Still, cool room.....

summary: Very Small for a quad. Not the worst for the last draw time in rocky
content: Very Small for a quad. Not the worst for the last draw time in rocky
I like to describe it as cozy! A little small, but endearingly so. The view from the room is amazing, especially if you like sunrises!

The room is a really good size. I have a couch, a small coffee table, a refrigerator and an additional shelving unit in the room as well as the furnishings it comes with. The closet space is amazing! However, it's 5th floor no elevator which sucks and makes moving in a literal nightmare.

Drew this with a fine draw time for my junior year. Great room - lots of light in the mornings, L shape makes it easy to arrange everything and leaves space for a big bed. Nice sized closet, no bug problems, across the hall from a womens' bathroom and not far from a mens. Only downside is that window positioning makes it easy to hear pregames or loud talking if your neighbors are noisy. But as far as a junior single, it's pretty great.

summary: Very spacious room with heat issues
content: This is a really nice single, with tons of closet space and natural light. However, you can not turn the heater on (long story, but the knob to turn it on is in the neighbors' room AND when they do turn it on, heat does not radiate throughout this room). Facilities is happy to give you a space heater for free, so it's not that big of a deal. Good room!

Huge common room, kept both desks and shelves in with plenty of room. Large bedroom - room for three beds side to side. 2 closets that come with doors (Joline 214 doesn't come with closet doors). 
Loud at night because firetrucks come in through the street. Also leaking ceiling that university services just refuses to fix properly.

It's a decent size for a single and the closet is pretty big. Few downsides: Ground floor facing courtyard so it can get SUPER noisy, and you can basically never pull up your blinds if you want privacy. Walls aren't soundproof at all. Heater isn't really good, so if you like colder rooms then this would work well for you. Have had a few bugs here and then, but it's Pyne/slums so nothing too surprising. Bathrooms are on the second floor. Otherwise, the room has a nice rectangular shape that allows for creative rearrangement of furniture.
draw_time: Second to last day, around 5 p.m

content: Huge closet, great shape, great size, mini balcony. Honestly best room a sophomore could ask for. TAKE IT if you can.
large room but it's near the elevator so you can hear it at all hours and it is pretty far away from the bathroom
The room was huge. I had a couch and there was still plenty of space left over. Also has a nice view of the golf course

This room tends to get overlooked I think since it's on the smaller end of square footage, and that's how we got it, but it's really an awesome room. The common room is quite large, we have room for a couch, table, 2 desks, bookshelves, refrigerator, and lots of room to spare. One bedroom is easily debunkable. The other is possible to be debunked, but there's not much room if you do that (we kept it bunked). Blair is also a fantastic building. Overall, awesome room that you could get with not such a good draw time since most will pass up on it because of the square footage.

One closet is in the common room so it makes the most sense for someone to live there instead of having two people in one of the back rooms, so as long as someone is okay with that the set up is great. room that faces the street is slightly smaller than the one that faces the courtyard but was still a perfectly good size for me. windows in the common room are large and nice. womens bathroom is upstairs but we just used the men's in our hall.

summary: huge common room, way uneven bedrooms
content: amazing location, really huge common room, one of the bedrooms is pretty big but the other one is very very small

Great room. Nice kitchen space, individual rooms, and bathroom. Common space is great for hanging out. Its nice and quiet as well. Having the wa nearby is great, but be prepared for a half minute (not so bad) trudge through the snow to clean your laundry or print something out.

I loved this room! Its one of the biggest singles in Wilson. Great lighting (3 windows) and great location. 
Small cons: sometimes the heater can be noisy and you can hear a lot of what is going on outside on the street below.

This room is dope. Comparatively far from shit, but its a hidden gem because its in a place where mostly juniors live and one of the biggest singles on campus. Slums are where it's at, but don't live here if you're anti party because it can be loud at times so you should be about the vibe that is going on!
draw_time: not good but not great-- page 12

content: Good sized-single, square layout, some street noise, decent sized closet. Other rooms in the hallway are louder with pregames, but overall a good single

This is one of the smallest singles on campus. But! I've actually liked it better than a lot of my friends' larger singles. It has a huge window that takes up most of the courtyard-side wall so there's a ton of light. The closet is also really big, the room is close (but not too close) to bathrooms), and it's in the slums so it's basically central to all upperclassmen dorms. I've loved it, just wish I had space for a big bed.
draw_time: Not great - this was the last single to go.

content: Extremely small bedrooms - it's not possible to unbunk the beds unless you're going to move them into the common room. My roommates and I were at the very bottom of the draw list and we still probably made a mistake drawing this room. Terrible location on campus and there are roaches. Only nice thing is that the kitchen and laundry room are right underneath.
draw_time: One of the last w/out room improvement

summary: Big comfy single, a little dark
content: Really good single - great closet with door, feels big, easy to set up. Radiator clangs in the winter, and not the best lit because it's at an angle with the building. Can be a little loud but not bad. Close to Ustore & gym. Definitely a great room :)
so big!

This room is incredibly overrated and has lots of issues with it. It's not worth the hike, the bedrooms are very unbalanced which caused issues, we had to do 3 people in one bedroom for half the year because of it. 

The heaters also make a ton of noise and the electric outlets stopped working, which maintenance couldn't fix. Much better quads for seniors out there.

summary: Great room, but the single is cramped
content: If you live in the large double area like I did, it's awesome. Well lit, pleasant view, and TONS of room for you and your roommate. Everybody who saw it thought the room to the attached single was a closet door. The single is cramped and dark, but it's a single. Bathrooms are upstairs, and the room is right above the study room and laundry room, which is nice. I had this room in 2015 and the wifi was AWFUL, so that might still be an issue. It's sub-free, so the freshman zee group on the floor above you tends to not be obnoxious.
Very spacious common room, bedrooms are alright, view is pleasant, and it's fun to run into tour groups everyday and bask in the glow of strangers thinking your life is awesome.

While the room looks great on the floor plan and seemed like a great 3 room double pickup. This could not be further from the truth. Bugs and mice were problems all year. The radiator is incredibly loud and keeps you up at night and housing couldn't fix it. Plus it's situated in a weird place that makes furniture difficult. Because it's the ground floor you hear absolutely everyone passing by. Getting a bigger two room double would be better than this room

This room is very small, but I put my bed (with a great deal of difficulty) in the narrow part of the room perpendicular to the door and it opened up a little space. The view is nothing special (this was the last single left in whitman when i drew), but the shared bathroom is a plus. Personally I thought it was just the right size for one person, but don't expect to have company in any capacity

A pretty good room, connected by a bathroom to 210. We had two of our other friends draw into 210 so that we made a kind of quad. Great view, decent size (although we raised our beds on 8 inch risers and put our desks underneath our beds).

I really enjoyed the view of Poe Field, especially because it meany I could have my window and shades open all the time with no fear of people looking in since it was on the 4th floor. 

This was a great room for those who don't want a shared bathroom (no cleaning). Laundry was right down the hall and printer was a floor down. Study rooms and bathroom (Women's) very close. Pretty spacious for a stand alone single with tall ceilings. One of the further rooms from Frist/Up campus which can be a drag but it's still a great place considering the cleanliness and air conditioning.

pretty decent room. common room feels relatively spacious (more so than my freshman year quad) w/ enough room to put desks, futon, chair, small table, fridge, coat rack, etc. two doubles are the same size and beds are debunkable but there is very little space between them. holder's location is a bit far but if you're already in rocky it doesn't make much difference. would recommend

summary: with a creativity, this becomes a home
content: Good-sized common room with a nice view out to Psafe side of Whitman (holla at your boy). It may not look like you can debunk, but there is space-- we unbolted the wardrobes to make room. We also moved 2 dresser-drawers into the common room.  The bedroom on the right when you walk in is bigger so race your roommates to town. The bedrooms are really cozy debunked and it's worth it. Girls and guys bathroom almost ridiculously close!!
draw_time: it was lower middle, most of our favorite quads had been taken

content: This room is super great-- Idk what the other people went through, fire safety came a normal amount of times. 2 decent sized doubles and a single and a great sized common room. One of the double's L shape is kinda annoying, but you can finesse it. No major bug problems. Downside is that there is no bathroom on that floor.

The room is extremely spacious and in a great location. It is right across from the girl's bathroom, so this is a good single for a girl. only downsides are that the radiators can be extremely noisy at times, and since this room is at the heart of campus, people walk nearby to get to the Street, so it is incredibly noisy Thursday-Saturday. If you don't mind a bit of noise, it's a great room!

summary: Terrible set up, and bugs too
content: This room was not what I saw based on the floor plan. It is significantly smaller and the closet takes up lots of space. Bathroom is far away
Solid choice, good location, right next to study room and across from the kitchen. A bit on the smaller end, but all Butler rooms are pretty much the same

In terms of location, this room is phenomenal. Easy access to two staircases, right near trash (but not next to it), study room and elevator at end of the hall, one floor above printer and laundry, two floors above the kitchen. The North side of Scully is a lot closer to campus than you might think. The two half-bath setup was great. Fairly sizable rooms. If circumstances were right, would absolutely live here again!
draw_time: Midway through junior times for upperclass draw.

summary: Meh room, made better from circumstance
content: You're not going to choose this room unless your draw time sucks, so I'm sorry about that. But my draw group were able to all get rooms next to each other on the hall, so it was nice to have friends nearby. Also, somehow my roommate and I ended up as the only guys on the entire floor (the nunnery is the adjacent hallway), so we pretty much had the men's bathroom (which was right across from our room) to ourselves. Positives are that this part of the building has fairly easy access to the Main Inn and the Annex laundry room. You still have a nice view of the golf course/grad college and there's less activity in this area. With all of the furniture on the walls there was a surprising amount of space in the middle of the room, but by no means is this room spacious. Negatives are that it's inconvenient to go to throughout the day; but you must already know that as a Forbesian. Oh and we had ants in the room for most of the year which was annoying, but not a huge deal.
draw_time: Bottom of second to last page

summary: the circus is lit roll thru
content: dope room, 10/10 recommend. private bathroom is clutch, tons of windows so good natural lighting, big common room makes for solid team pregames. we had mega bunk beds and there was very little room in the bedroom but who cares. hang out in the common room fools!

It is a smaller single for upperclassmen but it is very live-able. I have a double bed in here with drawers underneath all the dorm furniture and a mini fridge and there is still plenty of room to walk around. I put my dresser in the window alcove and store cases of water next to it. The walls are slanted slightly on one side of the room but it does not affect where you would put your bed and there is still plenty of wall space. The BEST THING about this room is that it is RIGHT next to the girls and boys bathroom. Small so you wont really have people hanging out in there but not too claustrophobic.

summary: probably one of the worst rooms in forbes :)
content: this room is very small. the hallway bathroom only has one shower, but i've never really had to wait to shower before. cinder block walls, you can see the golf course but the view isn't amazing or anything. there's nothing explicitly wrong with the room, but it's just not great because there are absolutely 0 perks to it. i found that after i drew this room i spend much more time on campus and rarely any time hanging out in my room as i did last year

This room is super nice. One of the singles is a lot bigger than the others and I lived in that one. the ceilings were super high, i was able to fit a couch and a tv in my room and still have a lot of floor space. definitely pick this room. there is a laundry room on our floor and also an elevator if you don't want to climb the stairs
draw_time: first quad draw time for freshmen

content: Nice room, nice size. Great closet space. First floor is a great location and location to the dining hall is ideal. The only drawback is the delivery trucks coming in to Wu. However, you'll get used to the noise. All in all, a good room, would recommend.
This room is so spacious and beautiful. It has four windows overlooking walker courtyard with a fireplace and open closet. Probably the best room I'll live in all four years here.

We had a poor draw time for Junior year, but were pretty happy with this room at first because it is possible to de-bunk in both rooms. However, one room is much smaller than the other, so if you debunk, you have to get rid of your drawers which was not great. The common room is very nice; we moved out two of our desks and had a sweet setup. Bathroom is clean. No bugs. 

Worst thing about this room is the CREAKINESS AND THINNESS OF WALLS!! You can literally hear every footstep, every creak, every door closing from upstairs, downstairs and next to you.There were nights me and my roommates couldn't sleep because of how creaky and noisy it is. And we are right next to the stairs in the entryway, so you can hear everyone entering and walking/running upstairs super clearly. Can say with certainty that I hated living here.

summary: Two rooms, Debunked Bedrooms, Big Common Room, Great Location
content:
Would choose again.
You can debunk the bedrooms (slightly small) and bring the desks to the Common Room. Can easily host like 8 people in the common room for a party. Laundry is right downstairs, Dillon is 30 seconds away.

Only reason for 4 stars is that the bedroom is kind of small, can get loud, and walls are quite thin. But in general, definitely go for it
Nice size, nice closet, good windows. Bathroom and laundry are in the basement, but not a big deal. Only downside is that it's next to a main thoroughfare for delivery trucks to Wu/Wilcox.

This room is probably one of the worst rooms you can get on campus. It's tiny, poorly lit, can't see the golf course because there are big trees in your way. The walls are cinderblock and very thin such that you can hear literally everything. It's also so far from the rest of campus. You're in this room because you had a crappy draw time tho, so it's not like you have a choice. Have fun hahaha (you're not going to; I hated my sophomore year time spent in this room)
Really good room - one room is way bigger but really nice overall. We got this as the last quad in spoon.

summary: Great room, but with some minor drawbacks
content: Obviously this room is awesome, since it's big and has a sweet view. However there were a couple of small things that I wish I had known previously. For one, be prepared to hear everything from the room above you, as the ceilings offer little to no sound proofing. If 517 plays music, you are now also listening to music. Also, we were unable to debunk our beds (although I've heard people have been able to do it in the past). That being said, having bunked beds was not nearly as bad as I thought it would be. The bedrooms are small so I didn't spend much time in their anyways, and the common room makes up for it. Though Rocky has no air conditioning, if you open all the windows you get a great breeze!
draw_time: We had the first quad draw time

content: Has nice space for everyone, but it's a little awkward to have people go in and out of the double room if they're going to the single.  Has nice closet space and shelves and cabinets as well!
draw_time: Pretty good; 2nd or 3rd page I believe?

content: The double faces out onto the street, so at night, you have to be careful to keep your blinds down. The common room feels small compared to the double. Overall, it was a nice set-up. The women's bathroom is right across the hallway, and it feels like the bathroom is only for this bedroom. Overall, a pretty nice room.
5/5 would recommend - chill junior room
Whoever's living in this room from 2017-2018 is soooooooo lucky. Wow wish I could be them
Technically small, but fit everything I needed. Rearranged the room to have the bed closer to the window, but central-campus, no bugs, generally thick walls, and cozy.

I stayed in this room over the summer, so I can't speak to the full academic year. The room is pretty decently-sized for a single, and definitely has room for other (small) furnishings in addition to those provided. It's very conveniently located directly across from a women's bathroom, just above the kitchen and laundry room, and a 30-second walk to the U-Store. However, it is also right on University Place, so there is a ton of street noise for most of the day, and there's a large non-functional radiator against one of the walls that limits the number of possible furniture configurations. Also, note that there's no door in the closet.
Cute single in Holder overlooking the path out to Nassau. Good size, cozy space - would recommend!

To echo the other review, the shape of this room makes it very difficult to arrange furniture and have living space. We do have the beds debunked, but we have very little floor space. The "nook" does hold a desk well, which is nice, but definitely not as big as square footage would make you think. Nice view of the golf course and the private bathroom is nice!

Picked this room over a lot of rooms in the main inn. It’s super spacious and really nice for having privacy but still getting to live with someone. Especially good option if all the singles are gone by your draw time. Only complaint is being next to the bathroom and hearing literally everything through the wall. Small price to pay for such a good room though!

Don't let people fool you, the main inn rooms are not objectively nicer than the annex. This room is pretty small and oddly shaped with lots of corners, making it hard to arrange furniture and feel like you have living space. Be prepared to have your desk in the nook. They turned off the air-conditioning within a few weeks of school starting (and it was still upper 80s!!!). The closets are nice, maybe somewhat smaller than the wardrobes. Randomly popcorned walls make it hard to hang things. Shared bathroom can be a pro or con depending on your situation. Nice view of golf course, windowsill was very roomy, great for plants!

This room isn't bad! It's long and thin, so just know that there's no chance you'll fit any extra furniture in it. There's a kind of weird ac unit sticking out of the wall in the corner which makes it a bit difficult to rearrange, but that's ok! One person will have their desk at a bay window and one will be at a corner window, but both are honestly pretty good. There's plenty of space in here for two people, but definitely not for any additional furniture or too many guests.
draw_time: Average- our two other draw-mates got the last two singles in Whitman

content: Seriously the worst if you can't sleep past the sound of an alarm (i.e. the dump trucks the others mentioned).  I was forced into this room and have been trying to leave ever since.  Everything they said is accurate.  That said, if you can sleep through *extreme* noise, the five windows are nice for cooling in the early fall and late spring.

Bedrooms are nice, especially with the bump-outs/bubbles in the rooms. All the furniture can fit in the bedrooms, so you can do essentially whatever you want to with the common room which isn't that big, but enough to put in a couch and a few other fun loungy chairs. We really lucked out with this room, as it was the last bubble quad left with our shit draw time. Highly recommend!
draw_time: 2nd to last page of sophomore draw (this was the last bubble quad left)

content: Overall a great room, the common room is massive but awkwardly laid out... there's plenty of space, you just have to be creative. The beds really do have to be bunked in the bedrooms, though, unless you're willing to be really squished. Good sized closets in each of the bedrooms plus an extra closet in the common room, which is awesome. A cool entry hall with some hooks for jackets as well.
draw_time: I missed room draw, so this room was randomly assigned to me.

content: This triple combo is pretty clutch - you get a very decent common room, bigger than most in Joline I think, and one lucky roommate gets a single. We hosted plenty of pre-games, comfortable for 25 people if you move your furniture around. The double is also de-bunkable.
Honestly just a good room overall. The slanted ceilings are fun and the bedrooms are pretty big- it's totally possible to unbunk, you just have to put one of the beds under the windows.
room is pretty small, but bed is debunkable if you remove one of the closet doors. Large and nice bathroom, AC and heating controls. Not the best room in the world but you can make it work.

This room is literally so convenient to live in. I would recommend this room for an all girl quad just because the girls bathroom is a few steps away, and you have to go outside to access the boys bathroom. The laundry room and water fountain are also extremely close to the room. You will have to go outside and into the second half of the building to access the garbage shoot, but thats not too inconvenient if you take it out in shifts every week. The room itself has two bedrooms and a common room, yet it is surprisingly spacious. Don't expect to do too much decorating though in the bedroom, especially if you came from a single or double where you had more space for cute things. Beds are bunked and can't be unbunked. I'd say stick to simplicity and this room will work out fine. The bedroom that is to the right of the door is the best one because it has two armoires and two drawer units. The one directly straight ahead of the entrance is unfortunate because it has two bars for hanging clothes, but they're out in the open. The room still has two drawer units though. I would say people with the most stuff should have the room to the right. The common room is a nice size for living and doing day to day things. Its a good postgame room, maybe not a good pregame room. We have a couch and table in addition to the desks. One issue is that there is not an outlet for every desk. If you have the desk closest to the door of the bedroom to the right of the entrance, be prepared to run an extension cord/powerstrip along the floor so you can have a place to plug in your electronics. Also, being on the first floor means that if you want privacy, you're gonna have to keep the shade down on those bedroom windows. However, the natural light is a wonderful addition to the common room.
draw_time: Mediocre...almost trash. Like 3rd to last page.

content: Lot of great times with the boys in this room. Solid sized common room, we had big couch fitting 4/5 people, two desks for working and one as tv stand, and two mini fridges in the common room. Bedrooms are about the same size so the person in the single is much luckier.

Great room, really spacious and clean. More than enough room for a single. Only complaint is that heater would bang sometimes but I think that happens in all of 1901 (also happened very infrequently). Lived here junior year but would consider living here again because it was such a pleasant experience.

Pretty good. No bugs, if you keep it clean. Temperature is always mild. You live near a really nice RGS. 

Small - make sure you get along with your roommate. 

Really bad con - no girl's bathroom nearby. There's one around the corner and one directly above.

summary: Lots of noise, small, but very warm
content: If you are a light sleeper/hate noise, this is not the room for you. You hear all the doors in the hallway (the entrance door and two doorways leading to the hall/stairway), the people in the study room next door, and the elevator. BUT, if you're like me and don't care about noise, it's a fine spot! It's on the smaller side, but the great thing about that is it gets warm and cozy in the room.
draw_time: I placed into this room midway through the year.

summary: I got it as a double-- it was awesome
content: super spacious, great lighting, good location, hard-wood floors and a small balcony. Loved this room. You can also have someone in the common room which still works pretty well.

Pretty standard one room single. One window, with views of trees, New South, Dinky Bar, people walking to Forbes, and McCarter Theater. Right next to the stairs, but one hallway's walk from the bathroom. Nice sophomore option.

summary: Will be a little crowded as a Quad but a decent room overall
content: The biggest plus is the bathroom and the washbasins being in separate rooms. The common room is average sized but the two dorm rooms may be a little cramped if you don't move your desks out.

summary: Good room, basically on Nassau Street, would recommend
content:
I liked this room. It wasn't very big and was a little bit of an odd shape but I managed to fit my full size bed in here comfortable. The best part about this room was that during the time I was staying in it, every other person apart from myself and one other were guys and hence the small bathroom, which locked from the inside (E.g locked the whole room, shower included) became somewhat of a private bathroom.
I would recommend this room, it is close to Nassau Street which I liked a lot. Holder is a good place to live and since most of the other rooms on the floor are singles aswell it wasn't too loud.

I was weirded out by the common room space before living there but it's actually great because people can study in one half while other people are chilling in the other. Had a bit of a spider problem when we were in there but it honestly wasn't that bad. Great room!

Common room is large but it's hard to utilize the space because the room is shaped really weird. There's one very small bedroom and one nice bedroom with a bay window. It's on the first floor so you have to be okay with people just seeing into your room, especially since the common room window looks directly onto the door of entryway 6. Perk: there are two stairs in the room, which is cool for like the first month.
draw_time: Middle of the second page for rocky

summary: Literally the best room in Princeton, probably
content: This room is exceptional, especially if you're male since the bathroom is down half a flight of stairs. It's got a lovely bay window and the room is shaped so you effectively have three different living spaces if you parse it properly. Also this room has the claim to probably the best amenity of any room at Princeton - a balcony with a railing (okay technically it's just the roof but it's awesome and the railing will make you feel protected from falling) overlooking Holder Courtyard that is downright beautiful. Good for a summer night under the stars or a wonderful parapet for wintry snowball fights. Literally the best room at the university. Should be a straight-up priority for any rising soph. ALSO there's an elevator. It's PHENOMENAL.
draw_time: Pretty good, but nobody wanted this room

summary: Not as bad as you'd think
content:
First off the pros of this room. The location is actually not horrible. It's right next to the entrance to the annex next to the bike racks so it's really close to the wa. If you cut across the small gap to the nearest entryway, the walk to the dhall isn't too bad and would be worse if you lived in the left wing of the annex. It's quiet. No one really pregames here. 

Cons: It's hot. The heat is for some reason really high. Three flights of stairs every time you leave. Because it's the island the 2nd/3rd floors don't connect to the rest of the annex. The nearest kitchen is kinda far. The cold air isn't really that effective in the heat. The wall is slanted on one side. 

All in all, if you are reading this you are probably at the bottom of the draw time like I was. This room is definitely better than other rooms because it's directly up from the entryway closest to the bikeracks. Best room in this hallways among all the ~180 sq ft rooms. I'd give it 2.5 stars if I could.

Clean, nice amenities, air-conditioning, private bathroom, +common space. Great location (right next to a kitchen, which is part of the reason why we chose it). Common room is a bit small if you’re coming from 8-person or 6-person suites, but still fits two couches, two desks, + mini-fridge nicely. Room setup = 2 doubles + bathroom + common room. As the previous reviewer said, the ‘bubbles’ are cool and great for storing other things :D
draw_time: ~halfway down Butler draw list—we were the last juniors to get a Butler room!

content: Nice B)

You will sacrifice bedroom space for living space, but the common room is worth it. Incredible space, we fit 3 couches, 3 tvs, and several tables/desks in the room easily. If you can find a group of 6, go for this room.

summary: Huge common room and great location
content: See title. Rooms can both be unbunked with some creativity, but that requires all four desks to be in the common room. Probably one of the better locations on campus - really close to Prospect Ave. Can get noisy on Thurs and Saturday nights from people going to the street. Laundry unfortunately requires going outside, but the 1903 lounge is really nice. Right across from a girl's bathroom
draw_time: ~1/3 the way down Junior draw list

summary: Spacious, but not good if you are a light sleeper
content: The room is very spacious. I easily fit a futon in addition to the furniture that started in the room. Lots of closet space. There is a ceiling bike rack. Drawback is definitely  the noise. Trucks come to the dinning hall on an off all day with the earliest ones coming in at ~5am and going throughout the morning. I typically sleep like a log so it wasn't a problem but there were a couple of nights when it was pretty miserable because I couldn't sleep. Super convenient location otherwise.

largest single in spoon
elevator noise might bother soon people but idc
bathroom, kitchen and laundry around the corner is amazing
HUGE common room! Love the lighting and window seating. Had a great time here!

This room is perfect in so many ways. It's close to the kitchen, laundry, printer, and several entryways. It gets a lot of sunlight even though it's in the "basement" level. The bedroom is cozy but large enough so that you can unbunk both beds in that room. The common room is spacious when both beds are in the bedroom; we had a futon, both desks, and a lot of open space. The ceilings are really high (higher than they are in rooms on other floors of little). The fact that it's tucked away in a little corner means it's never noisy. Definitely grab this room if you can!!
draw_time: Near the end for independent room draw

summary: overall great time but tiny bedrooms
content: location of brown is so prime, it's close to the eating clubs, it's pretty far up the hill, dillon gym is right there (i've exercised so much more this year!). common room is really big and spacious with lots of windows and natural light, the downside of this room is that the bedrooms are reallllly small. both of our rooms managed to unbunk the beds, but for one room there's basically a foot of space between the two beds and for the other one the closet is blocked by one of the beds. makes for a fun quad though and brown is just a good time overall
draw_time: page 39 or 40 /47 i think? definitely first half of juniors

content: If you want a single at any cost, this is the way to go. Protip: put your dresser in the closet so you have more room.

It ended up being a pretty good room for me, but I think it's really only because I got lucky. Only two of us lived in this triple, so I was able to get a whole room to myself. I lived in the room that otherwise would have been the double, and having two people in there would be super cramped. You can debunk the beds, but there's really not a lot of space once you do. Pretty good closet space though. The rest of Lockhart had a major problem with cockroaches, but we got lucky and never spotted any in our room. The men's bathroom is right outside, but unfortunately the women's bathroom is upstairs. Lockhart does have a laundry room and a kitchen which was nice, no printer though. The ustore is so close, it was both incredible and also terrible for my health.
This room is spacey and conveniently located. The downside is it's not sound proof, but it's one of the best rooms in Wilson except for Wilcox.

Pros: close to women's bathroom (one on either side of hall), close to hot water and water fountain, big walk-in closet

Cons: if you are a light sleeper, this is not the best room. Although walls are thick and you can't hear neighbors, you can hear basically everything outside. Also, pregames upstairs can get really loud. Not the biggest single but its cozy.
No problems with bugs, decently sized common room. The single faces into the courtyard and can be loud on nights out. The radiator would sometimes make loud clanging noises.

We picked this room cause it was listed as one of the biggest triples and looked really good on the floor plan, but when we got there we found out renovations happened that weren't on the floor plan so its now an average/small triple. The single is tiny with average double and common room.
Pretty fine as far as 3 room doubles go, but the slanted ceilings make the effective square footage way less than listed amount

This room is great for two people who kind of want singles, but don't want to completely isolate themselves. It is not as convenient as the rooms that have a separate toilet and shower bathrooms (like Scully 268), but it's a good spot within the building.
The location is very convenient for sports, eating clubs, and Wawa (praise be).  You'll grow to love the air conditioning and private bathroom -- trust me. One bedroom is significantly larger, however, so be prepared for a slightly awkward move-in day. After that, it's a great set up.

summary: Great room, set it up like 3 single
content: Title says it all. Bathroom is downstairs, which is annoying, but you'll survive. Patton is prime location on campus, too. You'll grow to love the table outside the entryway -- great spot to hang out on late summer nights.

The common room is very large and easily customizable. There is a bench and ample room for a couch. The bedrooms are small, one moreso than the other. While the beds are debunkable, space is still tight. In the small bedroom, the light from the U-store shines through at night, and in the larger bedroom, the window is on the first floor, which is not ideal. Even so, most of the time spent in this room is spent in the common room rather than the bedrooms, so it's not too big of a deal.
draw_time: 12:30; second to last page of the draw list.

content: Great room! Really spacious and sun-lit. The only downsides would be the location on the fifth floor, which makes it quite a trek up (especially if you do laundry - that's six stories to climb), and that gets really really warm at the beginning and end of the school year. The girls bathroom is also a floor down, which could be inconvenient at times. Other than that, love how it's set up, with a nice nook for the bed and plenty of extra wall-space for any additional furniture or decorations you might need. Lighting might get dim (as with any dorm room) so get your own lamps! Would live here again!
draw_time: Not so good in Mathey draw as a junior

content: right next to womens bathroom, laundry right downstairs, in henry courtyard with all your friends. Can debunk beds in the double
Standard Scully single. Enough space to be very comfortable. Across from printer and not far from the co-op kitchen if you're into that.
get this room if you can
Really a great room, but far from the bathroom and the elevator is loud when it dings.
This is a great room as a single! I think the L-shape of the room compartmentalizes it very well, and it has lots of closet space.

summary: dont live here if you have a choice
content: do not live here if you don't want to sleep with 4 people in a tiny room. so happy to leave the bunker
draw_time: we got the last room in room draw

content: I absolutely loved this room, given the general conditions of Mathey/Joline. The only thing that really killed me was the fact that it's an irregular shape. It can get loud because it's by the street, but nothing I lost sleep over. Such a fantastic 3-room double! 10/10 would recommend.
draw_time: Very/pretty good depending on who you ask

content: This room is oddly shaped. It's got two triangle rooms and a tiny square room in the middle. Upside is everyone gets their own room, but there's no common space. It's kind of cool to say you live in a tower. Overall it's kind of small, but it's cozy!

Pros: We were able to convert this triple into 3 singles by putting a curtain on the hallway for the third room. Worked perfectly. However, curtains are a fire-safety violation so make sure to put them down before fire inspections. 
Also right next to the elevator, great building location, and laundry in the building basement.  

Cons: One of the rooms is much smaller than the other two. Men's bathroom is one floor up.

This room seems good on paper but the area was renovated to make room for a storage closet so the room is much smaller than 457 sq feet. Otherwise it's ok for a 3 room triple but there are much better options out there.

Not a bad room but the windows open DIRECTLY near the parking space where the cleaning/maintenance trucks back up everyday in the morning. They are insanely loud and WILL wake you up every morning at 5 am without fail. I had extremely shitty sleep quality for an entire year. 10/10 would not do it again. Good square footage though.
This room is great. It's spacious, has a closet with a door, is right next to the women's bathroom, and looks out on a tree. You couldn't ask for more.

The bedrooms are both pretty big - one is clearly bigger than the other, but both are big enough to have both beds debunked, and fit all the rest of your furniture (desk, shelf, dresser, etc.) in them, leaving the common room open for other things. The common room has a staircase INSIDE the room, which is cool, but also severely limits the floor space of the common room. The stairs lead to the 4th floor (the room is on the 5th floor of Holder), where there's just a door leading to the hallway. The room is kind of confusing/annoying to get to - it can be hard for people to find sometimes due to weird numbering of nearby rooms and multiple doors/staircases in the general vicinity. Closest men's bathroom is on the 3rd floor, and closest women's bathroom is on the 2nd floor. Elevator only goes from entrance 2A of Holder up to the third floor - you have to take the stairs the rest of the way. Overall a good room - if you host pregames/do other things in the room, there's very little chance of your RCA or P-safe seeing/hearing/smelling it from outside. Not too many bugs in the room - I've only seen 2 cockroaches this year so far.
draw_time: Lower middle - page 4 out of 6 of Rocky draw

summary: Not bad, but could be better
content: A lot of the square footage for this room comes from the super long, narrow hallway, which is mostly unusable except for bookshelves. The common room is pretty decently sized, and we were able to fit 2 couches, a TV and a table pretty comfortably with the 4 desks in the room. The view from the windows is pretty nice, and when it's sunny out the common room gets a lot of good light. The bedrooms are pretty small and can't be unbunked, and there isn't too much storage space. Henry can get pretty loud, but it can be a fun place to be if you know a lot of people in the building. The good thing with the 1st entryway is that laundry and kitchen are just right down the stairs. Overall it's a good room, but nothing spectacular, mostly just taking away points for the bedrooms.
Wasted an average draw spot on it.  Outlets don't work and walls are thin so you can hear neighbors.

summary: great Bloomberg single, very close to elevator
content: a decent-sized Bloomberg single. It's right next to an elevator, which is convenient but if you are awakened very easily the sound of people using it might be bothersome (it wasn't for me). Also very close to a laundry room and both the men's and women's bathrooms. There are three windows with ledges that face Poe field.
draw_time: a decent draw time for juniors (I had a group value of 2.2)

content: Great room with bump-outs, private bathroom, and common room big enough to fit 2 futons

One very large bedroom, one very small bedroom, and one medium-size common room. Overall was quite a good pick, especially considering our draw time.

Both male/female bathrooms are very close, and the kitchen and laundry are only a few steps away. Overall a very decent room.

-1 Star for the three roaches that lost their lives at our hands!

This is honestly doesn't have to be too bad of a room. The view of the golf course is nice and the sun exposure is lovely. Unfortunately, the roof leaked all spring term despite several attempts to fix it. The leak was directly above my bed and several feet long. I ended up sleeping with my trashcan and recycling bin to prevent the rusty water from staining my sheets too badly or causing mold.

summary: 1 room double. near bathroom. overall fine room with a good roomate.
content: fine room
draw_time: bad, 2nd to last page of freshman

content: Have enough room to get a larger bed, if you want.  There's a slant in the room that makes the effective square footage lower than it is listed.  However, the location is hard to beat, being seconds away from a printer, dining hall, laundry, etc.

summary: Kind of meh but at least it's on the 2nd floor
content:
VERY hot and humid during the first month or so, can get to 85+ degrees and literally 100% humidity. I think this is because the window faces south so the sunlight floods into the room in the late morning/afternoon. Also, it's really tiny. Like if you push your chair back from the desk, you hit the bed. Be careful, the walls are very thin so if the person living above you has loud shoes or drops their phone or if someone in an adjacent room is having a loud conversation, you can really tell. I expect most of the south-facing singles in Spoon are like this because each floor's layout is the same.

On the other hand, Spoon is a nice location for Rockefeller, and being on the second floor means you don't ever have to take the elevator which is SO slow. It was alright overall. I liked having the privacy of a single.

summary: spacious and well-located but cold and noisy
content: The heating doesn't work almost at all, so they provided mobile heaters without thermometers attached that make the room exceptionally dry. There's a small crack between the window and its frame that lets in the air outside (hot or cold) and noise from the parking lot and drunk students walking past. That being said, there are three rooms for three people, and the (boys) bathroom and (tiny) kitchen are just downstairs. Patton lounge is pretty nice.

summary: Spacious single w/ south-facing windows (sunlight in the morning)
content: A fair amount of room, bathroom, laundry, kitchen not too far away.

The room is huge, the windows are beautiful and BIG and living on the same floor as the kitchen is a big plus. Only downside is being able to hear every step the people above make. Still way worth it.
draw_time: upper middle draw time for rocky

content: Trash. Noisy because its at ground level and in front of the Feet note, really really really tiny, not enough space for 2 people and terrible architecture which makes moving furniture around nearly impossible.

summary: the footnotes are annoying as hell
content: the windows let in pretty bad draft & noise on cold days/big nights out, the hallways let in pretty bad noise @footnotes.

summary: Incredibly convenient location, room itself has some drawbacks
content: Close to two single hallway bathrooms, more central location of Edwards, and being on the 1st floor are the best features of this room, so if you care about convenience, this might be one of the best rooms in Mathey. The windowsill (and room probably) was infested with spiders and spider egg sacs at first, and I got some spider bites in the first few weeks before getting rid of the spiders, but this might not be the case in the future. If you're deathly afraid of spiders, don't pick this room. Also note that the window faces where tons of people walk by everyday, so if you want privacy and don't want to have the window shade down all the time, put up some kind of translucent window curtain or pane or something.

I was on the housing waitlist (3rd to last entry on the last page of upperclass) and got placed here, so I didn't really have a choice, but the room is decent. It's right next to the UStore, a ten minute walk to EQuad, and relatively quiet. The common room is spacious and the single is reasonably sized. The double is a bit small. Bathroom is right down the hall
I hate this room and the stairs and people being loud in the shower

I lived in this room my sophomore year and absolutely loved it! The two floors create a sense of privacy when you're in the bedroom versus when you're downstairs, and the bedrooms are very spacious. The women's bathroom is just down the hall, and you can take the elevator down to the laundry room. The only drawback would be if you don't enjoy taking the stairs to go downstairs from the bedrooms to the common room (I didn't find this to be a huge issue). It feels like an apartment; I would definitely try to go for this room if you live in Rocky!

Pretty fantastic overall.  Very little to complain about.  It's close to laundry, bathrooms, and an elevator.

Noise concerns: Trucks can be heard in the morning around 8-8:30 but can usually be ignored even to the most sensitive of ears if the windows are closed and you use earplugs.  The elevator is a bit annoying because it dings throughout the day, but this also can be blocked out with ear plugs.  It's also a little creepy to know that everyone using the elevator can hear what you're doing and vice versa.
draw_time: Special needs accommodation in the Spring Semester

content: STAY AWAY FROM THIS ROOM! TONS OF COCKROACHES!! I ended up moving out it was so bad. The exterminator came dozens of times and they still did not go away. The first night I was there, I saw about 6 large cockroaches withing the span of a few hours. The whole situation made the start of my senior year into a nightmare.
So much space and natural light... two floors!!

We split this room into common room and bedroom. You can unbunk the beds in the bedroom although it is a little cramped. Closet is very spacious though! The common room is a nice shape and pretty large; we had room for the desks plus a couch, fridge, etc. Really the only the drawbacks are the bathroom is either 1 floor up or 2 floors down, both ways down a long hallway, and you have to go to Brown or 1903 to do laundry. Room itself is nice though!
draw_time: 2/3 through the list of juniors, this was the second to last 2 room double

summary: Decent size, nice shape, balcony, close to mens room
content: It's easy to divide the room into two sections (L-shaped) and the balcony is fun. Close to the men's room but far from laundry (basement). The closets are shallow and open.

summary: Comfy but small, close to bathroom.
content: Comfy but small, close to bathroom, windows open
Biggest room out of all my friends - including a bunch of people who have doubles. Close to exit, easy to find, close to laundry and study room.

There aren't really any issues with this room, just a little small. But it's honestly a cozy room that you can fit most things in. I had a lot of stuff so it was tight, but if you arrange nicely, it'll work great!

Really enjoyed living in this room. Big double with plenty of space if you push the beds into the corners. Shared bathroom with much smaller adjacent double (will likely have to share with freshmen). Next to stairs so you will hear pretty much everything in that hallway. If you can deal with that it's probably one of the better sophomore doubles in Forbes.

Faces Dillon gym. Light fills the room in the mornings. Great if you have a hard time waking up. Directly next to the girls restroom and water fountain, but guys restroom isn't far away. Printer + Laundry room one floor down.
It's a long and skinny room with an awkward fireplace. Only half the room is lit, so studying at night isn't optimal. Great location on campus.
Overall solid room.

Awesome room. Able to debunk beds pretty easily in both bedrooms, although the bedrooms aren't huge. Common room is great: easily fit three couches, two desks, fridge, coffee table, etc. Right across from laundry room, around the corner from a men's bathroom, down the hall from a sink and a microwave. Built-in mantel shelves are a nice touch. Thermostats work! Would highly recommend.

Really nice room for junior year - big walk in closet and good amount of space but the best part was all the natural lighting that comes through. Because it's on the third floor it's also not as loud as living on the lower floors of the slums.  Printing and laundry also in the building

summary: Big ol common room, itty bitty bedrooms
content: You're getting this room for the common room, which is excellent for pregames and just to hang out in. One of the largest in Princeton. Theres also lots of windows and the turret is a good place to have board games or whatever. The room is almost unwieldy though. Its kinda long, so its a little difficult to lay things out.  We weren't able to debunk in the bedrooms though, and they're definitely very cramped, so thats the major drawback.

HUGE COCKROACHES EVERYWHERE. We were so excited to get this room, but the year was literally ruined by how many cockroaches there were. Besides facilities coming into our room regularly, we couldn't have food in our room which was a pain.  DO NOT TAKE THIS ROOM FOR THE SQUARE FOOTAGE.

summary: ANTS AND FLIES EVERYWHERE, NO HEAT, NO LAUNDRY ROOM
content:
Cons:
- Size difference. If you're considering this room, you probably already know about it though.
- No laundry in Cuyler
- You can't control the heat. It gets RIDICULOUSLY cold in the winter (maintenance will do nothing unless it's "significantly colder than other surrounding areas")
- I have not even touched on the worst problem yet:

We had a HUGE ant problem in our room. We called maintenance to fix it, but they apparently can't do anything about it and we were told not to have food in our room which was incredibly annoying. There are swarms of them in every nook and cranny, literally thousands.

The bathroom nearby is also disgusting. I'm pretty sure maintenance only cleans it once a month because someone once threw up all over the toilet and it wasn't cleaned for weeks. The sinks sometimes all fill up with mysterious liquid. We also had a sewer fly infestation in our showers. Imagine pulling back the shower curtain and seeing 100 fat flies. 

Pros:
F$cking none, the common room is pretty big I guess

TL;DR It is hard to distinguish this room from a third world country

summary: Don't be fooled -- this room is shit
content: When we got this room, we saw its reasonably large square footage number, and we figured we were getting a steal. Turns out we could not have been more wrong. The rooms are totally different sizes (you basically have to do a triple and a single if you want to debunk) which means you don't even get the benefits of lots of floor space, not to mention you're in a basement so you don't have any light, and it's freezing all year round because you have no control of the heat. Also, there's a fuckton of ants who we think are probably immune to ant poison at this point so be ready for that if for some reason you're disabled enough that you decide to choose this shitstain of a room.

THAT ONE WEIRD ROOM THAT LOOKS LIKE IT'S 684 SQ FT BUT IS ACTUALLY 468

CLICK HERE TO FIND OUT HOW TO IDENTIFY OTHER WEIRD ROOMS: https://bit.ly/IqT6zt
draw_time: AT FIRST I WAS PAGE 25 AND THEN I WAS PAGE 1 AFTER THAT ONE WEIRD TRICK

content:
The summary says it all, but the men's bathroom is on the floor above and is absolutely disgusting--there is a women's bathroom down the hall though. There are two identically sized bedrooms, and the room that acts like a double is really cramped. We managed to unbunk the beds, but there is literally no space for anything else. The heater in one of the bedrooms does not work, and the heaters in general are EXTREMELY loud. Finally, the room is in the corner on the first floor right next to an entryway so you'll hear people coming in and out of it all night long--it is VERY loud.

Probably the only positive of this room is that the common room is a decent size--that's it.
draw_time: On the second to last page

content: I really liked this room, but there's not much you can do with it in terms of furniture because it's long and skinny (so def don't think about a tigerbed). SO much great light (the window is the size of the door) and has a nice bright red brick fireplace so it has a lot of character! Super high ceilings, so it doesn't feel too small when you're actually there. Very quiet, super close to the bathroom and stairs (super low-traffic).

slightly weird shaped but not terrible. location is great (super close to ustore, and close enough to slums, but still quiet for the most part). girls br is nextdoor, but boys is nowhere to be seen. not soundproof at all really, but thats princeton housing in general.

summary: Great room, great location - double is a bit small
content: It's close to everything, it feels well-lit and spacious if you have the single. The double requires you to bunk for sure, and that can feel cramped, so you'd better be very happy with your roommate.
draw_time: About the middle of the juniors

content: We had a horrible draw time and this room was still available! It has a very large double where you can easily debunk and a single. It's a great junior year triple.

Honestly much better than expected. It's small and has an awkward layout due to the bolted down wardrobes, but it makes for a good living room/bedroom setup, or two singles setup. My roommate and I did both this year, and it made for a roomy bedroom with slightly cramped living room / study room, and the two singles also end up being super cozy (reminiscent of a Dod single). It does get really hot bc heaters are OP and you can't turn them off, but the windows are easy to open and allow for cool breezes. Walls are paper thin, but you can usually just bang back and tell them to shut up. Didn't expect much because our draw time was ass, but very happy with this room.
draw_time: Our group took the last upperclass single (84ft). As mediocre as possible.

content: Really awesome room, great location, great hallway. Noisy at night with the Street traffic. Also, it's super hard to hang anything on the walls.
Can debunk in both bedrooms, common room is relatively big - nothing wrong with it but can definitely do better in terms of size
i love it

Broskis - Loved this room
Two Room Double, both rooms are decently sized. Bathrooms right next door, (not too loud, not really an issue), living on the fourth floor is great because usually no one is there and its not too loud... Laundry is down 3 flights but that isnt too bad. No bug problem, window shade doesnt automatically go up.. The layout is superb, put a curtain up in the big room and had a little walk in entrance fron the small room into the big room. Could also both live in the small room and have a huge common room with great lighting... Snatch it if you can.
draw_time: Eh.. Mid draw but the website crashed. got SUPER lucky (we both wanted singles)

content: This is a triple the size of a quad in Mathey, which was great for pregames. We had two couches in the common room and still had space for ~25 people groups.

This room is only kinda alright if you get the single. We had to switch the double and the single because we couldn't debunk the beds cause of the weird shape.
Common room is very weirdly shaped as well so only 1/3 of it gets light from the window and the rest of the room is all dark the whole day (invest in good lamps). Also, in the double, you only get one closet so you have to share the space with your roommate.
The only good thing about this room is that the bathroom is right in front. Other than that, everything else is terrible. Plus, you have to walk out of the building to do your laundry, and there are no water fountains. Also, there was a rat in the room next door at some point in the semester. Nothing in this room though.

the reviewers below me have accurately described the room. 

some notes:
lighting is poor in half of the room. there is only one light and it's concentrated on one half of the L.
bathroom door slams and is very loud. if ppl on the floor get up early, you will know.
walls are thin. you can hear someone cough in the neighboring room.

MAD CUTE ROOM THO. L SHAPE CONDUCIVE TO HEALTHY FRIENDSHIP (SINCE YOU WILL STILL HAVE PERSONAL LIVES). BLEAK SETTING CAN BE HARNESSED FOR QUAINT SAD FEEL.
The worst room ive ever had or seen. Drew way too early, should be last room off the board -n
was amazed when this room fell to us two years ago, but in all honestly it was a joke. would never do again. worst quad in the business -n
I had this room four years ago as a junior and am literally coming back on this website just to tell you not to get this. worst experience -n
I was scared shitless every time I walked into this room in the winter. There were spiders everywhere!! We put up spider traps and nothing worked. Nice set up though, lots of singles and 1 double.
draw_time: very good, like top of the list

summary: Nice room. Everyone except two people get singles.
content: The room is spacious. Private bathroom is a plus. Some bugs but minimal issues. Minimal light from windows in common room. Overall very nice. Recommend it.

This "quad" fell to us pretty late on into junior draw time and we thought it was a steal, but ended up getting a room that we did not expect and turned out to be just terrible. Everything is cramped and the layout is awful, would not recommend. Don't be fooled by the sq ft, pass this up if you can.

summary: Decent room. Two doubles, a small-ish common room, and a bathroom.
content: fine.
draw_time: Worst rising sophomore draw time of them all

summary: Not nearly as good as it seems - would NOT recommend
content: Very bad layout to the room; at least 100 sq ft are unusable because you can't strategically fit furniture. Yeah it has four rooms, but most of my friends with 3 room quads have a much better layout. Add in the noise of Pyne, and it's a bad look. Not ideal, draw as a last resort if necessary.

summary: Good common room situation, BAD bathroom situation
content: Would recommend for those who enjoy spacious common rooms and less spacious sleeping situations. We kept our beds bunked and spent a lot of time decorating our common room so this worked out really well for us. Only downside is that the bathrooms are in the basement. Other than that, you can't really ask for much else from one of the biggest doubles in Rocky.

The 2-room doubles are so big!! If you can't get a single, get one of these. You can each have your own bedroom, or you can share and use the big room as a common room. Yes, the 4th floor involves a lot of stairs, but it's typically really quiet, and this section of the hallway has minimal foot traffic. Beware, though, that you share a wall with the bathroom...and the wall isn't soundproof.

The rooms on Edwards that are closer to Little are quieter than the ones closer to Elm, so that's a plus for this room. Sometimes the heating makes a lot of noise for unknown reasons. Men's bathroom is very close. Room is not too big but I found it cozy enough and not cramped.
Cleaning your own bathroom is an L. Make sure your roommates are clean people.  The bedrooms are very unequal in size

summary: Very good room, but fan required
content: It is a pretty decent size, although in order to get my fridge in a good spot I had to put the little shelves in the closet (which is also a good size). Beautiful view from the window, although the sun shines directly in at the beginning and end of the school year, so the room gets super hot if you don't have a fan. Be prepared to hear every arch sing ever, but at least it'll be from a room with no cockroaches!

Well. Congratulations. You've entered the Penthouse. If you're more than a page down on the draw time list, stop reading now. Frankly, your consideration is insulting. 

Good. Now we're alone. Get ready for a home that has been written in your destiny for centuries. You are about to enter one of the most exclusive rooms not only at Princeton, but in the world. 

A long, elegant hallway leads into a sunny and well-ventilated common room that will certainly drop jaws. Treat her well and she will make your life heavenly. 

Welcome to the excellence, welcome to prestige, welcome to the penthouse.

summary: Amazing single with a few drawbacks
content:
PROS: Literally right next to the kitchen. Located in a relatively quiet hallway of sophomore singles, and I rarely run into anyone using the shared bathrooms, which are pretty clean. Very spacious for a single; I think it's bigger than some friends' doubles. Enough room for a futon, fridge, and rug to sit on in the middle of the room. Besides that, it gets a good amount of natural light and has an amazing view looking over the Forbes golf course (there's even a little stream with a bridge over it!) that sometimes makes me forget I'm in a student dorm. If you stay up late doing work and look outside around 4am, you'll usually see deer grazing! You can also hear birds chirping often, which can be good or bad. It's very relaxing and gives you the feeling of a high quality of life, if that makes sense. I love coming back to my room at the end of the day or even right after class.

CONS: LOTS of bugs. This part of the annex is known for having stinkbugs. I probably run into one, dead or alive, at least every other week, although they're easy to deal with. I've found a dead stinkbug in my coat pocket before. I've also had a cockroach run out from under my blanket, which was traumatic. Also, the view onto the golf course comes at a price, since it can be pretty noisy. Lots of golf carts and grass mowers, especially on weekend mornings when I try to sleep in. Gets pretty hot during the summer since there's no AC.

All in all, I'd give it a 4.5/5.

summary: not as bad as everyone says
content: lived here and it's not terrible. I has a good amount of floor space. you don't need to bunk. the way the wardrobes are set up gives you a nice sense of privacy when you sleep. It has a nice view of the grad college and the pond.if you take bookshelves off of the desks, it makes the room feel much bigger. I put one next to the window, and my roommate used hers as a shoe organizer under her bed. there is an ant problem in the spring, and the bathroom in the hallway is gender neutral, but there are more around the corner. good luck!
draw_time: last page. sophomore, close to end of draw.

content: Pipes literally hurt me in my sleep they are so bad

Had a very mediocre draw time, probably 5/6 on draws for sophomores. It's sub free, which is why some people might not want it. It is a little bit tight, so we put our beds along the wall and stacked the bookshelves on top of the dressers. Way more space if you do that. The private bathroom is also quite large, which is a nice plus.

If you have this room you better treat her RIGHT. Ole Murl isn’t for everybody. If you weirdly drew into this double without knowing the ppl in T304 idk what you’re doing. But if you pretend this is a quad with a quaint ~vestibule~ than yeah you know what you’re doing. You have a basically private bathroom that a very kind and nice man cleans every morning, there’s enough room to store NOT ONE but two! bikes in the hallway (vestibule), and you can yell at people in Whitman courtyard from the comfort of the tower. Comfortably fits two tiger beds, a fridge, two bean bag chairs, and a large bin of protein powder.
A good sized double, can make into a cozy space.
Everything super ideal, nice view of the field, not small at all!

Huge common room, but no AC. Easy to move in/out, because it's on the bottom floor. 
Bugs (ants, 1 cockroach), a slight problem.

Typical Butler quad. One of the doubles is slightly larger than the other, but they're both decently sized. Right across the hall from the lounge and around the corner from the kitchen and study rooms. Also, the elevator takes you right down to studio 34

summary: Best room in Forbes if you have a friend in 301
content: Great room.  301 is definitely significantly bigger but both rooms are great, shared bathroom was super convenient -- really no complaints.  302, the smaller room is somewhat hard to organize just because of there being something on every wall so it's hard to decide where to put the bed.

It's definitely one of the smaller singles in Wilson but the room is almost a perfect square making it seem a lot bigger than other rectangular singles. There is a giant walk-in closet that gave me enough storage space to not have to loft my bed. The heater is either pretty hot or not hot at all, which is a little annoying in the winter time. Once you close the heater completely it takes some time for it to reheat (like 1.5 days), so I recommend turning it to a low during breaks/time away from Princeton. The walls and floor are old but sturdy. Hanging things with command strips on these walls are impossible unless they are really light. It's not a bad single but you have to make it work.

Edwards is crap but the room itself is really nice. There's plenty of space, a huge closet (its basically two closets in one), a high ceiling and a nice view of some trees. However, four flights of stairs is a lot and it's quite a pain. There's only a male bathroom on the floor and the female one is 1.5 floors down.
draw_time: Very good, top quarter of the Mathey Draw

content: Beautiful view of the golf course. The light right outside the window can be bright, the heater is incredibly loud (which I sadly got used to), the walls are super thin but it's a single and that's what I wanted.
draw_time: Most of the annex singles were open; I just missed the last Main Inn single.

content: Nice room! Witherspoon recently got all the floors redone so it looks really nice. Decent sized room and decent amount of sunlight. Hall is pretty quiet, though the common rooms at the ends of the hall get kinda loud on weekends. For those who care, very few bug sitings.
draw_time: Fairly early (but there were lots of Spoon Doubles available later in the day)

content: Surprised we got this room with our bad draw time. Large, spacious common room, but tiny bedrooms. Both rooms can debunk but with very very little floor space. This is especially rough bc you can't move the wardrobes. Bathroom is upstairs which is annoying, but the location of this room on central campus makes it super worth it.

We only got a room this nice so late in the draw because it's sub-free. Common room is absolutely massive and the bay window/window seat/isolation of the room is awesome. Only downside (and it's a big one) is the bedrooms; the bedrooms, especially the bigger one, are angled really weirdly meaning that it's impossible to debunk the beds. In the bigger room, both closets can't be opened at the same time. Overall though a fun room to live in, and about the best possible situation we could've asked for from the last page of the draw. It's also very cool/unique that it has 2 doors for entry, one that leads to Entryway 1 and the other that leads to Entryway 2. It's one of only a handful of rooms on campus with this feature. 2.5 stars

Considering how late a draw time I had, this was a pretty solid room - while not  overly large, it doesn't feel at all cramped even with beds debunked. Being next door to a bathroom, above the kitchen, and only on the second floor are nice, though laundry facilities and water fountains are relatively far away and the room has a tendency to overheat at times - open windows are often necessary.
draw_time: 4th to last - this was the last available room in Holder

content: Especially if you're a quad of girls -- this room is so nicely situated. Right next to entry door, laundry room, and bathroom. Bedrooms are a little small but you can unbunk and be fine. its cozy. highly recommend.
Wonderful single. Got it as a sophomore in the freshman year draw. I fit in a couch, a fridge, and there's still extra space. Definitely above-average single in Whitman.

Pretty nice room. It's possible to debunk in both bedrooms but one is a tighter squeeze than the other. The common room isn't super huge so you might have to put a desk in the bedroom or stack bookshelves, but we have two chairs, a futon, and all four desks in the common room and it all fits. The room is right next to both bathrooms which is nice. The entryway doesn't have basement access so laundry/printing is a pain though.

summary: Nice location , looks pretty, kinda gross
content: Bad heating. Bug. Disgusting communal bathroom. But spacious and convenient. We all wanted singles but got a shitty draw time. Thankfully our preferences align quite well - I like big rooms and window while my roommates like privacy, so I made the common room my bedroom.

This room is spacious with 4 enormous singles. It feels new, has air conditioning, and a decent bathroom. There is an oddly large hallway which ends up being mostly wasted space. We wanted a common room, so two of us doubled in one of the singles and used the open single as a common room. It was a decent enough size for some couches and a TV, but nothing crazy. This room is perfect if you want to have 4 singles and no common room. If you want a nice common room, I would look into upperclassmen housing. Otherwise, this room is amazing.

This place is kind of epic. The thirty-foot ceilings make you feel like you have tons of space. The upper common room has a balcony that overlooks the lower common room. Super great for parties. The heating is broken in one of the bedrooms, in the winter it goes nonstop to the point where you have to open the window in January.

Considering this is one of the smallest singles on campus, it is very physically limited. In addition, the closet is walk-in, so it also limits what you are able to do with the space [as opposed to having an open closet with no concrete walls surrounding it]. Still, I was able to comfortably fit in all my furniture and a fridge. Keep in mind that your room is on ground level, so everyone can see inside when they walk past.
draw_time: Pretty bad - my draw time was around noon

summary: It is very spacious. Right next to 2 male bathrooms.
content: This room is exactly as advertised. I was able to fit in a sofa chair, TV and fridge, and still feel like I was not crowded at all
draw_time: I was towards the bottom of the upperclass draw.

content: Awesome room, common room is full of light with big windows. Bedrooms are pretty much the same size but not a problem if one person lives in the common room. Would recommend for juniors or seniors!

Great room, so much natural light and a pretty view of the golf course and backyard! Sometimes gets noisy when people are walking by, because the hallway noise echoes into the weird corner by the door, but not as loud as rooms down by the staircase/exit!

For the annex it's not that bad-- it has a private bath! Rooms are a double and a single so there's no common room. A little small and sometimes cold, but it's one of the only options for a suite in Forbes. The door locks on the main door, rather than on each room individually, so you can open it up and make it more like a triple.

Carpeted bedroom floors, huge common room, not over the main Wilson courtyard so not nearly as bad as could be. My only complaint is centralized heating for the building meant that facilities cut it for fall break (idk why) and I had no control over it and was v chilly. Super concerned about our quality of room bc we had such a bad draw time, but this room is the top floor of a building with an elevator and sound-insulated with the elevator and bathroom. Sounds from neither of which are super audible from inside the room. 10/10 would live here again.

This room is perfect if your main goal is having your own space. It's small, but cozy. I did not encounter any bugs or roaches, which were a huge problem my freshman year. 

There's really only 1.5 good options for furniture configuration, and definitely no room for you to bring in furniture of your own (I had a fridge but no extra chairs etc). Sound travels pretty easily from the other single that shares the bathroom. 
It's nearly impossible to hang anything heavier than a poster on the wall (hooks, frames, etc) because the paint has been layered on thick and is cracking--the stuff will fall and take paint/wall with it.

summary: Great room for those who want space
content: Two pretty large singles and two medium-sized singles. Bathroom is a little dingy (toilet sounds like a jet engine when you flush), and not great for light sleepers due to thin walls. Lack of common room also means roommates can be a little bit more separate than a normal Butler quad, but all in all it's a LOT of space to work with, even in the smaller rooms. Recommend!!!
Spacious; girl's bathroom is on the 2nd floor but men's bathroom is close, heater acts up occasionally

You can unbunk in both rooms, and the bedrooms are pretty equal in size.  Common room is small, but there is a pretty window seat, we added a cushion and it functioned as a couch.  Really good lighting and Holder has printers/ kitchen.  The bathroom is a hike, but it's a nice room for a bad sophomore draw time (esp. if you don't want to bunk).
draw_time: Very bad draw time as a sophomore.

content: This is an awesome room! It is directly next to the women's bathroom, but there is not really much noise from the hallway. There is a really nice window seat and a HUGE closet. Also lots of outlets and close to the laundry room. It is a relatively quiet location because it does not face the courtyard, so there is a lot of privacy. Great room to have as a junior!

This room is not a bad pick for sophomore draw. The room itself is really nice, and most of the drawbacks come from the Edwards building itself. The room is pretty big and has a huge closet. It also has a beautiful view and lots of privacy. The main downfall is that it is really high up (five to six flights of steps) with no elevator, and the laundry, printing, etc. are in the basement.
