Moving in and out is awful. The women's bathroom is also far away. The building's heating system is super old, so there is loud clanging in the walls whenever it turns on. However, if you want a single, this room is a good size and was nice enough that I would still choose it over living with a roommate.

summary: Big Single, near mens bathroom. above kitchen.
content: pyne has cockroaches and lots of parties

This room is spacey and generally quiet. It's super close to the U store and Nassau St. If you're a girl it's convenient to go to the bathroom, but usually you won't hear the noise there if you're in your room. The only downsides are sometimes guys use women's bathroom and if there's an arch sing at Blair Arch, it gets noisy at night.

Five singles, one double. Rooming arrangement worked out perfectly. It's on the first floor, so no need to climb the stairs everyday. Right next to Wilcox. Only cons are: no A/C, laundry is across the courtyard, spiders/bugs, and it's sub-free. Other than that, really cozy and quiet. A really fun room if you room with all the right people!

summary: Good room. Bathroom on the same floor. Enough space for tigerbed.
content: Pretty solid room, would recommend.
quiet, AC, near studio, private bathroom!!

Looking at the floor plans, you can see that the room is next to the laundry room, but the laundry machine noise never bothered me. Also, you may be worried that the "hallway" in the room may take up a lot of space. There is a notch in the wall where the wardrobe fits snugly. The rest of the room is very big (even with a tigerbed), so don't worry about space. Also one of the walls of the room is composed entirely of windows (which can be blinded), so the view is very nice.

this was such a promising room but we had to deal with the SERIOUS drainage problems all year. because it was next to the bathroom, and obviously holder is old, we had to deal with psafe coming into our room so late at night so many times because water was spilling from the ceiling. disappointing and stressful

summary: Serious Drainage Problems!!! Not worth your time
content: This room was terrible. Even though the size was great we deal with so many water leakage issues from the bathroom next door. There were several times where the water leaked in the middle of the night and we would wake up with water on our clothes and the floor. Unfortunately my experience in this room was remarkably unpleasant.
do not live in witherspoon if you like sleeping before 12 from thursday to sunday!!!! im serious, pregames here are ~intense
draw_time: amazing, wish I drew into holder

content: ok so AMAZING room, really good common, but TINY AF sleeping rooms. as someone who lived in a quad my freshman year, i really wanted more breathing room in the sleeping space. better for people who are super neat and clean, if you're messy, don't do it–– you'll get overwhelmed. obviously common room was beautiful.

The massive fireplace sticks out like 2 feet from the wall which makes desk and furniture placement so annoying. The doorknob fell off of the closet. The wooden floor has caused everyone in the room to get at least one splinter. There are rusty nails sticking out of the ground. The ceiling plaster falls on me in my sleep. Also the bathroom is down 2 flights of stairs and the laundry is in Joline. The room is spacious, but good god at what cost.

Room is honestly pretty good. Its a bit on the small side in terms of Bloomberg singles, but it's more than fine if you arrange the furniture well. I've put my desk up against the windows, my bed + wardrobe on one wall, and then my dresser + bookshelf against the other. I also have a minifridge and chair in here for reference. The room's close enough to the bathrooms + laundry machine so it's super convenient, but you don't ever hear showers/toilets flushing!

The Shire's best feature is certainly the common room. There are 3 bedrooms, two of which are pretty large and one of which is tiny. Just hope you don't get the tiny one. The bathroom gets pretty nasty but is quite large. Large population of Wilson bugs, but they're friendly.

Hi I lived in Forbes first two years, had to move closer to campus. Love being close to the Equad and Frist and Eating Clubs. Right near the boys and girls bathrooms which is awesome. Super pretty view with a window seat. may the odds be ever in your favor.
^rt on the review written before w/ pros and cons list. No problems with bugs or anything, plenty of space

Pros: 3 room double and good location on campus, right next to women's bathroom
Cons: Patton doesn't have AC or control over heating, the individual rooms are not that big, and if you are in the bedroom on the side closer to the bathroom sometimes you can hear people talk :/

Good room, but like the other commenter said, the AC makes a loud noise every once in a while and you have to keep your blinds closed most of the time. Also there is a small archway between the room and the laundry room. So to get there, you need to either leave the building for a few seconds or go up a floor and back down

Never had an issue with any bugs like other people in dod may have had, great location, only thing for guys if you're looking at this room is that the mens bathroom is down the hall while the ladies is across from our door lmfao 

also the water fountain (right outside) had really low water pressure our year. Otherwise GREAT
good room, able to fit a decent sized couch and can de bunk both beds. the storage space is not optimum but it does everything it needs to
If this room is available during your draw time and you don't pick, you're just straight up ignant.

Disappointed in this room. First, the square footage isn't correct. It is a lot smaller than what is listed. Second, it is impossible to sleep. The radiators go off just about every night and sound like they are about to explode. There is also always construction outside the room and the walls are so thin that you can hear everything. Finally, there are an absurd amount of bugs. Cockroaches, weird caterpillar things, spiders, and more. Would not recommend.
Absolutely loved this room - great view with amazing sunlight coming in the morning. Very big common room (though small bedrooms) and no bugs as it is on the top floor.

This room is pretty nice, even for being in the Annex. It's a spacious single, about the size of my double in Forbes last year (at least it felt like that) and this room actually has two dressers for some reason, which is nice if you have lots of clothes. There were some ants at the beginning of the year in the Annex, but I bought some ant traps and they were never an issue again. The only major downside is the lack of AC. The heat is fine, in fact, it is really strong sometimes, so you'll never get cold. But when it gets super humid early in the school year or late in the school year, you may have to leave your windows and door open to get a breeze to pass through. Also, the rooms are super thin, so if you have a promiscuous neighbor, you're gonna be hearing all the details, unfortunately. Overall a great room, plenty of space, sub free, would recommend. Just bring a fan and some earplugs!

summary: Big Single with nice sized closet right next to the bathroom.
content: I loved this room. I easily fit an entire full sized couch plus two additional "bowl chairs" inside. Being on the top floor you have high ceilings which make the room feel even bigger. While the stairs are annoying you definitely get used to them. Great central location on campus as well. Only downside is taking the stairs for laundry and printer.
The room isn't super big, but it is a single and I arranged in a way that leaves me enough space to host and stuff.
draw_time: Draw opened at 10, I was at 10:19

content: Had this room my freshman year and it was dope. Go visit your friends in Wilson and realize how lucky you are to have SPACE. it is huge, no common room (not like anyone would come to forbes to have a party anyway) but the little hallway is good for big winter coats and wet shoes. Private bathroom, space, quiet, could turn into a 1 room quad and 1 room party room but not worth it in my opinion
the best room ever

summary: If you're into steel drums + traffic, this is your room
content: Huge single, huge walk-in closet that fits all my clothes and more. Plenty of space for books and even a coffee table. However, the sound of Elm Drive traffic and, in the winter, the radiator is pretty consistent, oftentimes annoying. You get used to the stairs - move in/move out is the only part that's difficult.
draw_time: Middle of rising sophs - not bad, not good

content: Each bedroom is exactly the same size, so not conducive for doubling up. We made it into a 3 room triple by putting a bed in the common room, which is definitely the best way to do it. There's a cozy nook for your desk if you take the common room. The bathroom is kind of a pain (downstairs and down the hall) but it's really convenient being on first floor. Also, walking through the arch to get to your room never gets old. Cuyler courtyard is really pretty. The bathrooms get kind of gross as everyone in the hall uses them, but oh well. Laundry in Brown is also kind of a pain but we survived, it wasn't too bad. Overall pretty decent considering our draw time

I was in this room last year. There is a common room, and two small  bedrooms. One bedroom has 2 closets, and the other has 1 closet. The room with 2 closets however has oddly-shaped walls, so we weren't able to fit two beds there without bunking them. We decided to put those two beds in the other room, turn the room with 2 closets into a single (closets were shared), and keep the common room as a common room. The double room was a little crammed, so we put the desks, dressers, and bookcases in the common room. Common room is actually quite spacious. 

Bathrooms were not on the same floor, but other than that the building is actually not too bad. There is a computer cluster, a lounge, and laundry room in the basement.

We made the most of it but midway through the year the roof started to leak slightly and maintenance cancelled our work request so every day we had to change tape and paper towels so our beds weren't ruined. Also my desk was unusable because it was under the worst part. Also ants made it on my bed , which only got better after extensive investments in ant traps. Otherwise not bad though.
This is a great room!!! Lots of natural light + space to put furniture like a futon and a mini fridge. Also nice central location and layout.

Edwards is a great building for peace and quiet. Little to no pregames. Interesting layout – two closets, and two built-in shelf spaces... Hard to explain but it's nice – like having extra furniture. The eves are fine - no issue at all with headspace. No neighbors to the left or right and no one above is nice. 5th floor gets HOT in the Fall/Spring. 5-10 degrees warmer than the outside temperature. Get several fans and embrace the sweat. Only lasts a couple weeks, and being on the end of the 5th floor is noticeably cooler than up the few stairs near the middle. Doesn't take too long to get used to the 5 flights, although those that workout/stay physically fit will have a much easier time with it. Beautiful View all the way to the horizon.
draw_time: 1/4 to 1/2 down the list of rising sophs

content: Very spacious. Nice view of courtyard. Close to laundry and men's restroom. Dining hall is 2 floors down. Two close exits. Will miss this room!

This single was really nice, especially because it was on a corner and therefore had way more windows than the connecting one -- five windows!!! It was pretty narrow though, so there's not a lot of space to have chairs/beanbags for guests, but with some moving around, I made it work. Overall nice room especially since it's close to the computer cluster and printer. Only downsides are that Bloomberg walls are thin and walking back always made it feel like it was the farthest thing on campus.
draw_time: one of the last juniors into butler

content: Got this room off the wait list and was pleasantly surprised with 5 windows, right next to mens room. I put two dorm beds next to each other and still have plenty of space. The bathroom right next door is pretty bad even for the slums and the radiator makes a lot of noise. Overall, happy with the room.
draw_time: terrible, out of singles by my draw time

content: Couldn't be happier with this room for my junior year...for girls it's great as the bathroom is just a few feet down the hall, and the view out into the U-store courtyard is beautiful. The bed and desk can be moved around in the room from left to right, and the ledges on the side really add to the room and make it easier to place things. Overall super satisfied with the location and vibe of this room, I'll miss it!

summary: we loved it but it's not that great of a room
content: This room has a lot of character, but the set up is not ideal. We made it work though. You have to be creative if you don't want to bunk because the wardrobes are unfortunately placed and can't be moved (we had two beds pushed together for "mega-bed" and one "floor-bed" mattress on the floor with the feet under another bed). The common room is a decent size, but the hallway takes up square footage and is not very usable space. Bathrooms are right up stairs. For laundry, I think the closest is going across the street to Dod or going really far away within Little. People can see into the common room with the shades open but not into the bedrooms. It's not too loud which is nice. This room also comes pre-named which is awesome (it is carved into the fireplace). Welcome to the meatshack!

The room works fine as a single, all things considered. There is an annoying pole in the room, but you get used to it over time. Since the room is on the third floor, it's very hot at the beginning and end of the year. There are also some bugs. You're just down the hall from the bathroom which is nice, and the design of the room makes it feel more spacious than it actually is. Laundry and printing can be annoying, as they're in the basement (four flights down).

It's a nice room with a 5 windows so the ventilation is pretty good. but since it's the first floor, you'll probably want your blinds down all the way for winter, and about 3/4 of the way for the hot months so that air can flow. It's loud around 9-10 pm and 6-8 am because the room is right above the dining hall truck parking areas, but it doesn't really bother me because a) I keep really irregular sleeping hours and b) if you're tired enough, you wont notice. It does get stuffy in September, second half of April, and most of May, but bring a fan and that'll be enough for most people. There's a locked door that connects to the corner room so you can hear everything, but it was okay because my neighbor was very neighborly. It really might be the worse of butler, but I can list dozens of rooms worse than this one in all the other colleges, so don't complain. Pro tip: push your bed lengthwise against the window wall to maximize outlet connections, make cleaning easy, and cool while sleeping when it's hot.
draw_time: second to last page for all of butler draw

summary: Great location and view, very small
content: This is a perfectly located room and it looks out over Prospect Garden which is beautiful. Very close to the men's bathroom and the trash room, and on the opposite side of the building (30 second walk) from the women's bathroom. Large walk-in closet. Only complaint is that it's definitely small, I had a Tiger Bed so I didn't have much room for anything else.

This room is MASSIVE. Certainly one of the largest singles in Rocky. Room for a bed, couch, desk, carpet, multiple bookshelfs. Walk in closet. Only window is a skylight but it feels very cozy. Definitely gets hot in the fall and spring and the biggest issue is that it's a 4 floors away from the bathroom which is a bit of a trek. Very few bugs.

This room is pretty nice for two people. My roommate lived in the common room which gave us both our own space (it could be considered a 120 sq ft single and 180 sq ft single, just attached). Cons are that the only bathroom is in the basement and there's no laundry room in Campbell. The heat was also a bit bipolar and you can't control the temp in the room. Overall, solid room, don't be afraid to live in Campbell!

This was a really great room to have. When you walk in, there's a small antechamber where you can put shoes, a fridge, and other small items. Then there are two rooms that are basically singles, and two bathrooms (1 is a toilet, 1 is a shower, and both have sinks). The bedrooms themselves are a bit small, but cozy. This room could probably have fit a TigerBed, but instead I chose to have a small couch for people to sit on. I also had a nice thick rug which made the whole room feel really homey.
draw_time: Top of junior draw/bottom of senior draw; I drew mixed with a senior.

content: As far as campbell rooms go, this room was actually great! (biggest quad in campbell, decent view, good layout and all) That doesn't change the fact the campbell is the worst! Only one bathroom two floors down, have to take your laundry outside, dirty hallways/floors/bathrooms. Avoid campbell at all costs

summary: Honestly not sure what the other two reviewers are on about.
content:
As far as design and amount of space goes, for an Annex room it's pretty typical. Not enough space for any large furniture but roomy enough for all other purposes. Good lighting (facing the west, so the sun comes in in the evening) and (perhaps surprisingly) good air circulation are perks. The bathroom (at least, the men's room) has doors that offer substantially more privacy than other places in the Annex, which is also nice. On the other hand, there's only one small shower per gender for the entire hallway of ~12 people, so plan that out or you may have to wait in the mornings.

The view is one of the best on campus IMO. You get a fantastic view of the trees, the lake and the golf course, with the grad college in the background.

If you despise cinder blocks, require furniture, or your hallway is all one gender, you're going to have a bad time with this room. Otherwise you'll be fine.
draw_time: Just about as bad as it can get.

content: Layout is deceiving, and the room is a fair bit smaller than it is listed as. Foulke is crappy. Would avoid
great room, very large and spacious, lots of natural light and super conveniently located with an exit, library, and elevator nearby. it is sub-free though.

summary: We made the best of it.
content: It is one room on the fourth floor of Pyne. The bathrooms are not the best, laundry is 5 floors down in the basement, and there is no filter water tap nearby. However, it is a very large room and we really loved the setup we had and truly enjoyed our experience in this room. Its not the worst choice out there. We snagged this halfway through the rising juniors selections and thought it was a steal for our draw time.
draw_time: We were middle of the pack of rising juniors that drew into upperclass housing.

summary: Had a Pretty Bad Junior Draw Time but It's Fine
content: It's a one room double. That can get extremely annoying if you and your roommate run on different schedules. Also, the nearest bathroom (men's) is one floor down while women's is two floors down which can get annoying. All that said its a huge double which provides ample space to each person. If you have a bad draw time as a junior this isn't that bad.

The ceiling leans down across almost the entire room. The alcove created though by the ceiling next to the window is actually really pretty in the morning. Overall, not a bad choice because the bed fits horizontally across the back wall and the closet is quite large but be aware of the ceiling.
draw_time: I was 2/3 of the way through the juniors? or about halfway? cant remember

content: We were really excited about this room. We had a bad draw time and were wondering why there was still a 3 room double available. After being woken up repeatedly throughout this year it makes total sense. The combination of the pipes being obnoxiously loud and this rooms windows being near the walkway mean that you'll be woken up by people talking outside on their way back from the street or by the pipes. You can't even turn them off. Pick another room.

Lived here my junior year. It is on the top floor so half of the ceiling is slanted which makes for a cozy vibe. Not a lot of ventilation in this room because there is only one window and it is more of a skylight than a window, but it's bearable. 

Amenities wise: there is a pretty good bathroom nearby, but there is no laundry room and no printer in Cuyler.
draw_time: Pretty okay! Middle of the pack

content: The room is mostly fine for Wilson standards. Climbing up four flights of stairs is a hassle but you get used to it. The bedrooms are pretty small and there's very little closet space, though there's a closet in the hallway which is a nice addition. The downstairs common room fits only the desks, but the upstairs common room is quite nice. The bathroom is spacious too. Keep in mind that the upstairs' bedroom's walls don't go up all the way, and that can be VERY noisy. It also gets insanely hot up there. Overall, we had a really bad draw time but actually got pretty lucky, because this room wasn't half as bad as we thought it would be.
pretty loud but not too small, right next to the bathroom

summary: A good double with huge closets.
content: This room apparently used to be a large quad, but it's now a nice double. I guess some of the quad is now just these enormous closets – seriously, the biggest I've ever seen. There's a good window and comfortable room for 2 people. Great for guys because the mens bathroom right nextdoor is basically a private bathroom that Princeton cleans.
great room but bad roommates

this is a pretty small triple that really only works if somebody is in the common room (which is fine to do). both singles can fit tigerbeds if you move the dresser outside of the tiny single. closets are pretty decently sized and the person in the common room gets one of the armoires. the common room can fit a couch+seating plus a bed, 1 desk, and 2 dressers. the classes at dillon can be incredibly annoying early in the morning and late at night, esp in spring and fall when windows are open. you need to go outside for laundry, girls bathroom is one up and boys is one down. directly above what is usually a frat room.

summary: Room is great, building amenities kinda suck
content: The common room is pretty massive and has a nice nook where you can put the third bed if you decide to do so. Ceilings are angled in all three rooms, which, in my opinion, made it feel really cozy and didn't take away any functional space. Closets are massive. Relatively few bugs - a few house centipedes and one or two roaches during the very beginning of the year but not much else. M/W bathrooms just a few doors down. Laundry situation really sucks as you'll have to go over to Brown or 1903. No nearby kitchen or water fountains. Location is one of the best on campus though, and that makes up for most of the downsides.
draw_time: 9th page of juniors (about halfway through juniors)

content: People are scared by 1 bedroom. It's not a problem because the room is huge. No bugs, can see Nassau street, great cross-breeze.  This is the best room in holder.

summary: Yeah this was a tough double
content: In the basement, so your window opens up right to the ground which is perfect for ants. Had to call the ant police to get rid of them. Also the guys bathroom is upstairs which wasn't a huge deal but wasn't great either.
stellar
humid, tiny, and ground floor. right by M bathroom. technically 116sqft but feels more like 80 since space is lost to the closet and dumbass area between the door and actual room.

Ok, yes, it's small, but if you don't mind bunking or getting rid of the occasional bug, it's a great room. The common room is super nice, and it's super homey once you decorate. Not a ton of natural light, but we put string lights up and it was perfect. The location is unbeatable, though people walking back from the street can be kind of loud. Be careful storing shoes at the entrance if you have sweaty feet-- air flow is minimal.
draw_time: Not great-- this was the last quad available in Wilson.

summary: Decent common room. Carpeted floors in bedrooms. 4 closets. Close to bathroom
content: see above

summary: Okay Room, Over the Arch, Good Window Lighting
content: I appreciated this room. it is quite small, but as long as you don't try to fit much more than the given furniture and maybe a fridge, it works great. No bug problems or anything. The heat blasts in the winter. Had to constantly have a window cracked. Near women's restroom. Men's room upstairs. Closet juts into room and takes up space, but it's really spacious and fits a ton of stuff. Use under your bed for storage as well and you should be set.
draw_time: Almost end of Juniors in Upperclass Draw

content:
Pros: central, 3 rooms

Cons: you can not debunk the double because it is the same size as the single. You should have someone sleep in the common room if possible, bathroom is down steps and under entryway 2, laundry has to be done in brown or 1903 ( I did it in Patton once so I could have somewhere to relax while washing)

The room itself is fine. No bugs and a small but fair amount of room
draw_time: bad as in no more singles or doubles

content: Large for most junior rooms. Pros are the size and that it's in Pyne. The bathroom is 1 floor down. Cons are that the Dylan is right next door and the noise from games/workout classes and people talking can get annoying and can be disturbing. No large quads to hang out in nearby.

summary: Good size common room, one bedroom bigger than the other
content: This is a pretty good room for rocky. The common room is a good size and both bedrooms are big enough to unbunk, although one is definitely bigger than the other. Can be a little noisy since it's on the first floor and apparently the church next door needs to blow leaves at 9am but not too bad.
Decent size common rooms but bed rooms were tiny and there was crazy amount of bugs. My roommate woke up to a cockroach crawling on his face
One good bedroom but otherwise this room was a disaster. Was in middle of room draw as a jr and thought we made a good choice but was horrible.
Don’t draw this room
Couldn’t unbunk the beds and was barely space to open dressers

Common room in bigger than in the average quad, we had room for 2 couches, 2 desks, wardrobe, large tv, and two dressers with still plenty of space. Bedroom if you put two beds in it is small but fits two twin beds well. BEWARE of constant noise that prevents you from sleeping. The bathroom beside it is extremely outdated and in terrible condition. But the worst part is the amount of noise it makes. Everytime someone even opens a stall door it is loud enough to wake you up. You can hear every shower, every flush, and the constant work that is being done. There is also a heating system that clicks all night for about every other night which is extremely annoying. Also whenever it snows the snowplow is right outside your window at 6am and the lawnmower goes off at around 8am twice a month. If you are a very very heavy sleeper this room is definitely for you because it is one of the biggest in forbes.
draw_time: we had the 2nd draw group time

content: Awesome room. Huge single, surrounded by other singles, perfect for a hallway takeover with friends. Right next to bathroom and super close to laundry
The room has its own bathroom, which is amazing. It's the perfect size and has slanted ceilings/window nook that overlooks the golf course/grad college. Great for plants

This room is solid. In terms of one room doubles I feel like it's the best you can do. It is very spacious and has high ceilings. Nice and clean. Nice windows. 5th floor is a lot of stairs and the elevator is mad slow but it's not that bad. Plus two bathrooms right next door.

Literally a fantastic room, common room is incredible, well-lit, cozy, great view, everything. One complaint is that the bedrooms are not big enough to de-bunk. But doesn't even matter bc the common room is so good. Great for pregames and parties too!
draw_time: We were one of the first quads to draw. witherspoon quads go very fast

summary: Best Annex Single, Still Some Problems
content: It's good location for the annex, but the window opens right to a nearby hallway, so everyone walking into the annex from the dhall can see right into your room if the shades are up. The structure of the room is also kind of weird, so it doesn't feel as big as it is (partly due to the huge bathroom, with is a plus but kind of excessive). Garbage trucks also dump shit super loudly right by the window at around 8am at least once a week, so if you're a light sleeper that can be rough. Overall, it definitely has it perks but go for a main inn single if you've got the options.

Amazing view, amazing lighting, great common room. Bedrooms are small, beds can be unbunked in both rooms but will be like inches apart. One room is bigger than the other. I'd live here again tbh. Amazing location
sick room, fun pregames, don't try to put a ball pit in the stairs, bedrooms are huge. It's a hike up to this penthouse

The common room is huge; we have two couches, 2 minifridges, a coffee table, a TV, and all our desks, and there's still plenty of space. Two of the doubles are pretty big but one is very small (not so small that you have to bunk tho). bathroom is big, pretty large shower, 2 sinks. just get there early so you can pick your room. only downside is like half of the common room (the side with the bedrooms) doesn't have any outlets

The common room is giant and the doubles, while not big, were definitely comfortable. Having a private bathroom was also super convenient. We had two couches and a table in the common room which made it feel super homey, plus there was still a ton of open space

It was the second to last single, so definitely not the largest of rooms. Not bad at all though. Plenty of room for one person, not great if you're looking to have man people over. You can fit an air mattress on the floor beside the bed though. It gets stuffy pretty quick, so I always left my windows open and it was fine. I've come to appreciate the quaint-ness. DO 203 will have a special place in my heart.

This is an alright single - you can definitely lay out the room so that you can have a fair amount of guests (I hosted two prefrosh), but the lighting is pretty sad and even though you theoretically have a good view of the courtyard it never really works out that way. Roomy, though, for a single.
Amazing corner room. Right next to men's bathroom and water fountain. One of the rooms is too narrow for debunking but it's still pretty big size-wise so I don't mind that. Huge common room
draw_time: probably first half but not definitely not super super high

content:
The common room is much smaller than it looks on the floor plan, because the stair takes up most of the space and there are two big closets that you cannot move (they're attached to the wall). There are many cockroaches, and the next bathroom for women is far away. 

That said, you can definitely make it work! We had a wonderful time here this year, and the two floors definitely give the room a homey touch.
draw_time: We were the first juniors to draw and accidentally drew into this room :))

content: Given that this is in the main inn, amenities are certainly better (shared private restroom, a/c, etc.). It's a bit small given it's a double, but honestly, most doubles in Forbes Main Inn are probably this size. Lovely room to have, just annoying that the windows face the outside (parking lot/trees), so we had to leave it closed most of the time.
draw_time: quite bad (second to last page of Forbes)

content: We actually lived here as a double instead of a triple because one of our roommates moved out, so it was actually an insanely nice 3 room double for us. A bit old, dusty and no A/C (just as all central campus dorms are), but otherwise the location to Frist is really nice and there's good sunlight from the common room. You can also unbunk and fit the third bed in the common room if you'd like.

It's a nice, spacious room, but I got a lot of ants in the spring (like they crawl all over you when you wake up). Also, there's only one window, so be prepared to deal with not being able to get fresh air. If you prefer your personal space though, it's a pretty good deal.

Enough room for a mini fridge a standing lamp and an extra chair in addition to all the other furniture. Nice windows with plenty of room for displaying figureines and books. Only saw 2 bugs the entire year and close to bathroom, kitchen on 2nd floor and laundry on first. Super thin walls thoigh
draw_time: The very last name in the draw

content: It is not the biggest single but it was great for me! If you don't mind having your bed sorta high you can easily fit a tiger bed. I slid my desk under the bed to have even more room. I also liked that it was right by the kitchen and TV room. I did most of my studying in the common area at the round table and loved it. I also liked that the girl's bathroom was just down the hall and since there was only one other girl on that floor it was pretty much ALWAYS clean. It also is very easy to go in and out of the building too because there are exits right on that floor! If you want a single I highly recommend this room! :)
Amazing room, can't recommend highly enough. By lofting the second bed in the double up over the window bench, the double become plenty large. Close to M bathroom, microwave, sink, water fountain.
draw_time: Good but not good enough to get Dod quad.

content: big bedrooms (can unbunk you just have to cover the weird built in drawers), lots of light b/c 3rd floor/slanted windows, also really liked the tall ceilings. just gets super hot at the tail ends of the year so buy a lot of fans
Great room and very nicely located. Got this room as a sophomore, few bugs here and there but whatever. Situated right across from the RCA.

Huge common room (like double the size of most quads' common rooms). Long entry hallway that makes it feel like an apartment. Bedrooms are small. If you want to debunk, all desks have to be in the common room (at least 3 of 4). That's what we did, and it worked out great. Literally two steps to the men's bathroom, and women's is right down the hallway, on the same floor. Couldn't have had a better setup soph year.
Solid room, pretty small but not crazy small. Comfortable room.

Yes, it's next to the Footnotes but I assure you they're not that loud and their practice times aren't annoying. Very big double and super convenient female bathroom outside, ground floor so you can go in and out of windows and don't climb stairs. Walker is old and decrepit but so is all of Wilson so honestly, what do you expect?

No surprises here. Spacious, hardwood floors, private bathroom, etc. 
One pro tip: get the corner room D212. It says the square footage is smaller than 210 but because it's a corner room it is super spacious and has more usable space than 210
draw_time: Middle of the pack. This room flies under the radar

content: This is a pretty big room with high ceilings. Basically a box, but lots of room for two people and some character.

This is a great room! It's super spacious and gets a TON of natural light. It's right down the hall from the bathroom (ladies) which is really nice. People sleep on Buyers because it's technically sub free but I've had a great experience in this double. We have our room set up with the beds unbunked and have room for a little sitting area with a couch by the bump-out windows.

great room!! it is really big, has a walk-in closet, lots of natural light because the entire wall is windows. It's right across from the women's bathroom, and the men's is down the hall. Kitchen two floors down, which is great for independents. The only downside is that the traffic on University Pl is REALLY loud. You can very clearly hear cars, trucks, buses, people all hours of the day even with all the windows closed.
draw_time: independent draw, a bit more than halfway down

content: Bangin room. Bedrooms are a bit small, you've got to bunk, but this is the ideal spot if you want to get rowdy. No one above, next to, or below and the bedrooms are on the courtyard side. The little staircase in the room is sick and unique and you can crowdsurf off it.

summary: Cramped, Dark, and Extremely Isolated (in a bad way)
content: The common space has no room to add any additions besides a mini fridge. The rooms are extremely dim. Unfortunately there are certain unfair advantages. There are two singles which both are the size of the smaller doubles. There is a large double (which is much bigger than the other two doubles). The doubles are large enough that there is no need to bunk, but other than that, they still are very cramped. Many spiders in the common space. Going up three flights of stairs can be annoying at first, got used to it. This dorm room location in the building makes it very isolated from other dorms and people. Nice that it is so close to Wilcox dining hall though. Cleaning your own bathroom can become inconvenient (and disgusting) depending on your suite-mates.

This was easily the best living situation I had at Princeton- laundry, usable kitchen, printer cluster, and multiple study spaces right downstairs. As an independent student I was more than happy. Technically this is a 3 person room but our 3rd roommate studied abroad so my roommate and I each had our own single and a massive common room, we used the third bed as a second couch in the living room and had endless pregames. But even with all 3 roommates the place is spacious enough that no one will feel too cramped. Literally heartbroken to be studying abroad and only getting to spend a semester there (beware, some bugs because Dod is lowkey in the middle of so much shrubbery, would definitely recommend leaving the windows closed when possible and taping over the top of the screen to keep them out.)
Huge room, we lived in it with 3 people so it worked a bit better. Definitely an amazing space and very comfortable

The balcony is awesome. Single is teeny, but big enough to fit desk/bed/etc. 2 closets and one wardrobe in the common room. Have to put desks from double in the common room if you want to unbunk, which is possible without a real problem. Double is a bit cramped but nothing extreme. Closets are pretty reasonably sized. No bugs in sight, bathrooms one floor upstairs or 2 floors down (and they are disgusting, despite our lovely custodian's best efforts!). There is a window seat and a fireplace. Certainly nothing to write home about, it's pretty small, but it is fine and better than I was expecting for our sub-par time. Cdogg for life
draw_time: 60% of the way down Junior list. In other words: bad, but not terrible

content: Nice room, singles are pretty small and someone has to sleep in the common room. I haven't seen any bugs except when first moving in. You do hear a lot of noise from people walking by outside the windows.

This room leaves a lot to be desired. First off, there is a stink bug infestation. If you are afraid of them at all, do NOT pick this room. Additionally, the walls in the Annex are paper thin, so be prepared to hear many squeaky beds during all hours of the day. The bathroom is right across the hall (it's a men's, but who cares), but the shower is VERY small and VERY dark. You can bunk your beds to optimize floor space, but I highly recommend using bed risers instead. The bunk beds are unstable and far too noisy to be practical. All in all, it's a decent sized double and a place to live. Just avoid it if you can, but if you got it, your draw time was probably not great and I'm sorry. You'll live.

The common room is spacious, can hold ~20 people comfortably and up to 40 if you're packed in for a pregame. We had a tv, couch, couple chairs, and plenty of room in the middle. The bedroom was big enough for a queen bed and a twin, we used it just for sleeping.
lots of natural sunlight. pretty small bedrooms to be shared by 2 people, but it was a great steal for a pretty mediocre junior draw time.

Pros: 
Large room
great location
close to the women's bathroom so great if you're a girl
there's a little walk-in hall thing which makes the room feel a lot bigger

Cons: 
Footnotes are super annoying, especially during auditions
On the far side of the room there are A LOT of ants even without food, it's only bad during the spring but it's REALLY bad (I went home during finals as much as I could because they would crawl all over my bed)
Can't get over how HUGE the common room is! Also debunked beds (you're welcome!) and a pretty decent hallway.

This is a good room! Slightly odd shape but two decent doubles and a common room that has enough space for a futon, fridges, tv and more! Hot & cold filtered water right outside the door is the convenience you never thought you needed. The men's bathroom right next door is quite nice. However RE: the review from 2017 - The heating still has not been fixed, so we too got space heaters. Be prepared to request these when you get cold :)

pros:
massive
TWO bathrooms (one room with toilet one room with shower)
the wall in the middle actually is a nice divider, allows you to put beds on one side and basically have a common room
giant, gorgeous window, lots of natural light
not many bugs
has a patio if you know how to operate a screwdriver
also it came with like four trash cans which was cool
did i mention that it is really big? honestly should be a quad

cons:
nah

Pros: two big corner rooms, with two medium size singles in the middle, attached to a big bathroom. 

Cons: 1st floor rooms with lots and lots of windows, so you need to be careful about privacy and be sure to take the blinds off and on all the time. The shower is handicap size so sometimes it leaks onto the floor and not just the shower stall.
draw_time: Best draw time for sophomores in Butler

content: Wilson sucks but this room made up for it.  The common room is massive, the bathroom is pretty big, and the bedrooms are a good size too (one of the three rooms is way smaller but its livable). Downsides: no laundry or water filter in the building (get a Britta), there's only like two outlets in the common room so you gotta be very good with power strips, the stairs are a pain but you get used to them.  Overall I loved this room and wish I could stay for the next two years

summary: Love the room, way too many pests
content: The room setup and square footage is amazing for this room. The common room is super cozy and the bedrooms are nice (one is definitely larger). However, the room is in  close proximity to the kitchen and in the basement in the slums, and we vastly underestimated the pest problem. By February (time of review) we have dealt with cockroaches, grasshoppers, mice, and an ant infestation. It’s seriously gross and definitely detracts from the quality of the room overall. The bathroom is also far for girls, but luckily we converted the second floor bathroom into a gender neutral one with a dorm vote.
draw_time: Top of independent draw, after all the people from spelman dropped out

content: Although this room seems awesome, the bedrooms are super small. Maybe they fixed the smell, but the room is below a bathroom and sometimes leaks into the room / there is constantly a bad smell everywhere. Overall, wouldn't recommend.

summary: Not as good as other review
content: Was really excited about this room from other review, but turned out to be bogus. Being on bottom floor meant consistent bugs (cockroaches, ants, spiders etc.). Also with the positioning/acoustics of the room, people were basically yelling into our room when walking by when just chatting. Although common room is sizable, bedrooms are tiny. Not great.

summary: Great view, A/C, kitchen right next door, what more could you ask for?
content: Almost no complaints about this suite -- you get your own bathroom, decently large common room and bedroom, hardwood floors, A/C, and a kitchen right next door! My only gripe is that the walls are fairly thin, but they are nothing compared to those in the Forbes Annex. If you're STEM, the walk to your classes is so much shorter than that of most of your other friends, so you can literally wake up, roll out of bed, and end up in your classes in an instant. 10/10, would surely recommend.
draw_time: My friends and I were the third to last draw time in the Independent Draw.

content: Great single, good size and has a really nice window ledge where you can relax and do your readings. Only drawback is that it's on the 3rd floor of Mathey Campbell so the only bathroom is in the basement, but the bathroom is quite decent. Also, the laundry room and kitchen are all in the basement because we share the Joline basement, which is pretty nice.
draw_time: Smack in the middle of Mathey draw - this was the last single left.

content:
this is my current room, and i love it. 
Cons: stink bugs occasionally. Some noise on the weekends due to lawnmowers on a golf course
pros: quiet hallway, right next to the kitchen and men's bathroom.

Really amazing view of the golf course and the grad college. Bathroom is clutch, proximity to kitchen is also very nice. A bit of a tight fit - roomie and I spent a while configuring everything, and we've gotten pretty used to it. Space is at a premium, but you make it work
draw_time: Honestly, not great - bottom half and closer to bottom third lmao. Have hope!

content: Great privacy, nice location, 100% recommended.

We could un-bunk our beds in both room, though one is much, much bigger than the other. The common room fits a lot of guests, pretty comfortably. One thing is that there are stairs that one person in our room fell on and got injured. There's room for a sofa in the common area, though we had a futon and a big chair instead, in addition to a fridge. Bathrooms are annoying to get to, as they are a floor away. Window gives a nice view of the courtyard. Other window is a bit noisy certain mornings, since it's right across from Richardson theater.

summary: It is just too high...but overall recommended
content: As the summary said, the only main issue is that the room on the 5th floor, so it can be a pain walking up and down, as well as doing laundry. Apart from that, it is all good: spacious, close to most places (esp the gym), pretty quiet. If you don't might climbing the stairs, take this room
draw_time: On the first half of junior in mathey

content: At a corner in the building so the room has a weird shape, but the small space can be quite nice and cozy.

I overall was a fan of this room and would recommend. The common room is pretty sizable, so we were able to host like 10-15 friends, as well as comfortably fit 4 desks, a chair, a futon, and a fridge with some floor space. It is true that one of the bedrooms is bigger than the other, although both are unbunkable. Right above Holder kitchen and not too far from printer. Bathroom is a floor below but that's just a fact of life in holder. Room is next to kind of a busy door though, so people can see in/hear you if the windows are open. No issues with bugs.

Solid quad for freshmen, although if you're choosing this as a soph your draw time is probably not great. But if this is the case, I would then recommend this room! It has a decent size common room and beds can be unbunked in both bedrooms. Nice big windows looking out onto holder courtyard with bench seats. Location is great - right above bathroom and laundry room and not far from printer. Literally steps from dhall and conveniently on first floor. The bedrooms do face nassau st, so not great if you're sensitive to like car/siren noise.
Having lived in bigger rooms, I can safely say that ~150 square ft is sufficient—any larger and it just becomes a pain to clean. There are noticeably more bugs on the first floor, though.

summary: attic of a Victorian mansion vibes
content: huge room but very dim lighting. there are wood floors and windows with cool details

There are huge windows and a spacious common room. There are two floors, which means that the ceiling is very high. The three doubles are quite large as well, although one is slightly smaller than the other two. The shower and toilet are in separate rooms, which is convenient when people need to take showers. I would totally recommend this room.

This room is pretty spacious for a Forbes double. Has two nice closets, shared bathroom with adjacent double, three windows (!!), right in between the stairs and elevator and is attached to the balcony. You know it's nice cause the room one floor down is an RGS room.

Nice to be in holder because close to bathroom and laundry, but the room is very small and all of the built in aspects of the room (fireplace, closet, window seat) make it difficult to arrange furniture. Get creative.
While there is no common room and the singles are different sizes, we had room to sit together on someone's floor. If you want a single but still be near your friends, this is an amazing room.
draw_time: Very good draw time (at least top 10)

content: This quad is huge. There's a small room in the tower and too larger rooms. There are also two entrances, and one is very close to the women's bathroom. So that everyone could debunk, we ended up doing a single and a triple. This means that one person has to keep their closet in the other person's bedroom, but we never really had any issues with this. If this doesn't bother you, then it's a great, spacious room!

It's pretty hard to optimally use the space
Floor is quite unlevel in some places
Not really enough space to debunk the beds
No A/C
Close to men's bathroom, hot water tap, and trash/recycling receptacles
It's not huge, but it's big enough. Nice facilities. Only downside is that it's across from the bathroom so it can get a little bit noisy.

summary: good room but far from bathroom
content: great room, just have to configure the furniture correctly and it feels super big. only downside is the bathroom is far away!

I loved my room! A very decent single size, large window, A/C, tile floors which are easy to clean. The kitchen is very close, laundry and a printer are upstairs. Very central location. I'm trying for this room again

Functionally smaller than its square footage due to all the weird angles and short walls in the room. In one of the rooms we had to attach a plank to the wall to use as a bed frame because otherwise we couldn't have two singles.

Proximity to UStore and being up campus is a plus.
draw_time: Last two room double to go

summary: Not as Good as you think....
content: No private bathroom. Room was not as big as we thought it would be.
Perfect! No complaints
Get this room!!!  IT was so nice perfect room!

summary: Not as great as you think....
content: Room was a huge disappointment... we would've had way more space if we had all gotten singles
Not the best

We chose the room because of the square footage, but it isn't actually that big. I'm pretty sure the measurement is incorrect. Just take a look at the floor plan. The two bed rooms are smaller than most singles. Also very misleading is that the closet is NOT a "private bathroom". At least the common room is pretty nice.
Decent-sized, AC, view of Poe Field, bathroom and washer/dryer unit on same floor, far enough from the bathroom and common room that you don't hear noise, what else can you ask for?
This room was a steal for us. Huge common room. Warning- one of the bedrooms is bigger than the other. You can still debunk in both bedrooms though.

summary: All of the other reviews are wrong
content: This room is sick. One of the doubles is big enough for two full sized beds and all your furniture. The other might be too, but is definitely debunkable. Just moved out of this room, no noise from the prince, the only noise issue was from people coming back from the street on the side facing the slums and from the construction on University and by the U Store. The common room is a great size. We fit a couch, a long table, a few chairs, and a coffee table. The people before us had like three couches in here. Only real drawback is that the closest laundry room is in Henry or in Lockhart. Oh and also all those stairs really get ya on move in and out
DO NOT TAKE!!! Looked nice, WORST ROOM ON CAMPUS!! Drainage leaks right into the room, always had to have maintenance come in and fix. There are soo many other doubles that are better.

I loved this room in Laughlin! We were close to laundry, right next door to the women's bathroom, and were flooded with light each morning. Of course, because it's in the slums, it can get noisy, especially on nights out, but overall, this was the best room I've had at Princeton.

SO spacious, perfectly comfortable for two people, and the common room is really big! Perfect junior two room double, way more spacious and better quality than any quad in brown / two room double more central campus. Sure this is in the slums, but the room quality is insane. take it. really quiet hall too given many rooms on this floor are singles and doubles, so not rowdy at all. both girls and guys bathroom on this floor. access in this entry to both the dillon and henry side.

The L shaped room is big enough and it is close to bathrooms, laundry, stairs, and elevator. It's also next to a lounge though, and people might not quiet down at night given the thin walls. Kinda loud room, avoid if possible.

summary: make good use of the space!
content:
Great room! Having proximity to the door that led to the stairs was great, and being on the second floor was great. Forgetting my umbrella in my room meant I could just run upstairs and grab it. Going to the bathroom is down the hall, but not as far as some Bloombergites even have to walk.
This hallway has a study room (with a microwave, sink, and hot water spout), a water fountain outside that room, an elevator, women's and men's bathrooms, and right downstairs in the Bloomberg kitchen. This building also is pretty close to Wucox so you can get food either way. Also super close to the Wa! Will Bloomberg's many amenities ever end?!!?

This room is quite large and you can fit a LOT in there! I had the normal dorm stuff (bed, desk, desk chair, dresser, wardrobe, shelf) AND I put a couch, mini fridge, bedside table, and shoerack. If you're looking to plan out your furniture arrangements ahead of time (like myself), the wardrobe is located directly behind where the door would swing open. 
You can really have a pleasant environment in this (and any) Bloomberg room.

P.S. the other review that is glorifying Wilson has truly given way to Stockholm Syndrome. Yes, I had huge rooms in Wilson, but the quality of Butler is unmatched.
This room is huge since it used to be a double. But like the rest of Mathey, there's no AC and there's a good amount of bugs. The bathroom is also very far down the hall.
draw_time: Decent draw time, a bit higher than middle of the junior list

content: My roomie and I were bottom of page 2 out of 5 when we snagged this hidden gem. It's pretty L-shaped, but with the right decorations and setup, this room is magical. It was spacious, and having a big bathroom was a plus. I recommend getting lights to make the room appear bigger, but overall it was an awesome, cozy room. Totally recommend.
You can't debunk which definitely a drawback, but the common room is huge and beautiful with a fantastic view! Lots of natural light / air too if you open the shades / windows.

We got this room our junior year, it was the only quingle left, after getting a really good draw time (but this is back when draw times were biased lol). Great location, plenty of room in the common room, but probably not enough room for a couch- we kept all our desks and bookshelves in the common room and had a couple chairs up, as well as a minifridge, but maybe there was room for a couch had we moved all our stuff inside the singles? Each single room is nice and has its own AC/Heat. You really can't go wrong with this room. Easy access to laundry too, and bathroom is well equipped for the number of people in the area. Easy 5/5
draw_time: Can't remember exact time, but we were top all-soph group with >=4 people

content: This room is a beautiful quad in Mathey. Blair is a pretty nice building, and this room is located directly next to a water fountain (with cold and hot water spouts), and is just down the hall from the bathroom. The nearest laundry room is super close, in the basement like one entryway over. The location is also nice as it is very close to the U store, and is on the end of Blair further away from the arch (so you won't be bothered by noise from events there). This is a corner room, and so there are windows on two walls of the common room, including a bay window seat. During the day there is so much natural light in the common room, its awesome! The bedrooms are each large enough to debunk, although one is slightly larger than the other. The common room is pretty spacious–definitely large enough for desks & additional furniture such as a couch or futon. My roommates and I loved this room so much! Honestly one of the better rooms in Mathey. (Fun bonus: the mini-hallway from the door to the common room has built-in coat hooks and is wide enough to add a shoe rack.)

Pros: 
 - Relatively spacey if you move the beds against the wall
 - Private bathroom with shower but no bath
 - convenient location with a short walk to dhall and kitchen
 - saw no insects the entire year

Cons
 - Lacks ventilation overall so you'll have to keep the windows up most times.
 - Dehumidifer was a nice investment
 - View of the front of Forbes is almost completely blocked by asphalt terrace and 
   other rooms around the corner can see through your window
draw_time: Amazing but we messed up actually drawing

content:
Pros
Decently large with some nice window alcoves where we kept bookshelves. 3 closets were a nice upgrade from annex wardrobes and saved storage space and floor space. We ended up bunking one bed and had room for a futon, a standing piano and good amount of floor space left over. Also two windows made the room pretty nice and bright. Would recommend putting all the desks side-by-side. Ended up getting a monitor and having a bunch of smash tournaments :)
There are NO cockroaches or weird insects, part of the benefit of being on the 3rd floor.

Cons
Shared bathroom kinda stinks, would recommend getting a bathroom mat and not being too loud at night, because noises *ahem* can get through to you and to the other side. 
Heating was a little uncontrollable at time. The AC vents switch to heating vents after fall break, so be patient, there will be heat eventually. However you don't have full control of it, I believe there's a built in thermostat somewhere, because heating shuts off at a certain temperature, so it didn't always get fully toasty when you want it to. Also we saw quite a few of those tiny ants, but I think that's a general problem with Forbes.
draw_time: Good, drawing started at 10:00, our time was 11:15

content: This is the largest two room double in Rocky and I highly recommend it. You're next to the RCA so if you're a big partier, maybe not the best as you'll get busted, but the RCA doesn't bother you at all and you can't hear each other. My roommate and I took different rooms and she had the bedroom to herself and I lived in the common room, and there was still space in each of our rooms. Highly recommend this room AND you're only one floor from the bathroom which is great for campbell.
Really quiet, convenient location by entrance/relatively close to laundry and dhall, nice view of golf course, big enough, no A/C but manageable temperature with a good fan, pretty big bathroom

Very close to both men's and women's bathrooms, laundry, and water tap (including boiling water). Relatively well lit to be Whitman. Slightly awkward square room and one room has smaller windows than the others. Overall, very standard Whitman quad. Long way from exits (takes some time to get to, friends will get lost, and you'll die in a fire)

This room seemed great - but we unfortunately only saw it from the floor plans. The bedrooms are both slanted in such a way that a normal dorm bed (twin-XL) can barely fit in - nothing else. That was the biggest bummer, but also was normally loud with both the street right outside and our noisy neighbors!

This is a brutal room. It's clearly designed as an office (old Writing Center) and is far too small for two people. It's in the basement, far from bathrooms and laundry, the lighting is harsh fluorescent, and the floors are faux-wood vinyl. Really a depressing place, there's a reason everyone called it "the dungeon." Only plus is it's near the Wawa.

Cookie-cutter Whitman quad, no bay window but great location. Even though it's on the "third floor" you only have to go up one flight of stairs. Upper courtyard, so a bit closer to Dillon and Frist. But, still connected to the dining hall unlike Fischer. Common room on the smaller side, but bedrooms are nice and spacious. Close to laundry and bathrooms. Overall a very solid pick.

This room is not great - also were surprised as to why a 3 room double would be still available - although location is good the pipes were still so loud and a total nuisance. Additionally, the bedrooms are extremely cramped from the angled walls - get a different room. NO BATHROOM ANYWHERE NEAR. I had to walk outside in order to use the bathroom - Pyne is not a good building.

This room seemed awesome from floor plans, but once we got there it was awful. Not only was there asbestos in the ceiling ducts (which we had to move out of our room to have the university fix for 2 months) but before that, somehow the pipes leaving the bathroom were in both bedrooms and would wake us both up anytime someone flushed the toilet. Awful room.

Both bedrooms are tiny - can barely fit a bed let alone a desk. Heater does not work correctly and housing won't fix, very hot when it's fall + spring, no heat during winter. Overall not great and weird shaped rooms lead for a bad time
Downside is no lanudry. But it's so nice and i loved it - had it as a three room single and soooo nice. But also was in the double before my roommates left for study abroad and it was fine!
Lots of light in the morning, and next to the women's bathroom, like the previous reviewer wrote. Wall of windows, which is very nice.

summary: Amazing room with windows facing Wilson Courtyard
content: This is the best room I have had at Princeton in my three years. There were hard wood floors, the doubles were spacious enough (probably for tigerbeds in each) and we could fit our desks and dressers. The closets were nice and spacious too. It was great to have a private bathroom. Can't recommend this room enough. We had a pretty good draw time.

we actually somewhat enjoyed this room, the common room is big with a bench that perfectly fits a twin mattress for extra seating (or someone could make this their room). One room is like 3x the size of the other but we dealt with this by switching rooms during intercession. was surprisingly OK with the small room, just gotta be comfortable with your roommate. we had an awful draw time so we were happy this room was still available compared to the other quads.

This quad is really big, the only downside is that it's sub-free and in Wilson. One of the rooms is slightly bigger than the other but is offset by the huge common room. The bathroom is right next door.
draw_time: this was the last quad in wilson

content:
I took this room because I wanted a single more than anything. Huge mistake. I had roaches for all of the fall until Housing finally "fixed it" only for the bugs to come back a month later. The room smelled whenever the heating turned on and I often had to step outside to get fresh air from my own room. The bathroom being three floors down doesn't help either.

Terrible room. Do NOT draw.
This room is really big and has a lot of natural light and girls bathroom is down the hall super nice loved it !!!!
sleeper pick for sure

I would have happily taken a double elsewhere over this single. Three times I roach infestations so bad that I had to sleep in a friend's room for multiple nights in a row and the bathroom (two floors down, by the way) had flooded showers and stopped up toliets all the time. Room is 126 sq. ft. but the usable space is closer to 80, definitely do not reccomend.

Things have definitely changed since the review below. There's no one wall long enough for a bed, so you have to use up a lot of space angling it. I also had issues with paint chips and other misc. debris falling. Woke up twice with concrete dust or something on my face and my mouth tasted like gravel. It's a bad room.

Nice room overall! Having a shared bathroom with the adjacent single is great, and the hallway between them is quite roomy and can fit mini fridges and other small furniture. The lamp outside the window made it a bit bright at night and the hallway directly outside could be noisy. Otherwise a good space.

summary: small but big enough to make cozy
content: really close to an exit.. no stairs to access room so move in was easy... great access to gym and the wa/train... pretty direct route to frist .. also only a few doors down from the laundry/bathroom ...my only complaint is that the window is on the ground floor so if you like direct sunlight youll have to get used to people looking in while youre sleeping
sucks

summary: Definitely has degraded over the years
content: Got this room because it had great reviews. The walls were mouldy and moist. Was kinda grim despite us cleaning it every week. It's super noisy in the mornings and late evening due to Dillon. Probably sacrifice some sqft and get a better room elsewhere.

The two bedrooms were spacious enough (you could comfortably unbunk) and there were a lot of windows in the common room (which was big!). You had to go upstairs/downstairs for bathroom and water but you get used to it and other than that it's a pretty great room. 

Also super close to ustore + mathey dining hall

This room was terrible. We got it towards the end of the junior draw and spent the whole year hating it. The lighting is terrible most of the time, except when the sun is literally blinding you. The rooms smell really weird and you have to walk miles to get to the nearest bathroom. The double is so oddly shaped so you have to live with someone you really like. I'm not sure about the previous review but you definitely cant unbunk the beds if you want to be able to move. The single is also really weirdly shaped and my roommate complained about it constantly. Anyways this room sucks DEFINITELY dont choose this.
draw_time: last third of junior draw times

content:
This room had both great attributes but also a few large drawbacks. First, it has AC, an elevator (like all the Whitman rooms) really close by, a bathroom (no shower) a few doors down, and it was super quiet. It is REALLY BIG. I had a queen-size bed and ample room for a couch and a rug. Laundry is on the same floor as well.

On nights out it can get a little bit loud outside because the window faces the walk to the Wa, and there will always be people there. You're also next to the Murley Tower, and there's a huge chance there will be pregames there on nights out. It's also just a little bit too far from the showers, but not quite so far that it's a real inconvenience. The room is VERY dark, except in the afternoon. 

Overall, really big, but kind of dark and too far from the showers.

summary: Hey...it only gets better from here on!
content:
It's 88 square feet and it's up 3 flights of stairs. There's not much else to say except you must have REALLY wanted a single or you didn't have a say in the matter. 

Try to spend more time in Frist.
We used this room as two doubles. The room closest to the dhall has a bigger closet and more windows. All of the rooms in the New Wing are pretty big but this one is great if you want a “quad”.

loved this room so much. so large and layout is amazing. entrance is really cool because its kind of hidden around a corner so you have some privacy. only downside is that you dont get as much natural light because it faces the parking lot. amazing room though. only had one stinkbug at the very beginning of the year, no bugs otherwise. heating works.
draw_time: i remember it was pretty/very good but i forget what page i was on

content: Nice room. Smaller than most other singles, but shared bathroom not included in room size.

Nice, spacious room. Saw only one creepy crawler in my time there. Although you don't get windows facing Poe Field, you do get the view of Butler courtyard, which is great if you want to see who tf is yelling and screaming drunkingly on Thursday/Saturday nights. Location is convenient as well. Nearby the elevator, laundry room, and the two floor restrooms.
draw_time: Near middle of second page of junior draw time

content: Great location near the bathrooms, nice bay window and bench, doesn't feel cramped. Also good for multi-gender groups.

It's a small cozy room. Sunlight comes in the morning which is quite nice. Also the bathroom is right there and is a single private bathroom shared by the hallway (don't need to clean it yourself but you have privacy). Overall a really great room!

Good size for a double and has a private bathroom which was the best thing about this room. We had quite a lot of ladybugs and ants though. Also the walls are really thin and there's a locked door to the neighboring room - I had to sometimes wear earplugs at night to block out the noise lol. This was one of the last rooms remaining in the Main Inn when we drew.
We moved two of the beds from the bedrooms and turned it into a double + two singles. Great setup in a fantastic room.
Spacious and convenient with kitchen and laundry room in the basement. Nice big window. Can get a little loud on nights out but not a big deal.

summary: The Cockroaches Came Back and the ARCH SINGS
content: I think it's kinda funny that the review below advertises not having roaches because that literally defined my year. I took the smallest single in Mathey hoping it would be fine but I would have rather taken almost anything else. There's not enough room for a desk, a bed, and two people, and the bugs were an absolute nightmare. The privacy of a single was not worth going to bed every night worrying about waking up with a roach on my comforter (which happened like six times). Also: don't ever think about going to bed or having somebody over before 1 a.m. — the Arch Sings might as well be outside your door.
draw_time: Top, I should've taken something else

content: If you're thinking about taking this because it's one of the last singles in Mathey and you figure you're fine with the small space, you're wrong. This room is criminally small, much too small for any normal person to live in. There is literally not enough space to lean back in your chair at a desk. I would take any double over this postage stamp sized single.
I loved the location close to laundry room, between bathrooms, near elevator, but not too close to any of them.
draw_time: Acquired room after everyone drew rooms

content: This room so great. A Large common room, nice sized bedrooms, and a private bathroom. We had one half of the common room with all our desk, a fridge, and a shell, and the other half had our futon and tv. The window is also very gorgeous and its nice to put things on the window seal. The building also has laundry (only two machines tho) but 1939 and 1976 aren't far at all if you need more machines or the machines are full (which they often are). There is also a small common room in the basement that is often empty, it has a tv as well as a pool table. The building itself, like all Wilson buildings, is centrally located and right by wucox as well as Frist.
draw_time: We were the 5th group for sophomores

content: This was the worst choice I could have possibly made. The room seemed fine based on floor plans, but it was an absolute nightmare. I got splinters in my feet more times than I can count from the floors and mold started growing above my bed and honestly fell on me during the night. Campbell seriously has issues, do NOT take this room if you care about anything.

This room is extremely loud to foot traffic on the weekends. The outside fire alarm consistently goes off because people did not close the door. Bathroom sink and shower leaked. Air conditioning unit does not work and mold in the room.

This room is extremely loud to foot traffic on the weekends. The outside fire alarm consistently goes off because people did not close the door. Bathroom sink and shower leaked. Air conditioning unit does not work and mold in the room.

Rising sophomores, DO NOT get this room. We thought this room was going to be so sick because of its great reviews. LITTLE did we know, there was a cockroach infestation that made us call the building manager MULTIPLE times a month. They could never solve the issue and we had to spend our academic year stressfully jumping around our room. Such a disturbance to our comfort and happiness. If you want to be able to sleep through the night... listen to our advice!
horribly disappointing. thought this room would be good, but there were cockroaches the whole year. this room is also not unbunkable. :(

summary: Great room! corner window facing the path
content: beware everyone can see through the big window but other than that great window! keep in mind you have to clean the bathroom yourself but its worth it

summary: Decent Room for horrible draw time
content: Bedrooms are pretty small, only one could be unbunked although space was pretty tight anyway. common room is pretty decently sized though.

fancy fireplace. elevator, water fountain, bathroom right outside of room. gets loud though. apparently it used to be a double but then they couldn't fit all the furniture in comfortably so it became a single. would recommend.

good location, closer to frist than the rest of mathey, no access to the basement from the entryway 3 staircase (so you have to go outside to get to laundry), one of the doubles is ~significantly~ smaller than the other, the bigger one has enough space to debunk, the smaller one is really too small for 2 people and can only debunk if you put the beds in an L shape and put 3 sets of risers on so that the dressers can go underneath the beds (this is what we did lmao), but the common room is decent sized
draw_time: towards the end of my class year

content: Decent sized room. Really liked having my own space but bugs were a huge problem. Cockroaches and crickets in the beginning of the year so I called pest control and didn’t see any more until one in February in b22 (next door). But I couldn’t open the windows because spiders and other small bugs would come through the cracks. Even though I never opened it, there were still tons of tiny ants and little bugs. If you live here, I would recommend raid. Bathroom across the hall is kind of gross because people from upstairs come and use it too and there are only two showers, two sinks, and two stalls. If you do get this room, i would recommend having a friend live in the one next to you!
draw_time: I think I was about halfway down the list. My group got the last 4 singles in ro

summary: Lots of character but limited space
content: "The meatshack" is in a pretty good location, near the slums but also quiet and closer to the rest of campus.  Space is pretty limited, one bedroom can be unbunked but there's almost no leftover space and the other one we had to make a "floor bed" because the dressers can't be moved.  The common room is pretty good, enough room for all 4 desks and a TV + couch + fridge but not much else.  One of our roommates went abroad in the spring and it magically became a great triple, so if someone's going abroad in the spring you should definitely think about this room.
Kind of a long layout, spacious. Nice to have walk-in closet and a little coat hook by the door, feels homey. The one window allows for some good natural light in the room.

Pretty decent. Plenty of space. Nice windows but it's on the ground floor so people can see in pretty easily. Looks into the courtyard which is nice. No bathrooms on the same floor which is a minor drawback. No real complaints though.
draw_time: Slightly above average for a current sophomore

summary: I would trade my firstborn to have this room again.
content: This is peak Princeton living. You will feel like you're living in a bougie apartment instead of a college dorm. Fantastic for pregames/large gatherings (rip social distancing). The view is great. Witherspoon is amazing. There's an elevator if you're feeling lazy/need to haul a sectional up to the 4th floor. The bedrooms are narrow but we took the wardrobes out into the hall and got fire safety to screw them in there so y'all won't have to live the bunked life. You're welcome. Take this room and treasure it.

cons: so small. feels like a hallway. right next to the men's bathroom so you can hear them slamming the stall doors and blasting music in the shower
pros: view from window is beautiful! looks over prospect garden. also it can be cozy.

common room space was great for pg but we had to maximize space by bunking desks. the room for 2 people is quite small, but if you're in it for the common room and are willing to sacrifice on bedroom space, its a great room.

summary: Weird shape and lighting but super cozy :)
content: You can't really put extra furniture in this room because of the layout. With the window tucked in a nook, the rest of the room is pretty dark and the overhead light is super bright (easy fix w/ lamps/string lights). Also it's a trek downstairs to the laundry and the bathrooms are pretty gross.

Definitely a bug problem, and we saw mice semi-regularly. You just have to not leave food out ever. The rooms are awkwardly spaced and the square footage is deceiving, so it makes it difficult to have a good common room set-up, and the bedrooms weren't a great situation. The location is nice, but would've preferred a lot of other quads in Little.

summary: Overall not a great room, would not pick again
content: I lived in this room when I was a senior and it is not great. The ceiling was moldy and gross and looked like it had water damage or something. The paint on the ceiling was crackling and falling on to the floor/my bed. The noise from the street outside was also super loud and made it hard to sleep. Although the double looks big, it really is not. You barely have room for your stuff.

I loved this room! Super big, has a beautiful view out onto the golf course, women's bathroom 2 doors down & men's just a little further down the hall.   Kitchen is also right across the hall (diagonally) & has water tap/fridge.  Laundry is as close as it can be when you live in the annex.  Warm in winter, no bugs.  Really nice collection of singles here if you're looking to live near friends :)

summary: Great location, great common room, no laundry
