content: This room actually turned out to be really nice. We did a double, a single, and a common room, but you could definitely fit a bed in the common room if u wanted to do 3 singles. The single is a really good size, the double is a little cramped but beds fit unbunked, and the common room is big. The common room has a pretty big window seat which can be super nice if you put blankets and pillows and stuff there. There were definitely cockroach sightings downstairs in the bathroom but we didn't have a major problem with bugs in our room. Girls bathroom is one flight down and down the hall, boys is one flight down. Important: no laundry or printers in Cuyler so we used the ones in Brown, but this room is pretty ideal for that because it's entrance is right across the courtyard from Brown. Obviously amazing location (near frist, street, etc). P.S. if housing services hasn't removed it yet this room comes with a really nice custom built cushion for the window seat ;)
draw_time: right about in the middle of junior upperclass draw times

content: This is a great room, I was sad to leave! 4 giant windows and really spacious with a nicely sized closet. You need to go 1 floor up to the women's bathroom, 1 floor down to the men's. The women's bathroom is super clean. The room is on the first floor so you only need to go up a few steps to get to it (good for moving in/out) but because of the way the building is structured it is technically two stories high, which was really nice (pretty view + I never got any bugs + you can wave to people from your tower). Only con is that it's next to Dillon (although not facing it) so you can sometimes hear spin classes/music blasting, but that didn't happen super often. Also, the radiator juts out at the bottom all along the wall with the windows so it'd be hard to put furniture against that side, but that wasn't really a problem for me!
draw_time: Good but not amazing, probably towards the bottom of the top 1/3 of juniors

content: Honestly not too bad. Clean.
draw_time: Bad - Didn't get to draw was assigned

content:
Figured I should write this to save people some pain. This room was a nightmare from the beginning. We didn't have the best draw and we thought this would be a nice compromise but the floor plan doesn't seem right. It's way smaller than the 425sq ft it says, my friends in doubles had bigger rooms it felt like. Also one room doesn't have a door (common room?). Also the walls seemed to be made out of cloth because you could hear EVERY. SINGLE. WORD. from the neighbors... This is just the surface there was endless problems with messy bathrooms, bugs, and local pregames causing this room to be the biggest mistake i've made while at Princeton.

Word of advice for anyone who wants this room: don't or apply for room improvement and pray. Look for another triple if there are any left.

- on the 4th floor. unless you love elevator rides that make you feel like you live in a warehouse or climbing 4 flights of stairs, probably not the greatest factor. 
- AC - yay! (well, like all whitman rooms)
- slanted ceiling that can be super cozy or make you feel like you're in a coffin, depending on your mood 
- honestly though, it is a pretty good single, and pretty big for sophomore draw. very close to women's bathroom, very very close to laundry, weird random table right in front of it, and water fountain less than a foot out your door (also there's a mirror in the closet so that's dope). 
- lighting's not great because there's a massive tree outside your window but if you're a *window sill sitting romantic* that's a plus of this room.

summary: huge room, nice with fireplace, some cockroaches
content: Very large and has a nice fireplace too. It's right at the entryway door, so depending on the other people living there, it may be loud. But faces south toward Spellman so doesn't get courtyard/Dillon noise. Faces a walkway, so make sure you get curtains for privacy! Made sure to keep the room clean (re. food crumbs etc) and called facilities for traps and the cockroach problem resolved itself.
Nice room. High ceilings. Good view

Outrageously long but that's why we picked it. It's quiet, you have your own little hallway between your room and the normal hallway (weird, not sure why), but also right across from the RCA. Not a problem for us, but for bigger partiers, maybe not ideal. We bunked the beds on one end and had a couch and desks on the other, this was great for entertaining. Lots of wall space, great for decorations

Nice quad, huge common room and the bedrooms are big enough to unbunk and have your own space. Some bugs, but nothing too bad. Quiet little upstairs dorm with a bathroom shared by 6 at most, but the bathrooms were cleaned a lot less than other dorm bathrooms. Altogether, a nice room and great common room for entertainment.

summary: I cried when corona kicked me out of this room
content: I can't say enough good things about this room. after months-long beef with fire safety it is now permanently debunked (thanks dennis daly, you're welcome 23s). you will get swole quads from climbing the stairs and a swole relationship with your roommates as you maximize use of common room for ~gatherings~. get used to people saying "wow your room is so big" and just let it go to your head it's fine u deserve it. the natural light! the beautiful non splintery wood floors! simply incredible. please party extra hard to make up for the nine weeks we missed in this beautiful place xxo

there are literally no downsides to this room. beds are debunked, common room is huge, location is convenient, kitchen and elevator 2 steps away. glenn is the absolute sweetest and will make this place feel like home. i have no doubt that my housing experience is only downhill from here, so please shower this room with love she's so precious.
B309 made my sophomore year. Ample space, sweet bay window with a great view, & proximity to a kitchen were all pluses. Men's bathroom is unfortunately quite far (I think the women's is closer)

Space-wise, this room was more than adequate. What made it especially great was the immediate access to laundry (literally right across the hall), bathroom, Dillon, UStore, and even eating clubs are not that far. One con is basement means it doesn't get much light, but a lamp or two helps with that
Decent room but a bit cramped. View can be blocked by tree.

Faces right out into the courtyard, so if you don't have the shade down it can feel a little too close for comfort, but it also means that friends can come by and knock on your window to say hi! Men's bathroom is right outside and women's is one floor up // really cute closet and fun to arrange for a cozy setup. Really really good location on campus!

summary: Small (as in smallest in all princeton), but not that bad really
content: This was the last quad available in holder and as a former campbell resident, i was not about to go through that trauma again. The room is actually kinda cool, everyone that came in was surprised at the fact that it's the smallest quad in all of princeton, so furnish it right and you can host a few pregames. Bathrooms aren't too close, but not as bad of a walk to the laundry room as the rest of holder.
draw_time: Last three pages of rocky draw lol

content:
Do not be fooled. This is a single large room. That's right. Now, it is a square essentially so my buddies and I thought about getting dividers and splitting it into 4 quadrants (3 singles + a common room) but apparently that's against fire safety regulations. Long story short, you'll be getting to know your roommates very well.
Advantages: GREAT for pregames (you push all the furniture to the walls and you have a huuuge dance floor in the middle). Biiig Long windows, so you can get quite a bit of sunlight when it's sunny outside. Also you get a shared bathroom + a shared shower and bathroom!
Disadvantages: Being located by the YES arch means everyone walks by your room. You might wanna have your blinds down at night if you have the lights on cause people see straight into your room. We've never been busted while throwing a pregame, although it is possible because of the location. It goes without saying, but there's NO PRIVACY, so your sex life will likely suffer, and so will your circadian rhythm. This room used to be a classroom, so it comes with the shitty gray classroom carpeting and the incredibly bright classroom style lights, which is a minor but palpable drawback.
That being said, we did throw some SICK pregames, which made up for a lot of the drawbacks. All in all, this is not a bad arrangement if you and your friends couldn't get singles, there are 3 of you, and you don't wanna leave anyone behind.

We managed to debunk the beds, put 2 wardrobes in the hallway and 2 in the common room after a long "discussion" with fire safety... so no worries if this is an issue there are ways to sort it out. The common room is huge and has such a lovely window seat. Honestly really recommend, I know the rooms are small but the common room makes it worth it!

campbell is not a great building but the room was nice for a double. we put both beds in the back room so we could have a common room and it worked really well. love the window seat but wish it opened for storage like some other rooms have.

(lived there 2 years ago) huge 2 room double especially for freshman. tbh I was really lucky to get this room freshman year because everyone else in the entryway/zee group lives in pretty small quads. plenty of room for a couch etc and both desks in the common room. the windows face the street which was less than ideal because the house across university place was being renovated like the whole year but other than that cant complain.

really large double by forbes standards. no AC and can get really dry and hot when the heater is on. otherwise no complaints! the closets can be pushed into the closet space by the bathrooms, which is a crazy hack that makes the room incredibly spacious
This room was really nice.  It took some maneuvering to get the furniture arranged in a way that worked, but once I did I had room for a small living space which was great.
Room is overall good, however you are seriously screwed if you get the small room. No bugs, nice bathroom, huge common room.

Its a one room double. Its bigger and nicer than the other ones in the hall but its still a one room double. Closets are bolted in really inconvenient spots. I had to use my desk as storage in a corner to get any space. With a good layout is very liveable but given that you live in Whitman you can do better

It overlooks the golf course which is nice, but there's only a men's bathroom in this part of the hallway (the women's is right around the corner though). Also convenient that it's on the same floor as the Forbes lounge which has a printer (that's all the way at the other end of the hallway though).

This room is extremely cramped and annoyingly located. We had a horrible roach infestation and it took the university forever to respond. It's just like the bathrooms... they don't seem to be taken care of and it's a mess. 

Also trucks frequented the area and woke us up every single morning. Why are we backing up at 6am people !! Beep. Beep. Beep.

Looking back I would've urged my group to select another triple. This one looks nice on the floor plan but it's anything but nice.

i loved this room and i was so sad to get kicked out of it :'( surprising amount of space if you keep the beds bunked; it leaves a cool hallway-type of area that's fun to put a rug on and hang out in. clean, really nice windows, accessible bathrooms, no issues with bugs. super quiet and peaceful, barely even heard the elevator. 100 times better than whatever shithole i'm getting next year for sure. enjoy it while it lasts!
draw_time: bad, almost at the bottom. this was the last double left in spoon

content: Men's bathroom was directly underneath, which was super convenient. Both rooms could debunk, but desks had to be moved into common room. Close to computer lab and away from noisy Nassau street. Had a great view of Holder courtyard. Overall, would recommend choosing this quad.

my roommates and I managed to debunk both rooms (although the entryway 2 room was a little awkward, but the entryway 1 room was pretty good). Laundry is three flights of stairs below in the basement which was annoying but theres also two bathrooms close by. The common room is HUGE, we had all four desks, a futon, and a fridge and had plenty of walking room. Definitely recommend
draw_time: pretty bad, like bottom quarter of mathey sophs

content: Awesome size for a single with a double closet and great windows which are very necessary, because when the heat is on the room gets HOT. There is a small hole in the wall by the radiator that maintenance closed as much as possible with a radiator cover early this year. Pretty noisy on nights out and my neighbor and I could have conversations through the wall, but overall great single!
Incredible room

I thought this room would be good because of the square footage, but it is terrible. You literally cannot fit two beds into the weird L shaped room. It sucks and the common room has weird nailed down dressers that take up so much space. The roof also slants in and you feel so trapped.
Such an awkward room I regret this so much. Applied for room improvement because it was so bad. Save yourself and don't draw this room
Impossible to work with the shape, roach problem, smells bad, loud.  Not much else to say. Don't do it.
My roommate found a cockroach in his shoe, not to mention the noise issues. Avoid this room at all costs.

This is a very classic Butler quad. It has bubble windows which make it feel slightly bigger than average. Its the first room on the second floor and is super close to WuCox which is pretty nice for when you're in a rush.
draw_time: Our Draw time was not particularly good, probably middle of the bunch

content: I loved Clapp 232. It has a big common room, two spacious doubles, and can fit a couch or TV.

This room was one of the last rooms left in Forbes Main Inn when I drew. Supposedly it's a little larger than the surrounding doubles but not by much. It's possible to live with unbunked beds if your stuff doesn't take up that much space. 

Pros:
- Really good location (same floor as d-hall, pretty close to the library and laundry).
- AC and heating (although the heater can be a little too hot sometimes).
- Decent view of Forbes backyard and golf course.
- Shared instead of hall bathroom is nice if you like to have a little more privacy (just make sure you work out a cleaning schedule or else it'll get a little gross).

Cons:
- Pretty regular noise from the hallway (people going back/forth at all times of the day, doors to the outside opening/closing).
- Right above music practice room, so you might hear noise from there too
- Walls are pretty thin, so watch out if you have loud or pregame-happy neighbors.
- Closet space was functional for me but could be too small for some people.
it is small but cozy. the ceiling is half slanted with a big window. i will miss this little space despite the amount of stairs it takes to get up there.

This room was the dream. Top floor bedroom has a high ceiling and roof access. The other two bedrooms are also decently sized but one is noticeably smaller. The setup of this room is super sick and doesn't feel crowded with 6 people at all. There is also one bathroom with a toilet + sink, and the other bathroom has a sink + shower. Only downside is that the common room isn't that large but still big enough to host people. Also loved the view of the courtyard

The double is pretty small, just enough room for the bed, dressers and desks. Private bathroom is really nice though. I had the single which was nice, again there isn't really room for extra furniture. I liked this room a lot, super close to the dhall, all you need to do is get up and walk up the stairs. I would say that you do hear people outside but that's to be expected in annex. Cinderblock walls.

I lived here Junior year, got it off the waitlist. It was the best room I’ve had. It has 3 big windows that surround the room so you get a LOT of natural light. Beautiful view of the courtyard. Very little noise with occasional arch sings that are actually pleasant because you can always shut the window and it drowns most of it out if you don’t want to hear. The hallway is really cute and makes it feel bigger. Two enormous closets. It is one room so you should be comfortable living with your roommate, but the little niches are a really nice place to study.
draw_time: I forgot to sign up for room draw...

content: I had this huge problem at the beginning of the year where there was a hole in the wall and crickets would constantly get stuck inside. The room is in the basement level, so it was right next to some bushes, which means bugs could get in easily. Crickets would get stuck inside the wall and then crawl though snd I would find them in my room periodically. They kept me up at night multiple times. I got the hole plugged but it doesnt mean that there arent other holes. I would check EVERYWHERE before getting settled so that you can get maintenance in to fix stuff. You also cant really open the blinds unless you want people who are walking past Dillion gym looking right into your room

summary: great location with a fire escape
content: This room is solid! My only complaint is that the windows are a bit awkward, so a strange amount of light is present t/o the day. There is only one small window on the south side, and it's in the corner of the room as opposed to in the middle of the wall, so it doesn't provide much light. The west facing window looks out onto the fire escape, and there are 3 panels, but because it's west facing, it only helps to bring in light near the later half of the day. The closet is huge and overall I am pretty happy with it, but those are some of my complaints.
draw_time: Placed in here Spring 2021, so no room draw

summary: Nice size, only annoyance is that it's on the second floor
content: The room is a comfortable size, and though the closet feels narrow it has not been an issue. It can be a bit cold even with the heat turned all the way up, but it's not too bad. The view of Elm is nice. Biggest downside is having to go down two flights of stairs for the bathroom, though this is mostly only a problem late at night/early mornings. I have not noticed many noise issues. Overall, not a bad room if you have to draw into 1915.

summary: small, cozy, good amenities but loud!
content:
Pros: access to a big and clean bathroom with lots of showers, access to a laundry room on the floor, some sunlight in the day but not a whole lot, nice windowsill; only one flight of stairs; you can access the dining hall without leaving the building at all

Cons: doors on this hall are super, super thin, you can hear EVERYTHING, even loud conversations in rooms across the hall; it's pretty small / cozy
draw_time: honestly, I had a pretty good drawtime

summary: tinyyyy but good access to lounges
content: kitchen nearby, laundry room is a bit of a trek, close to a zee group, VERY TINY ROOM, not much sunlight because it's a basement

summary: Cozy Room! A good single in Mathey
content: Room is pretty nice. The ceilings are very tall, and I had mixed feelings about the slanted windows. Very thin walls though, and the sound bleeds through the hall very easily. Getting to the basement is quite inconvenient but there is an elevator on the 2nd floor that helps with this. Being on the 3rd floor is quite annoying due to move-in and the walking but you get used to it.

i did not draw into this room but was reassigned after COVID and kind of lucked out honestly. its a really nice room, the square footage is unbelievably big and everyone gets singles. it did suck to not have a common room but you can definitely make it work. the walls are kind of thin and you can hear everything your roommates are doing and we had a nasty roach problem in the bathroom but i think it was because nobody had lived in it for almost a year before we did. i would recommend if you're okay without a common room!

i had this room as a freshman and lived in the biggest double which probably made the accommodation seem a bit better than it might have objectively been. i liked the common room although there's no space for anything outside of desks and a mini fridge and the smaller doubles can get a bit cramped. the bathroom was decent! you have to clean it yourself though. pulling suitcases up three flights of stairs is NOT IT.

summary: high ceilings, great light, slightly small
content: This is a room with super high ceilings and great light. Three windows look out onto Richardson and Holder for an amazing view! Gender neutral bathroom that locks right next door and very close to the elevator. Would be a little cramped for two people but overall a great room.

summary: Great common room and private bathroom is a plus
content: I lived here during spring 2021 so this is a massive room for one person. The common room is huge and gets awesome sunlight. The bedroom is small so if two ppl are living here you’ll have to bunk the beds. There are three closets so a lot of storage space. The only downside of this room is how thin the walls are. You will be able to hear everything your neighbor says so if you’re a light sleeper, then have your ear plugs ready. Also be prepped to deal with some bugs- like cockroaches and silverfishes.
draw_time: Towards the bottom of independent draw

content: It's on the small side, but I like it because it's easy to keep neat & clean. Right across a female bathroom, near a gender-neutral bathroom. South facing window so it gets great sunlight most of the day. I stacked my bookshelf on the desk for extra space and to fit the Microfridge, so that was nice. Outlets everywhere in the room. Room has adjustable heating, although it takes a few days to get a good feel for it. Window is easy to open. Haven't seen any bugs/pests so far and Witherspoon is just a really nice building (has elevator, kitchen, laundry, 2 study rooms) and everything seems newly renovated so that's nice. I loved my time here!

It might seem like a nice triple with 2 bedrooms and a large common room, but due to its location and how rundown the building is/how unclean it was, during move-in, I had to deal with multiple roaches on the first night and ended up switching to a different room. Try not to live here if you can.

This room was pretty nice. It's very spacious for a single and has a great view of the zodiac heads, Mcarter Theatre, and the graduate tower in the distance. The only downside is you have to use a large communal bathroom, which is technically located in Baker. There is a half bathroom near the room itself, but it's usually busy. Laundry machines are on the same floor which also nice.

This is a very nice and spacious single! It is placed just right in the hallway that it is just a few paces away from the bathrooms, the trash chutes, the laundry room, and the elevator. You can easily fit a minifridge or an extra chair in the room. Also, great views as these windows are not obstructed by buildings and you get a nice view of the street and Whitman. 
The communal bathroom nearby is also really nice and is usually kept very clean.

Really really great single, larger than many doubles. Good location, near the bathrooms and laundry, across from a small study area which would probly be nice if it weren't Covid. Waterbottle/hot water station right outside. Can be loud since lots of people walk past it at night for the bathrooms, water fountain, and to get from the stairs to their rooms (stairs are not so nearby), but overall a great room.

There are no doors anywhere near this room so it is very hard for people who don't live in whitman to find it, but the room itself is really nice. It's right next to the laundry and the water fountain, which is pretty convenient, but very far away from all the stairs, which is not very convenient. But it is large for a single, so no complaints.
draw_time: randomly assigned as we were in a pandemic at the time

summary: I never slept here anyways so...
content: The room is generally ok but definitely not sustainable for 2 people :(.

Huge common room, can easily fit two desks, a couch, etc. The bedrooms aren't big but they easily fit my bed and drawers so I didn't have a problem at all. An underrated room. Also faces Princeton instead of the street so not very loud.

Also not sure what was meant by the rooms being slanted since mine weren't.

summary: The Nest is a fantastic suite for a large group of friends!
content: The common room is massive, two floors, and two bathrooms. Ideal for co-ed suite. Most of the rooms are fairly sized (3 singles, 3 doubles) except for the double on the bottom floor which is the size of a normal single, but has a fire escape. The shower on the bottom floor does not drain that well. Otherwise very spacious, like living in a house with a large family. We kept it tame so there were never any messes to clean up. Not as grand as the zoo, but also not as echo-y or loud. Also pretty view of courtyard.
draw_time: Second highest large draw group (we wanted the zoo)

summary: IMMACULATE as a single, but I don't know about a double...
content:
The only good thing I can say about the University's on-campus COIVD policies is that it definitely benefitted physical living space for a lot of students. I am not quite sure how this room could be a double unless you are reeeaallyy close and reaalllyy comfortable with each other because it doesn't really seem like there's a way to divide the room. 

*However* if they happen to keep with this "each human needs an individual sleeping space" and Dod 303 stays a single I highly suggest it. I was able to make the room feel so homey- using the second desk as my 'kitchen table' and the top bunk of the bunkbeds as 'the loft', decorated the mantel & used built in bookshelf, plenty of room for a rug and folding chair/chaise/bed and storage ottoman for extra seating. We could only have 2 people besides ourselves in the room at a time, but so many friends who I have had over for tea throughout the semester commented on how amazing the room is as a single.  **Key feature** though is definitely the giant bay windows / little semi-circle. It lets in tons of amazing natural light- especially in the morning which is great if you are like me and have a hard time waking up. I moved my desk in there and friends called it my "control room" because it's like a whole set up with a big calendar and books on two of the three window sills, and then left one open to sit in-- my favorite space on campus to read/have isolated meals etc. 

All that ranting to say, in my situation this room was amazing and if you can get it as a single definitely do! If not, it still has all these amazing features (hot water right outside, close bathrooms, elevator, wash, mini kitchen, printer), just make sure you could live well in close quarters with your roommate.
draw_time: **didn't draw into- last minute emergency housing for Jan-Jun '21

content: The room itself is pretty ok, not the most spacious but it does the job. The real reason I don't like it is because of the hall itself. Fisher is literally a hallway where there's pretty much nothing to do. The bathrooms in the third floor, where this room is located, are pretty spacious, but also there are drain flies that are coming out of the pipes in the bathroom, and showers. The walls are thin, and everyone can hear what you're doing in your room from across the hallway. The worst thing however is the fact that there is only one laundry in the first floor with two washers and 4 dryers for the whole of Fisher Hall. That's around 40 people with multiple wash loads who will oftentimes want to do laundry at the same time as you. This is annoying.
draw_time: I was in Emergency Housing during Covid, so I didn't draw this room.

content: definitely smaller than other Whitman singles and a bit of an awkward shape considering the shared bath and furniture layout but the shared bath is a nice plus

summary: Overall good choice. Spacious for down campus
content:
Of the Scully layouts, I prefer this one. 

Upsides:
- Each person in this jack and Jill situation gets their own door, which I find preferable (for privacy reasons) to the little hallway situation others have. 
- The bathroom is really big, and is also in one piece instead of two. 
- Floor is tile so its very easy to clean and doesn't look as roughed up as wood. 
- AC

Downsides: 
- Next to the trash, so if your neighbors don't understand the trash schedule (WHICH IT SEEMS LIKE NOBODY CARES TO LEARN) that'll be the first smell to hit you when you walk out of your room, but it doesn't carry to the inside (thankfully). Scully in general kinda has a smell to it :/ the sacrifices we make for private bathrooms and AC.
- The walls are thin, which is normal butttt this room is close to the stairs, which people stomp up and down like they have no sense. But you get used to it.
- You don't get a ton of natural light due to the direction you face and also the window is kinda close to the adjacent brick wall.

Neutral:
- The wardrobe is kinda bolted to the wall in the hallway so it has to stay there but it leaves more space in your room.

I was lucky and got this room during social distancing, so it was great as a single, but I probably would've hated it as a double. There really isn't enough room for two people. Some features that may be helpful to know - there is carpet and the beds are bunked. There are dressers, cabinets, desks, and bookshelves for two people. It gets buggy in the spring so you can't keep your window open and the room can get a bit stuffy - bring a fan if you can! But, the view of the backyard is nice and there is a fair amount of sunlight.
draw_time: I had an absolutely terrible draw time, was literally second to last

content: A really nice and spacious single! The bathroom's only 1 floor up but it is a bit annoying that the entryway for door one isn't accessible through both sides and you also can't get to the laundry room without going outside because the the bottom floor of entryway 1 doesn't connect. Overall, not bad at all though!
draw_time: Middle of Juniors. Got moved here out of my double because of corona

summary: Very nice as a single, would be small for a double
content: I had this room during COVID-19, which meant capacity was reduced and I had this room as a single. I really loved it, but it would have been really small for two people - there wasn't enough room with all of the furniture to un-bunk the beds. The roof eliminates a lot of space in the room, but the top floor does have access to a regular water fountain and a hot water fountain, and seemed to have less bugs than lower floors. Quite far from the women's bathroom but close to the men's.

summary: Spacious common room and natural lighting
content: Great for 2 people. Def need to bunk for 3 :/ Common room is super spacious and you get a lot of natural lighting in the morning + afternoon. Love this room but the radiator and pipes get super loud every other night.

summary: Bedrooms might be small, overall pretty good
content: I lived in this alone (because covid), so it was quite spacious for me, although with 4 people it seems like the bedrooms might be a little cramped. I recommend bunking the beds. Girls' bathroom is right next door, guys' is around the corner. Window looks out back of whitman towards the zodiac circle and McCarter. Common room decent size.
draw_time: N/A (Spring 2021 - because of pandemic they moved me here from Forbes)

summary: big and spacious room, *really* warm tho
content:
This room is great if you're looking to have a lot of space in a single; it has a nook that fits your bed perfectly so you can use the rest of the floor area to arrange furniture efficiently and all that. Even though it's in the basement, the window gets a fair amount of sunlight, so it's not too dark during the daytime. It's located down the hall from the men's bathroom and two floors below the women's bathroom, so perhaps keep that in mind when selecting.

My one main complaint is that the room is extremely hot, especially compared to other rooms in Pyne—likely because of the exposed water piping that runs along the ceiling of the room. It's fine if you have a fan or prefer the heat, but I pretty much only wore shorts and a T-shirt the whole semester, it was that warm.

Otherwise, it's definitely one of the cozier places I've lived in on campus, and a hidden gem in terms of the space/layout and location.

summary: Covid season, makes for a killer double
content: must be the closest room to dillon gym in all of campus. centrally located and very convenient. it's a great double, possibly a bit cramped for a quad

Amazingly roomy single, pretty sure I wouldn't have gotten this in a normal year but I was assigned it during the pandemic, spring 2021, so I was lucky. Faces Baker Rink, right across the hall from a laundry room and close to a water fountain and bathrooms!

Lived in it as a double during covid (2021) and was sick to each have a bedroom and common room. Only one bedroom can potentially unbunk. Lots of space and privacy, mens bathroom kinda far. good location

Sq footage lists it as way bigger than it actually is. Really loud at night and no AC. Also lots of bugs and gross stuff. Always construction outside and smelled bad. Bathroom and washing machines also in super inconvenient spots. Would not recommend.

summary: amazing room if you are willing to live with the noise
content: this room is BEAUTIFUL! 3 huge windows facing out on to Elm Dr (so lots of natural light in the afternoons / evenings), high ceilings, aesthetic fireplace, and very spacious for a single. easy access to water, printer, laundry, and kitchen with sink / microwave. one (sort of major complaint) however is that Elm is often noisy - construction / leaf blowers / large vehicles early in the morning, and people (especially on nights out) at night. if you don't mind the noise, this room is easily one of the best rooms on campus.
draw_time: n/a; i got assigned to this room during COVID on-campus spring semester

content: Had this COVID semester, so didn't have a problem with the Arch sings, but still lots of noise with people outside at all hours of the day. The room itself is pretty tiny, so forget about having any friends over. Bring a fan for the heat. Close to the bathrooms though.

summary: This room has a great location and is a typical Whitman single
content: I think the best thing about this room besides it being a single is the location. The window looks out onto the Whitman Upper Courtyard from the ground flood. You can watch everyone sled down the hill during the winter. It is also located just a minute or two from the dining hall. It's very easy to get there without going outside when it is raining or snowing. The right window does not currently open, but I imagine you can get it to with a pair of pliers. Parts of the floor are damaged, but I don't imagine that bothers many people. There is a door on the left (looking at the window from the hallway) wall of the room. I don't know what its purpose is, and currently it is locked.
draw_time: It was automatically assigned when people came back to campus in January

content:
This room is on the larger end for upperclass singles, and there was plenty of room for me to feel comfortable in. The hardwood floors are clearly scratched and scruffed from years of use, but it didn't bother me much; if it bothers you, a decent-sized rug should cover most of the floor. The radiator is a godsend when it gets cold in the winter but a nuisance when the weather warms up, at which point you'll either need to crack open a window or use a box fan. The room surprisingly has very few bugs, most of which are very small, and no cockroaches at all, even though they are known to live in 1903. There is a decent amount of noise from outside besides noise from the nearby entryway (but a loud enough fan will drown out all noise). 

1903 is about as centrally-located as you can get on campus, and this room is well-located within 1903: it's right near an entryway right below both a men's and women's bathroom, and about as close to Frist as you can get in upperclass housing. The courtyard is a great place to hang out in 1903 during the warmer months if you have friends living in the same dorm. Laundry is only accessible from outside on the other end of the building, but unless the weather is awful it's a bearable walk. 

Overall, if you're willing to trade AC and quiet for room size and location, this room is a good fit.

Some extra notes:
- There is a water stain on the floor on one end of the room from what appears to have been a leak from the bathroom above and a burn mark on the floor near the radiator. Take this as a hint about what to look out for.

- Eating clubs were closed this semester, but expect to hear a lot of noise on the weekends, especially since you live right next to one of the main routes to the Street.
draw_time: I was assigned here by housing. Room likely gets taken on the first day of draw.

content: Sure, the windows are huge, lots of natural light which is great. The common room is also huge, like so huge it can be a bit daunting. Both are great, but the rest of the room is honestly lacking. Almost every floorboard creaks, there are a few prominent spots where the wooden floor is literally rotten, the bathroom is tiny (and for some reason they neglected to even put a mirror in the room, so if you wanna check your hair in the morning you better shell out some $$ to buy yourself a mirror), the walls are thin so you can hear just about anything coming from the neighboring rooms, and the place was dirty to no end. One of the desks had this large sticky stain on it that I couldn't even get off with bleach cleaners, the stain is still there by the way. So yeah, got some pros I guess, but in all honesty, this room kinda sucked, was mad disappointed.

I had it as a double due to covid rules and it was lovely. The bedrooms are small which would make it more challenging in a regular year but plenty of space in the common room, bathroom is right there, and good location near the U store and Nassau.

Pretty good-size single with good floor space, sloped ceiling section isn't too bad if you put the bed under it. Room enough for a couch. The closet has a roof? which is odd but adds some nice storage space. Can't speak to how quiet/loud it'd be in a normal year (lived here in 2021)

lived here spring 2021 alone and it was great, super spacious for one person. that being said, for two people, i imagine it would be kind of a squeeze. also the view is great but the windows started at about my chest height, so just be aware of that.

I lived here in 2020-2021. Because of the pandemic, I ended up being the only one in the whole quad. Even if I hadn't had 3 rooms to myself, it would have been plenty of space. The doubles are reasonably sized, and the common room is gigantic. 

There's six total windows in the suite, including a giant bay window overlooking the 1938 courtyard. You enter on the first floor, but because Clapp is on a hill, your windows look out from the second floor. This means that there are very few bugs (at least in my experience).

The temperature control is also pretty great. If it got too warm inside, opening a window was usually sufficient to cool the suite down. I didn't need a fan.

Other bonuses: totally carpeted (except for the private bathroom), laundry room one floor down, really close to a road for easy move-in/out.
draw_time: Middling (originally got the room 2 floors directly above)

content: I'm a guy, so the nearest bathroom was a couple of floors up (the half staircases are weird, but about 3 floors up). This comes along with the fact that the radiators were making such awful noises when I first moved in that they just turned the heat off in my part of the building and gave me a space heater for the semester. The room is huge, and has big windows, but because of the placement it doesn't get a lot of light.

summary: avoid as a triple, but ideal for smaller groups!
content: I had the blessing of having this room as a single during COVID, and it was perfect for the location (central campus, near Frist and WuCox, first floor so barely any stairs from the entrance but still an elevated window due to the basement). The common room is huge and the private bathroom is pretty great as well! However, the bedroom is extremely inconvenient for three people. The bedroom can comfortably fit two beds, so if you are able to snag this room as a double, definitely go for it.
draw_time: did not apply - was placed here in spring 2021 (COVID)

content: Absolutely huge single, right across the way from the sink/microwave, women's bathroom about 10ft away, near three different building exits, two big windows, cool brick facade on one side that gives the room some character. I was assigned this room during the COVID-19 semester (did not draw it), and couldn't have been happier. Maybe would be 4 stars if you were a guy because the bathroom is a little bit further, although it's still less than a 1 minute walk away.

Since my roommate and I had this room for COVID semester, it was just us two in a quad.  This makes it hard to judge the room for when there are four occupants, but the room is nonetheless massive (whenever people entered our room for the first time, we would always hear how awesome the room is).

The common room kind of feels like an attic because of the slanted ceiling, but that is not much of a big deal when you have so much space anyways.  The balcony overseeing Nassau Street is a huge plus as well.

Both bathrooms are right outside the door, making your life that much easier.

If you are sold on Holder and you want a quad, I don't see many rooms topping this one.

This room will probably last midway through room draw, but it is a sexy sleeper pick.

I loved this room! It is really big for one person, with two closets and a small hallway space, and the bathroom is also super close by. The only downsides are that laundry is in the basement (but that really isn't too bad), some of the spaces of the room are a bit unusual, it tends to get really hot in the room (so bring a fan), and the room can get a bit loud at times with traffic on university place.

summary: About as good as you can get in the Annex(?)
content: Super spacious single with a great view of the golf course. The heater was broken (very noisily so!) when I lived there, though, so in addition to having no AC, the room could be very, very cold in the winter. However, it's right across from the women's restroom, and its proximity to the staircase makes it relatively easy to get in and out / down to the laundry room in the basement. Also very close to the Dinky / the Wa, and it's also possible to get to the dhall from this room without going outside.

summary: Lots of space but the walls are thin
content: Being in the corner means you have fewer neighbours zoom calling at 1am, but you're right next to a busy road so you get car noises instead.

Very nice room- cozy might be the best description. You really can't beat the central campus location, and the building itself is distinguished and pretty. It's not super large, but if you put the dresser in the closet, you will buy yourself a good bit of extra room. Helps to make use of under-bed space and shelf in closet.  Entryway is nice for leaving winter boots, etc. Cute nook beside chimney for a coffee area/mini fridge. Lovely view of Prospect Garden. VERY high ceilings. Only slightly bigger con was that radiator pipes can make a good bit of noise. Overall, a sweet place to come home to.
draw_time: Didn't draw for the room- was put there for Spring Semester of the Pandemic

content: This room is huge but prepare yourself for a HUGE roach infestation. I put up a good fight but ended up sleeping in a friends room because it got so bad. The room itself isn’t bad tho if you don’t mind your roach buddies: the common room is huge, the bedroom is a little small but not bad, the bathroom is small too.
This room is tiny plus a slated roof makes it seem even smaller. but it’s surprisingly cozy. you can fit maybe 3 people awkwardly. works if you realllyyyy want a single.
draw_time: pretty bad at the bottom of rocky

summary: Large room (so good), bad blinds, room flooded LOL
content: Soo freaking big could definitely fit a couch plus something else in here if you want. The blinds do not shade out the sun really well because the windows are HUGE. The view is okay, you get the very side view of the golf course, at least there's not a lot of outside traffice so you don't have to worry about anyone seeing you that often (except for the occasional golfers).  It's at the very end of the annex so kinda far from dhall but good thing is its usually pretty quiet... can hear everything and everyone when you're in the hallway though lmao. Overall, would reccommend, having a large single could be fun for large groups of friends to come over once covid is over (if anyone even wants to come to forbes lol)

It's close to the bathroom, close to the elevator, a floor up from the kitchen, laundry is not too far. It's pretty good for your average room/location. However, there are so. many. bugs - spiders (not too bad or big) and centipedes (3-4 in. long). I suggest moving your bed away from the radiator and the walls so centipedes don't fall on it while you're sleeping.

summary: 9/10 - you learn a lot about bugs
content: Despite the bug problems, and I mean silverfish, roaches, flying-ants, and sometimes even wasps during the summer, this room is solid. It's one of the larger rooms in Forbes and probably has one of the best views in the college. It's on the first floor and has a "George Bush for President" sticker so people walking by the window will occasionally stop for five minutes and take pictures, oblivious to you sitting there right in front of the window. I had no problems with the heater or anything like that (it doesn't make any noise). If I had a choice to pick this room in retrospect, I 100% would.

summary: Too Small for a Double; No Heating; Lots of Noise -> SKIP
content:
Cons:

- heater is busted and not able to be manually controlled. The window is also busted and drafty. You will get cold in the winter if you don't somehow engineer a way to control the heating. The heater is also in an odd position, so you can't put a desk in front of the window.

- You are right next to the side exit to Forbes, and people are coming in and out all hours of the night, so make sure to bring earplugs; otherwise, you won't sleep. Lot of hallway noise since everyone is coming to get meals through this main hallway.

- It is entirely too small to be a double. You will essentially have to bunk and fit your dressers in the closets. I had it during the COVID-semester as a single thankfully.

Pros:
- Walls are thick, so you can really blast your music. 
- Great view of the grad college, but people cannot see inside your room. 

More on the heating: basically, the heater comes on whenever the average temperature of a couple of the rooms nearby (not the attached room) dips below a temperature. This is measured by the sensor on the wall next to the bathroom door (which can hypothetically be spoofed with an icepack). Since individually heating your room would affect other rooms, housing won't give you a heater. Good luck!

Private bathroom was quite spacious, and view of the flowering tree in the springtime was nice. Really close to exit 7 so I used that entrance a lot. Had this room as a single bc covid semester but overall think that there will be a lot of room in the middle if desks and bed are put along the walls

Honestly a solid room to be in, though my only complain is that there was incessant pipe banging noises in the walls for the winter months and it was super annoying. Also some bugs but which building doesn’t? The common room is humongous and there’s a nice window alcove that’s aesthetic, and the bedrooms are smaller than the other singles in the hall but it’s never been a big issue.

Relatively spacious, can easily fit a mini fridge and more. Couches or TVs would be a little stretch. Sound passes through the doors weirdly easily but not walls so thats good. Bathroom one floor down only has one stall and shower but two sinks. Bathrooms two flights up offer more. Nothing real bad to say other than that ppl walking by or large vehicles driving on the road can be rather loud (esp at night)

Trucks were noisy in the early hours of the day, heating didn't really work but it was always comfortable-ish so it did not really matter. Some days in May were really hot though. There were 2-3 bugs during the end of spring (which is not that much in comparison to the other res colleges)
draw_time: I didn't have a draw time.

summary: Perfect view, super convenient access to facilities, spacious
content: I really loved this room! I got a sunrise every morning, and it's great for growing plants. During the snow, the view is esp stunning (deer & foxes prancing, no ppl). I moved my furniture so that my desk was a little cubicle & faced the large window. I was right across from the girls bathroom (so as a girl, this was VERY convenient for never having to walk down a hall after a shower). We're close to the laundry room, and the bathroom was cleaned every day by the nice custodians (covid precautions might have increased the cleanliness?). The communal bathroom shower did flood 2x, but no big deal tbh. The room is very spacious for one person, imo; lots of room to stretch and lie on the floor during existential crises. There is no way for you to control AC/heating (which made loud noises about once every 1-2 hours but you tune it out eventually), so I kept my window open almost all the time to let cool air in & maintain a good temp (but no one walks by here except squirrels so there's sufficient privacy!)

***First read the review from March 19, 2015. That one has a lot of information that I would agree with and they don't miss much.***

I lived in this room during COVID so some things about this room (like partying or PSAFE presence) I wouldn't know but I'll comment on a few things...

-The room definitely gets drafty in the winter but that can be fixed with the heating and it never really gets too hot
-Bugs/ants will be a HUGE problem if you are sloppy with food and don't do some sort of cleaning regularly (we learned this on the fly)
-No chance at debunking unless you want to move all the closets out of the doubles
-Bathroom right next to the room for guys was absolutely huge, print/study room right down the hall was equally good
-There are stained glass parts of the windows which aren't covered by shades so sometimes random light coming in can become annoying if you're trying to use a projector or something
-People and tourists like to look into the windows from the outside so just be ready for that 
-Dumpster right next to the sleeping rooms was very loud at around 8:30 in the morning, enough to wake you up and keep you up
-The walk to the dhall was not bad at all even though Spoon is probably the farthest Rocky dorm from it
draw_time: Pretty good (close to top of list)

content: the roof is really high so it seems larger than it really is. this will make you feel really free and comfortable. the common room is really big, and there is a lot of open space. the bedrooms itself are also spacious. the bathroom is right outside too, and because there's an elevator, third floor really doesn't matter. the only issue might be doing laundry, but the room itself is so great that you won't really mind. also, blair arch means that its easily found, beautiful, and near the dining halls!

This is a fairly decent quad. I had a suitemate during Covid times so we didn't get the full experience, but we never felt too crowded. One room is a little larger than the other, but if you move desks to the common room you can probably debunk both beds. Next to the men's bathroom, so if you're using that it's pretty convenient. If not, maybe reconsider.

summary: Great room, ladybug problem in the spring
content:
Pretty good room. The bedrooms are kinda small, about my wingspan across (5'8" male). It's really close to the bathroom and laundry is only two flights of stairs down. I was in this room Spring 2021 [Covid Spring], so it was essentially a double, and it was plenty of space. 

There was a weird problem with ladybugs collecting near the main window in the common space, and we often had to sweep them up. Wasn't terrible, but there were a LOT of them. Overall, great room.
Spacious

lucked out and got randomly assigned this room and let me tell you...there is nothing better. so big, the layout is really spacious and unique, the desk can go against the window, gigantic closet, and 5 WINDOWS. like a whole wall of windows. and to make things even better, it's literally steps away from the bathroom and cold water tap. i'm so sad to leave you walker 324 :(
draw_time: I think it's a sophomore room normally

summary: Room is good, Fisher is eh
content: The room was good, you get really good light in the morning and pretty much throughout the day which is very nice honestly. The size was pretty good. There are definitely bigger rooms in Fisher but this wasn't too bad. However, the room feels smaller because of the slated ceiling which isn't the best. Other than that, I really liked this room. However, Fisher is not the best. The laundry room is lowkey a trek because it's on the first floor and there are only 2 washers for the entire hall so the washers are almost always full. On the other hand, the bathrooms on the 3rd floor are really nice and really big, space-wise they had 3 showers and 3 toilets so it was okay.
draw_time: I was assigned during Emergency Housing

content: Is it the smallest quad in Whitman? Pretty close. Did one of my roommates move out early in the fall semester leaving it as a triple? You bet. Was this room the greatest room I've ever had? 100%. B320 is a legendary experience--the correct mirror set-up lets you see everything all at once. You should probably pick literally any other quad in Whitman above this one, but if you're stuck with B320, you've still won.

summary: Better than a main building double...
content:
...at the cost of being in the annex. Actually amazing room for two people, the layout is perfect if you like your roommate and the common room is huge. Obviously, its the forbes annex, so you probably won't be hosting a ton of people, but this is seriously a great room. If you're between this room and a small double in the main building, this one is worth the extra minute of walking.
Cons are the same as any annex room. Sometimes you can hear noise from the bathroom in the bedroom but it isn't frequent or overwhelming. If you want a room to yourself, this is not the room for you. Beds in the smaller room and big room as a common room is the best layout by far.
draw_time: 1/2 of the way down i think

content: The nest was a pretty sweet room, especially because we were living there in COVID times so there were only 5 people instead of 9. The two doubles on the top floor are huge and two of the singles are well-sized, but the bottom floor double is small and echoes everything from the common room as if it was in the room, so not good for a person who goes to bed early. We had infestations of ants, centipedes, and a few roaches. Buying ant traps is a must. Don't know who will read this review since the building is being knocked down, but overall a great room, wish we could have lived there for a whole year!
draw_time: We were the 3rd large draw group, miraculously somehow got the nest

content: I got placed here during Covid and it functioned as a double. It worked really well as a double. I don't expect it would work as well as a quad during normal times; it felt like the two of us fully occupied the space and it was hard to imagine two more people living there as well.

This room was so small, I felt very cramped. It over looks the courtyard, but that is really loud at almost all times (when not the winter). The walls in this building are really thin and I could hear everything my 2 neighbors and upstairs neighbor said and did. The doors in this building slam really loud every time. I got assigned this room during the spring semester of the year of covid (2020-2021)... so I spent all my time in here. Not too many bugs, but I killed 3 house centipedes. But seriously, this room is really small but it did function as a single ig.

Don't be fooled by the size of the room - it's super hard to manage with five roommates. We expected the common room to be great, but it came to very little use. Room was often buggy, stuffy, etc. I wouldn't do it again tbh...
Very hard to use this space for 5 people. Common room was meh, but incredibly cramped. Shockingly, there were a lot of bugs.

summary: Spacious Room with a Great View of Golf Course
content: This is a really great room! It has plenty of space for a single and I arranged my furniture to be close to the walls of my room in order to maximize the space (but honestly, with any arrangement it still wouldn't feel cramped). The kitchen is just two door down and the girls and boys bathrooms are both about two/three doors down which was super super nice. The laundry room is also very close (directly below) which made doing laundry way more convenient. Concerning bugs, I only saw a few every now and then (thankfully no cockroaches tho!!) but it was definitely not a big problem. Also very few bugs in the girls bathroom (little gnats but no cockroaches!!), though I must say that the bathroom did flood twice but hopefully that's fixed now haha. Overall, this was a great room to get freshmen year and I would definitely recommend!!

I saw 30+ spiders during my time here. On my bed, on my desk, in my laundry pile, on the roof, on the walls, and even on my face on occasion. I also had hundreds of ants.

Pros: volleyball court, laundry room, printer, kitchen, and women's bathroom are VERY close. i also had great neighbors.
Cons: men's bathroom was permanently filthy, the insects were filthy
draw_time: I was forced out of my beautiful Blair quad into this room because of COVID

content: Is it the largest room? No. Is there a good view? Definitely no. Was it a great room? Yes.

Lived here for the spring of 2021. It's a great arrangement, especially if you know the other two folks living in your suite. The light is good and the view is nice, I was able to maintain a large plant with no issues. The bookshelf in the room is missing a peg so you'll have to jerry-rig your own solution to keep the shelf in place. Came with two dressers for whatever reason as well. I put one under the bed. It's very small, and you don't have much room but an area rug + posters does wonders for the space. The window sucks (they all do in Forbes) and I couldn't really see out half of it, plus the window has a really hard time opening/staying reliably shut. I shut it when I moved in and never opened it again. I've seen a few cockroaches/ants/spiders but nothing major. Cinder blocks. Biggest downside was the first floor - you get landscaping crews at 7AM most Saturdays mowing and running a weed wacker across the wall, plus the lawn outside your window is a really popular spot for loud 2AM parties on weeknights (during finals, no less). Overall could be a lot worse, if you have a good draw time and missed out on the main inn singles I'd pick it up, especially with two friends next door. Shared (between you and 1-2 other people) bathroom in college is a lifesaver, get one at all costs.
draw_time: 1-2 slots behind the main inn singles, so very early

content: The Fridge was a great room. If you can, get the fridge
